text: This review is long overdue....I had heard so many great things about this place and was terribly disappointed. I came twice just to make sure it wasn't just a bad taste in my mouth (not a cheap place either) and both times were mediocre at best. Food...ok. For the price it was not worth it. Service....ok. We had a large party of about 16 and one server......step ur game up! It took forever to get drinks, if you're trying to make money the point is to serve your customers. Not keep them waiting and asking other servers who pass by to find you. It seems so many of these uppity restaurants where you will automatically get grated, they lack in so many areas. They are lucky that there is gratuity tacked on because for the experience in its entirety it was not worth.

We arrived for Brunch at noon and were promptly seated. had to wait a little for the server to show up, but he was gracious and personable. We ordered Mimosas and he immediately said that we would have to wait as alcohol couldn't be served on Sunday until after 12 Noon. I checked my watch and pointed out that it was in fact after 12. He apologized and said he would place the order immediately. he came back a few minutes later and said he was sorry but the bar was out of champagne and could not make the Mimosa right then. He offered (or tried to upsell) but we said we would wait for the bar to get their act together. As it ended up, we probably would have been better off buying a bottle of Champagne and making our own- good OJ but VERY light on the bubbly. Maybe the food would be better.  He did offer good insight into the menu. We both ended up choosing the Shrimp and Polenta which was absolutely fantastic! Shrimp were juicy and flavorful, polenta creamy and delicious, the sauce was nuanced and perfectly complimented all the other parts, even had a little heat. Just wonderful!  Unfortunately, our server got over-seated with a larger party and that was pretty much the last we saw of him. We (and other tables near us) had to wait several minutes to get our check, and then of course get it processed and returned.  All in all, it would have been 2 star, but the food saved the day.

My best friend introduced me to this great bar. It has an amazing atmosphere and decor. I liked that is wasn't packed to the point where you feel you can't move but still enough eye candy to go around. I'll definitely be back and will highly recommend to my Lyft customers too.

Been here a few different times and each visit I get a different/weird experience.  It's either great service with a well-informed knowledgeable server or a complete train wreck that results in something being offered for free. I feel like this place is so close to being a great part of Charlotte and a unique restaurant that everyone can be proud of...but it's not there yet.

Went for lunch. Pretty hip place. Not the best service, but the decor is interesting and the presentation was right on. I tried the lamb burger. It tasted 100% lamb. I usually prefer some sausage in the grind to cut the gamey taste, but it was cooked well nonetheless. Can't wait to go back in the evening and sample the cocktails. There are table seats and then there's an L-shaped bar area that looks like it would be cool for after dinner. I shalst see....

Three other work colleagues and myself visited this restaurant in October 2012.  It's in a great Uptown location, and when I initially made a reservation, I thought the menu items would appeal to both my vegetarian and meat-eating colleagues.  We waited 20 minutes at our table before the server noticed us.  We had to go to the manager and actually ask him if we had a server.  Service was very very slow.  The food was ok....but we were STARVING.  After a long day working with no food, we were ready to roll up our sleeves, raid the kitchen and throw something on the grill.  It took over an hour from when we sat down to actually get our food.  The manager did end up comping desert, and it would not have been a big deal if I were enjoying a casual night out with friends.  But, the state of my stomach demanded food pretty immediately, and 5 Church did not live up to that expectation at all.  I dont think I would go back again....

We had a reservation at 12:15pm for brunch and received a phone call at 12:10pm letting us know that our reservation was being cancelled and the restaurant was no longer serving brunch.  This was after we received a call an hour and a half earlier confirming our reservation for that day.  The person who called us offered no explanation, had no remorse, and to be honest, was very rude.  We had been there for drinks before, but never to eat.  After that terrible customer service experience, we will NOT be going back - - for anything!  Where has customer service gone these days?!  Very disappointed 5 Church, very disappointed!

Service was slow and poor. Meal for seven of us was served in two stages because they said it took more time to cook the steaks. No bread until we asked. No salt and pepper until we asked. Two had fettuccine which by the time we got it was inedible because it was over cooked and was gummy. No parmesan cheese either. Had one taken off the bill which they did not complain about but also never saw waiter after meal was served until we asked for the check. Very pricy for average food. Last time I will take anyone there.

Aweful!  We had a reservation at Capital Grille however concierge service at Ritz Carlton suggested we change to Five Church.  The staff is very pleasant. The ambiance is average.  The food is less then average and bland.  The menu is limited.  It was very disappointing.

5Church was satiating in many ways: cuisine, atmosphere, service, diversity.    The cuisine was delicious: black bean hummus, quinoa, fried beet sliders, flatbread (and those are just the appetizers, or "Snacks" as 5Church refers to these options), caramel nut pie for dessert (with a sweet potato base -- pure genius) -- was also salivating over the description of the s'mores and the double chocolate cake, so will have to go back to sample those sweet treats.  Several entrees looked fantastic -- the ingredients and accompanying sides seemed perfectly chosen: wasabi crusted salmon, for example.  The atmosphere was intimate, interesting, and entertaining.  The space is well laid out -- plenty of room between tables so even though it's a very open area, the time with my friend felt private and cozy.  The furniture is funky and comfortable; the lighting is unique and just right -- not too bright, not too dim; even the bathroom faucets were fun.  There was a positive vibe in the restaurant -- a consistent buzz of folks coming and going, pleasant conversations, lots of laughter.  The folks who work at 5Church seem to sincerely enjoy interacting with each other and with the patrons -- when servers, hosts, managers, owners, bartenders, and chefs are walking around chatting amongst the crowd, the dining experience feels more like a community party.  Though it was the first time that my friend and I had visited the restaurant, we were treated like "regulars" and attended to like we were long-time pals.  It's amazing the difference it makes when the people who work at a restaurant balance the need to be efficient with the ability to be fun and interesting.  The diversity in 5Church also enhanced the overall experience -- from the artwork on the walls and ceiling, to the patrons representing a mix of demographics, to the creative menu, it was an incredibly fulfilling time.  I'm looking forward to brunching at 5Church on a Saturday morning, rocking out to a DJ on a Friday night, grabbing a mid-week lunch with a colleague, and taking friends there when they visit the QC.
A little loud, but the food is always great. The black bean hummus and bacon pizza are amazing. They also have really good cocktails if you want to do happy hour.

Incredible food.  Great trendy interior.   Had waygu steak, can't go wrong tender and delicious.  Prime beef bolognase was delicious but really really rich and heavy so if your looking for something light this isn't it.  Crispy pork belly and pork belly spring rolls were amazing.  Most favorite was the broiled oysters, very different but was fantastic, made like Rockefeller but with grits and quail egg.  It was fantastic could have ordered several dozen more !    Only complaint it's loud, hard to carry on a conversation.

Do not come here for lunch unless you have a 3 hour window.  We Arrived at 12:05 for lunch. Should've realized something was wrong as all other restaurants in the area were full and this one was half empty. Over an hour later by 1:20 we left because our food had still not arrived.  Our  waitress was not attentive at all. We could barely get her to  come to our table. She was definitely not too concerned about the fact that we were waiting for our food for over an hour. She never even offered us refills on our drinks while we were sitting there waiting for our food for over an hour!  Everytime we asked her about our meal she told us their kitchen was backed up. The excuse was hard to believe because the place was half empty.    We were not the only customers that left hungry and disappointed  as I noticed other tables of people getting up and leaving before their food arrived.   We ended up getting fast food sandwiches down the street to take back to our office as we had burned way past our lunch hour.  Total disaster!

We had a fabulous dinner.  We sat at the bar as the tables were full.  We were greeted by Karma & Drew aka fab bartenders who were on it! Karma offered a taste of a new wine I had never considered.... a French choice & Drew made great suggestions from the menu.  My crispy chicken was divine! My husband loved his Deckle steak .  Tonight was amazing.  We will definitely return and prob sit at the bar:).
Good food, albeit somewhat limited menu. Very attentive and friendly service. Pleasant atmosphere. Not highest rating b/c weak wine list & extremely miss-priced (overpriced) champaign list.

Haven't been for dinner but went in with my buddy for drinks.  decor is different but I think I liked it...  Drinks were awesome.  Will have to come back for food.  bartender was cool, left us alone but was around when we needed him.  We were def not in the hipster crowd like everyone else there

Excellent food and service. I got the scallops and they were the best I have ever had. My date had the wasabi crusted salmon and he thoroughly enjoyed it. Waiter was especially knowledgeable about the wine selection and suggested the perfect pairing to our meal. Took off a point because they seated me with my back to the kitchen and something my thumping against my back the entire meal and my seat was shaking as well. Rather distracting and annoying when you're trying to enjoy a romantic meal out. So tip: make sure you don't get seated on the upper level right by the staff entrance to the kitchen or whatever that room is.

I come to Charlotte frequently for work but tried this place out for brunch on a rare occasion when visiting during the weekend. Apparently this place is mostly a dinner/bar scene.  We were in a large group and were overall quite happy across the vectors of food, service and ambiance.   The modern/eclectic decor seems a little out of place down south (chalk it up to northern banking industry transplants) but still warm and inviting. I can see Charlotte still hasn't fully made the transition to a residential downtown (people living/working in same area), so I'd expect more places like this to start popping up - which is a good thing.  Food is fantastic and the portion size is HUGE, ie no one came close to finishing. The lamb burger in particular seemed to be a real hit.  Service was solid and managed the group at an off peak hour expertly.   I was dismayed to learn they don't serve breakfast weekday (when I usually visit), but I'd definitely come back when in town.

Good food overshadowed by all around bad service.  We made reservations for a large party (about 10 people) many weeks in advance. We all showed up on time but still had to wait 20 minutes for our table. The bartenders were rude. We had arranged for a semi-private, quieter area but somehow got seated smack in the middle of the bar.  It was possibly the WORST table in the restaurant, especially for a large group. It took over 2hours to get our food, which was cold when it arrived.  By this time, the 11:00 crowd had literally descended on our table.  People were jamming into us and setting drinks and beer bottles on our table as we ate.   Literally one of the worst dining experiences ever...

We've been to 5Church 3 times now....Favorite dishes are the signature 60 second steak (cooked for more than 60 seconds on one side until well and barely hits the grill on the other, so very rare...They say the chef auditioned with this one...I see how he got the job.  My other favorite is the Wasabi crusted Salmon...I am not much of a salmon fan - but this will keep me coming back for more.  The wait staff is always very helpful and the atmosphere is very much funky fun in Uptown.  If someone is visiting and wants a great vibe for Charlotte - this is the palce to go - or to bring them....

Went in for Saturday brunch, we thought it would be busy but wasn't. Our waiter was awesome! Our food didn't take long to come but we were very disappointed in the waffles they were over cooked. The rest of the food was good but needed a waffle to make it a heartier meal. The best part of brunch were the 2.50 mimosas and Sangrias!!!! What a deal!!! This was awesome! We thought they had bottomless but didn't but this was about the same in my opinion. The banana bread is also Very good as well. If I'm I'm in Charlotte again I would def come back for the drinks!

My 2 stars comes from my handful of times here. I've been at happy hour and the bar service was lacking. I came for lunch and the chicken cordon bleau was out of this world! This in itself gained them a star. My wife and I went for dinner on a weekend night and our food took forever, and when my wife got her steak, it was so dry. The manager came by and said they had another one cooking that could come out in 10 minutes. That was after the first one too some 40 minutes to come out. The replacement was better. Paid full price even though the steak was inedible.   Came back for brunch that same Sunday, and our food took forever...again. We thought it might've taken so long the other night because they were busy, but this was a much slower time. When my omelet came out, it wasn't even what I had ordered. Again, paid full price and no attempt or pressure to provide good customer service.   We may be back, but this will no longer be a destination spot for us going forward.

The Bottom Line: Fantastic starters but it's downhill from there.  This is such a frustrating review to write. On first impression 5 Church sets you up for a 5 star evening but it quickly runs out of steam. Entrees are good and desserts are disappointing.  They seem to be aimed at the young crow who is happy to congregate 5-deep at the bar and order bar snacks which are actually really good.  They have the potentials to do so much better.
God awful service. Worst dining experience I've had in Charlotte and I've lived here for 15 years. No apologies for forgetting our food and drink. Very snooty atmosphere.

Very just OK.  Went for restaurant week, but on a Sunday so it was not very busy.  The hostess could not have been more annoyed that we arrived and asked for our table.  The waiter was not great.  And the food was very ehhhh.  The plastic chairs were also pretty uncomfortable.  All in all, I wouldn't go back unless I was going somewhere with a friend who was choosing it for their birthday dinner and I couldn't override their pick.

Went to 5Church for post-work happy hour drinks, and although I was expecting it to be crowded and noisy, we actually questioned whether they were even open as we walked in.  Grabbing a seat at the completely empty bar, we found menus and starting perusing the drinks.  The drinks were good (5Church - yum!), but service suffered.  Feeling a bit snacky, I ordered the chickpea salad, but was brought the black bean hummus.  I called the bartender over to confirm if this was my order and she said "oh, I must have keyed it in wrong," took it away, and brought me my order about 5 minutes later.  Shoulda kept he hummus, because the chickpea salad wasn't anything to write home about.  When the checks arrived, I had been charged for the hummus, which cost $1 more.  I spent about 5 minutes trying to fly down the bartender again (keep in mind, it's still emmmmmpty at this point), and when I pointed out the mistake, I was told "well, they're they same price."  After informing her that in fact they weren't, she finally changed my check, but did so begrudgingly.    All in all, 5Church is an interesting space, but seems to think it's better than it actually is.  We'll see if it sticks around longer than other establishments that have preceded that space.

I've been to 5Church both as a bar and for dinner. It is a really fun addition to uptown. Very cool decor and atmosphere. When I went as a bar the first time this summer, it was the weekend and pretty crowded. When I went more recently, it was a Thursday night and not very crowded. Some of the bar managers were sitting at the bar and treated me and my girlfriends to our first round of beers. It was a pretty fun time. I decided to go there for my birthday dinner with my parents and sister, and it definitely didn't feel like the appropriate place to dine with my parents. It was pretty loud in there and just a bit too trendy for a family dinner. However, the food was really good. My sister ordered the lamb burger and said it was delicious. My dad and I both ordered the chicken with sweet potato mash, and it was delicious. My parents both ordered the bibb lettuce salad to start. I tried some and must say it was really good but doused in dressing. I couldn't eat part of it. Overall, would definitely recommend for a weekend night out or dinner with friends or a date.

Driving down south on a road trip from NYC and spent the day in Charlotte, NC.  I had a list of burgers to try in every state along the trip, but never heard of '5 Church'.  A bartender recommended '5 Church' saying the food was amazing, and they have a great burger too.  So, rather than take her word on it, I double checked some reviews/pics of the food on here and decided to try it...  HOLY SHIT that was some great food!  Coming from NYC, I didn't expect this, but I was blown away.  The restaurant is beautiful, and everything I ate was great... especially the burger!  I know it's a "lamb burger", and as a burger purest, but lamb is still considered red meat, so it's a legit burger (unlike those BS chicken, turkey, veggie, etc... fake burgers).  Even their crispy confit potato "fries" were amazing.  Here I am back in NY, wishing I had '5 Church' a lot closer than 650 miles...

VisitedCharlotte and stopped here for brunch. Was impressed that mimosas were $3! Thought the devote was beautiful in the restaurant.  The food was good.  I had the ham and egg madam sandwich, it was good. My husband got the lamb burger, he liked it.  Overall it was a good restaurant.

I would like to start this letting everyone know that I have been in the restaurant business for a very long time and I am not writing this blindly.   My husband and I were celebrating our first thanksgiving without family and decided to volunteer in the morning and then go to a nice dinner - we made reservations at 5church because we heard it was amazing. We went and it was terrible. Service was awful, the restaurant smelt like dirty laundry and the food left a lot to desire. Very disappointing - we were hoping for a wonderful experience and it didn't happen.

Don't really have anything negative with this place except I wish we would've sat at a real table instead of the couch seating area by the door...that would've been fine if we were just having drinks and apps but not a full meal. I was cold most of the time, I hate eating when I'm cold.  My friend and I spilt the pan roasted mahi-mahi and the wasabi crusted salmon, neither of us could make up our minds. Both were delicious, and the best part is the chef spilt them before they were brought to the table, very helpful. Also enjoyed the appetizers we shared, the bacon pizza was the favorite...I mean it's bacon, how can you go wrong with bacon!! Chose the house Malbec, thought it was much better than Soul Gastrolounge.   Some other choices that night were the lamb burger and the grilled yellow fin  tuna, everyone seemed to enjoy their selections. Good vibe there, place was packed for a Wednesday evening.   Spent a little more than I had intended, feel it's a bit pricy, but it is an uptown restaurant and great tasting food.

I want to start out with the upsides of this restaurant. It's beautiful, seriously, the set up is open and inviting. The presentation of the food is equally as appealing.   The downsides however, were where it counts for me. The service was not all that personable. We were met with lack luster, and even at times sarcastic employees (at least is my groups opinion). It was bumpy to start out with, considering it wasn't that busy and we weren't being overly rowdy or loud. The waiter treated us as if we were a burden, and it was really disappointing.   The food itself was okay. It took a long time to receive it, and wasn't that special. I had the lamb burger with fries which were too salty, the burger bun was slightly soggy, the meat however was pretty yummy. My friend got pasta, which was large, but she said it was bland. We also got lettuce wraps, which were forgettable.   I'm confused, maybe we came on an off day, if we decide to return it will be awhile. There are better options in this neighborhood in my opinion, I at least want to go somewhere that makes me feel welcomed.

The entire text from the Sun Tzu book The Art of War is transcribed on the ceiling! This is truly unique and worth going in to see.  Story is it took the artist and his wife (who read while he wrote) about six months to create the massive piece of art.   Good atmosphere, nice art on walls and subtle jazz at the right level to compliment. The wasabi encrusted yellow fin tuna is very tasty with just the right amount spice from the wasabi.

I should have taken the time to read more of the reviews as my personal experience is not positive. I made a reservation for this past Sunday 12/10 to avoid the drama of a NFL Sunday as this restaurant appeared like it was a good place to honor reservations and looked really nice. Was I wrong about this assumption. We arrived on time for our reservation at 11:30 that was made on Open Table to be informed that they were still attempting to seat 11:00 reservations because people were staying longer than usual. Football Sunday and you have not figured this out? Guy was leaving as we walked in very upset with service at the bar. Then I was flippnently told that we had to wait for an indeterminate period for a table that could not be guaranteed. And oh by the way we have still attempting to seat the 11:00 clock crowd. We saw these poor people standing there and decided to back to RiRa. Next thing I get a notice from Open Table that I did not show for my reservation. Bad form 5Church you suck.

I'm not typically a fan of Restaurant Week reviews, because the experience is not the same as a typical meal...but here goes. We'd read a lot about 5Church and their RW menu looked to offer some of their standard menu items, so we booked it for fairly early on the first Saturday of Queen's Feast. We arrived about 30 minutes early to enjoy a drink at the bar. The bartenders were friendly and the drinks were delicious. I had the 5Church (lychee martini) and my husband had the New Fashioned. Before we knew it, our table on the third level was ready. The seating is interesting in that they have several different levels of small seating areas. From where we were seated you couldn't see the famous Art of War ceiling. I ordered the pork belly appetizer, wasabi crusted salmon, and smores cake. My husband had the tomato soup, hangar steak, and banana pudding. The tomato soup won the appetizer round, the guy at the table next to us even leaned over and commented on how good it was. The pork belly was good, but required a lesson from the waitress on how to best enjoy it. The wasabi crusted salmon was delicious, not too spicy at all, just a little bite to it. The bok choy and the miso emulsion under the fish was fantastic, and this coming from a non-miso lover. My husband enjoyed his hangar steak and horseradish mashed potatoes. The smores cake was the dessert we preferred, the "deconstructed" banana pudding was good too. All in all a delicious meal, and we'll be back to enjoy the full menu at some point soon. We're also excited to try the new restaurant this group is opening in South End sometime this fall. In this case, Restaurant Week served it's purpose and piqued our interest.

5Church is a new restaurant in Uptown Charlotte, NC.  An amazing amount of effort went into the design of the restaurant.  It has a very contemporary decor with a hip vibe.  All colors are white, gray and black, so nothing is overpowering, yet nothing missed.  Novels coat the ceiling, which makes great conversation upon entering.  Seating is well placed with the exception of the long table near the bar.  Seating here can become crowded and somewhat uncomfortable to have a conversation.  One thing lacking was acoustics.  There really wasn't much thought given to the noise level in the design and as a result, when it becomes busy, it is very difficult to hear.  Aside from this, it is truly a beautiful place.  We started with cocktails, which were quite good.  Not the best we have had, but above average.  We enjoyed the cheese plate to start, which was amazing.  There was a goat cheese, a gruyere, and a sheep's milk cheese each paired with a very well organized compote.  Here we started our pairing of wine with a pinot noir.  A crisp, light, cherry flavor that went extremely well with the cheese.  A must if you dine at 5Church.  My girlfriend and I both opted for the 60 Second Steak; an interesting take on preparation.  The steak is cooked mostly on one side and the turn is for only 60 seconds.  We both ordered medium rare and when the steaks arrived, you could see all of the temperatures layered throughout the steak with the majority being your ordered temperature.  This is not a steak for those who like medium well or well.  The steak was good, but lacked a proper amount of seasoning.  This was offset by the sauce served with the steak, which was spicy and sweet, but a little too overpowering.  Still, quite good and prepared well.  We added the lobster mac and cheese, which was bursting with various molten cheese, full of the various flavors and accompanied by large pieces of lobster.  One of the best I have had.  A great night out at 5Church, but I expected a bit more flavor from the steak and wished the noise level was a little less.
The concept and food looks really good....to bad we did not stick around to try it.   The bar staff unfortunately lacks in service so onto the next stop.

Best meal I've had in long time. We had no reservations, but they squeezed four of us in at the bar upstairs. It ended up being great.. The bartender was gracious, helpful and gave us excellent service without being too chummy.   Had the quinoa tabbouleh app, wasabi salmon and peanut butter cake for dessert. I only wish I got the banana pudding like my friends. The cake was good, but not at the same level as everything else.   The flavors, balance of ingredients and innovative details make this place a standout. Charlotte is fortunate to have 5 Church! This place will be a regular in my rotation.

Love the atmosphere, have never been dissapointed there. Food is excellent.  One of my top three favorite Charlotte Uptown Restaurants.  Don't forget to look up. The Art of War is hand written on the ceiling.

Have now been here a couple times.  While I think it is a great atmosphere and place to get a drink, I've always been very underwhelmed by the food and when you combine that with value, I think 1 star is generous.

Went here after my friends wedding. A server came, greeted us and took my drink order. She then asked for a credit card to open a tab. More people came to the after party and I never saw the server again until I looked outside and saw her leaving her shift. I then went to the bar to close my tab. The bartender had no idea where my CC was and frankly didn't care. I thought he went to find out but noticed he started taking drink orders for other customers and would not come back down to help. I left the bar and called back a couple days later to ask where my credit card was - they didn't know but I would definitely hear back within 24 hours. Two days later I called back because I noticed they charged me. They finally found my credit card (as a reminder I had to proactively reach out). Problem is I'm from out of town and am no longer able to pick up the card which means pretty major inconvenience for me. I now have to cancel my main credit card. This is a very nice expensive restaurant. It's completely unprofessional that my card was misplaced by an employee and no one cared to follow up. Too bad as I really liked the ambiance and food.

I had lunch at 5Church and was surprisedly impressed.  Our server, Yianni, was INCREDIBLE.  Very attentive without being overbearing.  One of our party is pregnant and Yianni ran to the kitchen several times to ask the chef if certain items were safe.  The black bean hummus and quinoa tebouleh were phenomenal.  They complemented each other well and if I hadn't been at a work lunch, I would have been licking the bowls.  The grilled prosciutto di parma was mouthwatering.  Served on grilled buttered bread, this panini was stuffed full of prosciutto and mozzarella. And get a side of fries to share.  Trust me.   The decor is upscale and trendy and the attention to detail is fantastic.  Visit the second floor and see the artists' interpretation of the $5 bill.  Great for groups, parties, bar scene or just a dinner or lunch with friends.  I'm a fan.  They also  have a NY style brunch complete with DJ.  I can't wait to visit for that!

I'm usually tougher on reviews than the average rating, but I'm really surprised at how low this one is considering how much we enjoyed it.  Top notch food from appetizers to dinner and dessert.  The atmosphere was hip and modern. I've only been once but definitely plan to go back when I have out of town visitors soon!

Recently went to 5Church on a Saturday evening. Was excited to try this place, and have heard good things. Our reservation was late...8:30pm. I guess because of the hour this place felt more like a club, than a restaurant. At any rate the atmosphere was pretty cool and we were immediately shown to our table. We ordered cocktails. I was excited for a dirty martini because this place looked like they would know their way around a cocktail. The rest of my party (6 total) ordered cocktails, and in about 10 minutes another server was back with our drinks. He was pretty confused and had messed up most of my orders. One martini came with no olives, and my friends scotch was served with a lime...which was new. They fixed our drinks and we took a look at the menu. I had a steak. Everyone was asked what temp to cook their steak at, except me. It was so loud I just didn't think about it till my steak came and it was practically still mooing. I needed it to be about medium. They took it back, and everyone else ate while I waited for my meal to be re-fired. When it got back to me it was just OK. A little tougher than you would hope from a 40.00 steak. The mashed potatoes were good, and the gorgonzola cream sauce that accompanied the steak was also yummy...heavy, but that was to be expected. After dinner we ordered dessert. We chose the chocolate flourless cake. This was the most disappointing dessert I have ever had...ANYWHERE. The waitress brings the dessert knowing that everyone at the table wanted a taste, and it is literally the smallest thing I have ever seen. The entire dessert measured 1/2 inch high, and 1.5 inches long. Not even enough for everyone to have a small bite. It was almost as if they had run out...and gave us scraps.  I won't go to 5church again. Me and my husbands total was 210.00 and we both agreed we would have been happier, and fuller if we had dined somewhere else.
Great atmosphere  Excellent calamari  Ragu pasta with truffles was the best Wine list was great value

You come to this place to be seen and see other chic people like yourself. It reminds me of a hip bar in NYC or Rome. The staff is very prompt and courteous. I had the roasted chicken with creamy mash potatoes and it was good. For $20 though I think I could've been a tad bit better. However, no one comes here for the food, you come to be seen and order good drinks. Also, it had a really good crowd for a Thursday night.

Visited this trendy restaurant and wanted to enjoy it. The service staff were polite and attentive.  The appetizers were  tasty but service was very slow and the food was cold. I think the entre would have been very good but it's impossible to say - cold steak and potatoes just don't cut it.

Good service, but disappointing biscuits.  I ordered their take on biscuits and gravy.  While the chicken etouffee gravy was tasty, the biscuit was was dry and heavy.  Our server (Grace) offered to bring another biscuit or dish, but I declined.  If you try this spot for brunch, avoid the biscuits.
I stopped by for a drink the other night and thought the place was gorgeous.  The staff was friendly and I loved the mixed drink menu.  Looking forward to coming back for dinner soon!

While browsing Yelp for dinner options, I came across 5Church but have to admit that it was not the destination when heading out to dinner.  It turns out a lot of places are closed on Sundays in Charlotte, which I am not used to in San Francisco so it didn't even dawn on us to check, so this was stop #4.  My two colleagues had the filet but I decided to give the 60 second NY strip steak a try.  I was a bit leery, since it was an unusual way of cooking the steak but turned out to be quite tasty, although I can't say I have a lot of NY strips to compare it to.  I'm usually a ribeye girl.  Anyway, the steak is seared on one side so it's nice and crusty but they don't flip the steak so the other side is raw.  It comes with a choice of sides and a sauce.  I got their house sauce which is like A-1 - tasty.  The smashed potatoes were quite creamy.  I also added a side of broccoli, which they added red pepper flakes that added a nice kick to it.  Very friendly and attentive staff.  Oh, I almost forgot - they also gave us a free appetizer of the white bean hummus.

Update: we raved about this place to my family. Having gone several times and LOVING it. We took my family out for restaurant week. The food once again was mind blowing, but I was completely disgusted with the service. Our waiter clearly didn't want to be working. He tried rushing us through the meal and didn't produce a smile one time during the course of dinner. The entire point of restaurant week is to get more clientele to your restaurant. Clearly, they were only interested in getting people in and out as quickly as possible. I am also utterly disgusted by the manager. He talked to all the other tables around us, but never us. I'm assuming because we were a younger crowd. Remember that a younger crowd could create better tips because of the extras we like to order. Needless to say, I'm not sure I would recommend this place to others. You can't have great food and poor service. It's a shame, because they will lose return customers like myself.
I loved this place! From the unique menu to the novel on the ceiling - this place is just fun. Hip and trendy downtown restaurant.

This was our first visit. My wife had the scallops and I had the wild caught salmon, food was superb. The service was excellent and we were very pleased with the entire operation. Justine, our waiter, was friendly & helpful.

I thoroughly enjoyed my night at 5Church for dinner and drinks with friends.  We arrived a little late for our reservation (sorry 5Church!) but we were welcomed at the door and promptly seated at our table.  Unfortunately, they were out of the bottle of wine we wanted to order, BUT our server quickly suggested their replacement and another bottle for us to order instead. The wine was fantastic and the food was amazing.  5Church definitely held up to my expectations.
Been here two times already and both times the food has been exceptional!! From their appetizers to dessert, loved everything about this place!!!

Went to 5church in Charlotte on Thanksgiving and the one in Charleston on Christmas. Their holiday prix fixe menu had some of your traditional dishes with a nice update. Flavors were great and service was decent. I loved the decor and ambiance! We'll have to come back and try the regular menu.

I've now been to 5Church twice and the food, service and atmosphere have been consistent. Great food (grateful for vegetarian options!) - cordial service, fun, busy and loud atmosphere.   I also appreciate the attention to detail that went into the decor. Check out the script on the ceilings...Sun Tzu's 13 chapters of the 'Art of War'.

We had family in from all over the country and had heard good things about 5Church. We were seated promptly. The waitress came over quickly and served water. She then returned and got drink orders but didn't bother taking orders for my older mother or teen daughter, like they didn't exist.  That really bothered us.  Service was very good and we received our appetizers and drinks efficiently. The specialty drinks ordered by a few in our party were well received.  But, that's about all I can say nice. The waitress did not know the menu and was too busy to help us. She acted annoyed when we asked questions about the entres. For Charlotte this is an expensive restaurant and we should have had better menu knowledge.The waitress was 21, at best.  She acted 21, at best.  The entres arrived in an appropriate amount of time BUT WERE COLD. Not just one item, but every entre was cold, including the family style sides we ordered. Cold steak, cold mashed potatoes, cold everything. At this point, what do you do? Do you send it back and extend a meal that was already long? We just sucked it up.  The bill for our party of six was about $450 but that included two non-drinkers so a fairly hefty amount to spend for one night. The food was simply not worth it, not even close. If you are going to spend that much on a meal, it needs to be very good, or at least warm.   Word of warning - you are rolling the dice on this place. Clearly something is wrong in the kitchen. This was, at best, mall chain quality and boutique prices.

If this is Charlotte's best restaurant then I better not eat anywhere else in this city. I'm in town for a short visit and stopped by here after reading the local press. To be fair this would be a 1.5 to 1.75 star rating.   Service: 1.5/5  Sat at the bar for a quick bite before the dinner rush. I don't know if the bar is not used to serving food but food coming before cutlery was interesting. I also had to lift up my appetizer as I was eating so a napkin "placemat" could be out down. There was no cutlery exchange for the main course while not a deal breaker isn't pleasant in mixing flavours. The bartender was not particularly attentive, no water, no asking if I needed a cocktail nor a check in with how everything was. She did seem preoccupied with talking about just turning 21 and chatting socially with bar patrons. Not really professional and definitely did not make me want to order more drinks. That's the kind of bartending I expect at a sports bar.  It's a shame that a solo diner spending $50+ gets less service than someone having one drink order. It's a bigger shame since I'm a big fan of cocktails and usually spend $100+ on a meal and good drinks but the service did not compel me to do so.   Drinks: 1/5  I ordered the namesake "5church" with the intent on trying more but it was not well made. It was way too sweet and not balanced. As I watched the bar I noticed the bartenders weren't tasting the cocktails to see if they were proper. If you have a serious cocktail program you'd want them perfect and consistent. Unfortunately it seems more occupied with the trend rather than concerned about quality. It did not instil confidence in the rest if the cocktails. If the service was better I may have tried another one.   Food: 2/5 The artisan cured meat plate was okay. I was told it was house cured and I was expecting more for house cured meats but it wasn't bad nor spectacular.  The shortribs...where to start. The meat was bordering on dry but it was at least hot while the rest of the dish was cold. It was bland but the sauce and potato garnish was way over salted. I really could have used some water. Unfortunately mixing under seasoned meat with over seasoned sauce isn't pleasant either. The Brussels sprout leaves were spot on though but it was not a good dish. Dish presentation was good. To say it's hotel convention food quality would be a disservice to hotels.   Usually I would have said something but no one bothered to check in at anytime during the meal. When I asked for the bill, the bartender did ask how things were. I let her know about the sauce and that the dish was meh, she said sorry and there was nothing else. I would have sent back the dish if there was better service but at that point I was famished from not eating all day. I was so unimpressed that I just wanted to cut my losses and leave as soon as possible.   Go if you want to be part of the scene. Avoid if you like good food and drinks or good service. Disappointing effort tonight and if this is an example of the food scene here then Charlotte is not a food destination.

We decided to try out 5 Church as I had seen pictures of it online.  This is a very unique venue.  The d√©cor is unlike any place I have been.  The food was amazing.  As I looked around and watched the other customers get their dishes I could see all of the amazing ways they presented the food.  The service was good.  This is definitely a place we would visit again....we kept finding interesting aspects to the restaurant...from the lighting, to the ceiling, to the pillars and chairs.  All of that aside, the food was fabulous and that is why we will go again.

I'm at brunch here today at 5Church.  I haven't made a review for quite some time, but my experience today encouraged me to make one.   First of all I want to point out the consistency of the design elements throughout the place. I was constantly noticing things throughout the establishment as my brunch went on. The ceiling has intricate writings and the check book you get at the end of the meal matched. The couches and tables and lamps and decor was all inviting and interesting.   But we don't really go to a restaurant for the atmosphere alone, but in this case I was struck with the feeling that the same effort would be evident in the offerings available. Well, turns out I was right. The food was delicious. The offerings are inventive and interesting.   Then, moving onto the staff. Everyone working was gracious, helpful, professional and friendly.   To wrap up, I will say that I really enjoyed my meal (hence my gushing review, sorry) and will add this place to my "frequently visited places". I hope others enjoy this place as much as I have.

After reading so many positive reviews for this restaurant, I had high expectations and couldn't wait to try it.  5Church did not disappoint!  I booked a table for my birthday dinner, and we loved it.  Everyone at the restaurant really made me feel special for going there to celebrate my birthday.  There was no forced "Happy Birthday" sung to an uncomfortable table.  Instead we had great dessert and excited smiles.  The menu was divine.  You won't find the same thing here you'll find everywhere else, and it's so refreshing!  The creative food combinations were not at all pretentious like you'll find at some places.  The atmosphere is fun, inviting and unique. Great for a date, party, or happy hour. Can't wait to return!

It's unfortunate when the establishment is known for great food but has awfully, horrid service. Today was no different. Perhaps I'm so critical because I was a server for many years.  Our brunch was delish...once it was finally served but it was quite the chore to get condiments to our table. Even the manager asked if we needed anything else and when we told him condiments it went unacknowledged. There was also someone's hair in my water, thank goodness for my alternate drink (let's hope no additional unwarranted items were in that as well). The server was lucky to have received a gratuity at all, but we left 15% (low for us) and left without speaking to the manager since he wouldn't be of any help anyways.

My wife and stopped by for lunch. The food was very good. We had the Lamb Burger and the pasta special.  Service was also good.  Really the only thing that stood out was that I got the last bit of fries.  There was a large party and everyone had a sandwich and fries.  My guess was that they probably ran out and just scraped enough to put on my plate.  The food was flavorfull and I think it warrants the higher price.

You would never know that you're in Charlotte when you step into 5Church. The atmosphere alone is amazing. Classy, Modern, Elegant but not stuffy. In addition to the excellent local fresh food that they serve (try the roasted vegetables) but they also have a great wine selection. They also accommodated to diet restrictions and were spot on. Great place and will be coming back for sure!

The decor is disjointed and the noise level is very high. We went on a Saturday night and it was almost offensive. Too much to carry on conversation. The service was extremely slow. My crispy tofu was delicious but the vegetables beneath it were excessively salty. The cocktail I had was awful. Too bad that five church missed the mark on so many things because I would love a bowl of the tofu alone! I was surprised they charged me for my drink since I didn't drink much of it and voiced my opinion on it. The shared app for the table also went on my bill without asking either. For all these reasons, I probably won't be back.
Poor service for bar dinning.  Scallops dish was disappointing to say the least....and for $35, why do I have to ask for the complementary hummus?

PHILLIPE STARCK GHOST CHAIRS only complement the modern yet welcoming decor.  Tall ceilings (with the entire Art of War hand-painted on them) and custom artwork by famed Charlotte tattoo artist Rodney Rains complement the urban feel.  There are a few seating options- low, comfy couches, traditional tables, and a long bar area with a gastropub feel.  We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation and were promptly seated.  Boys enjoyed noda's ramblin on red on draft and we found a (a few) bottles off the wine list.  The cocktails looked great and we will be back to sit at the bar top for some drinks and small plates.  Started off with the gnocci, chickpea salad, goat cheese, spinach dip, black bean hummus $3?! and toasted mushroom ravioli.  Chef Jamie sent out crispy szechuan pork belly with spicy cabbage and stopped by to ensure we were enjoying ourselves (we were).  Don't miss the french style gnocci or toasted mushroom ravioli.  Entree-wise I opted for the Tokyo noodle soup with roasted pork, confit turkey, poached egg, veggies, and a dark smokey broth that was amazing.  I tried the 60 second prime ny strip steak- melted in my mouth good.  Niman ranch pork chop was a huge cut and perfectly prepared.  Dessert was pronounced great by those who tried it- some sort of banana cake with ice cream.  It was the end of the night so things are a little wine/food coma fuzzy.    Overall, ambiance was fun, service was great. and the food banged me in the mouth with flavor.  Innovative, delicious, and fresh.  Affordable and we will, without a doubt, be back!

A girlfriend and I met for a happy hour and dinner during the week.  We saw online it had complimentary valet but had to circle the block a few times because no valet was present.  We eventually parked in a deck and walked.  Upon arrival we asked the hostess about the valet and she said no valet is there until after 6PM.  And they do no validate any parking fee.  The hostesses could have been friendlier.  They seemed busy as a large party was arriving at their upstairs, so we sat at the bar.  The bar manager was outgoing and knowledgable of the food.  We ate the flatbread and mussels which were tasty but it took a long while to get our food.  Cocktails were good but didn't seem worth the price.  Overall, not bad but could have been better.

Weekday work lunch - no crowd. Our server was very friendly, went over specials, and made good suggestions. During the course of the meal she was attentive and chatted us up a bit.  A bowl of mussels w large side of fries for $13 and those mussels were huge! The sauce was to Sri based but light and flavored well and had stewed tomatoes, although they were whole and probably could've been chopped up a bit. French  fries were pretty good - decent amount of dal and crunch.  My friend had the cordon bleu special and the capicola in the middle was still cold - which was odd to have such temperature difference but still flavorful. And of course he looved the French style mashed potatoes.  The decor was very interesting (see picture of ceiling) featuring local artists and the Art of War all over the ceiling. A fantastic music vibe w bands like Aerosmith.  It was absolutely freezing in there! - we were expected to hit 80 that day and I'm a small person so I'm always cold.  They change the menu seasonally and our server recommended a crab stuffed prawn w salsa verde... So I'll definitely be back soon!
I had the 60 second NY Strip. Tough and terrible. Fries were just OK. Never again.

Likes: Good uptown location, amazing cocktails and fun, trendy atmosphere and decor  Gripes: Although the cocktails are amazing, the food is really not that good. It's such a popular, fun place to go with friends on a weekend night that I really wanted to like the food but it's just not good  Bottom line: I'd go for cocktails at the bar and skip the food altogether

So this place earlier was some Irish pub and then they renovated and opened up as 5 Church. This swanky place is as terrible as it could be. The menu is awfully small and yet they take forever to cook the ordinary food. Do not even consider going there if you are a large group. We went as a team of 15 for lunch and while it wasn't much crowded, the servers were totally clueless and had no basic manners in treating people. The food took so long to come (just basic sandwiches and fries) that they gave the checks to everyone even before the food was out.  This is the only place I have ever paid first without even getting the food. At last the food came out and the servers once again had no idea whom to serve what. They never even apologized for late food or poor service, neither they had any smile or seemed happy to be serving. Nor did any manager came to apologize. And the quantity of the food is also really small. Their main focus is still on bar and drinks. Their bar is so big, probably that's why this terrible place is surviving as its close to all the pubs in the area and the location is right in the city center.   The awful SMALL menu, absolutely terrible service and overly decorated interiors. This is definitely one of Charlotte's worst place that looks good from outside but is absolutely terrible. I won't recommend this to anyone at all.

This is my favorite place in Charlotte. Very chic. Amazing food and fun bar scene especially on the weekends. Some of my favorite items are the black bean hummus, wasabi salmon (I could eat this every day), shrimp flatbread, local mixed greens, scallops. Even the fried tofu is beyond tasty. The smores dessert is to die for delicious. Hip and cool decor. Inventive mixed cocktails. Friendly staff. You can't go wrong with anything here.
Dope ambiance! Good food. Great place to go to for brunch. I had the lamb burger, which was awesome.
Food was fine. Crab cakes were OK. Not great. Mashed potatoes were really good. Restaurant was too noisy.

I've been here several times for lunch and the quality  of the food has always brought me back. Today was a bit different, since I brought several out of town colleagues along, from my high recommendation.  As usual the food was excellent, however it should not take 90 minutes for lunch when we arrived at 11:45am.  The service was slightly below what I would call abonimal.  It took 10 minutes before our drink order was taken and over the whole 90 minutes I managed to eek out 1 refill of unsweet tea. As I said, the food is exceptional. My previous lunch experiences have been much better service wise, although the kitchen was slow on all occasions. If you want a conversational and delicious lunch eat here.  If you're in a hurry skip it.
Very cool ambiance at the bar. I will definitely go back for cocktails. Dinner was average, and it was dark and hard to hear.

A party of 6 for dinner last night with reservations.  We had to wait for the table and we felt as if we were in the way.  We would have gone to the bar if escorted.  We were seated upstairs and it was uncomfortably hot!  We brought two bottles of an excellent Bordeaux because it was a special occasion.  We practically had to beg to get it uncorked.  After we did finish it which was practically before our food came we were never offered the wine list.  Their loss as we easily would have drank 2 more bottles!  This is just the beginning of a bad night.  As the waitress was truly trying she was the only one!  Every one of our meals was cold.  It was not just the protein it was every component.  We tried not to complain but one member of the party had to send his plate back.  It came back to him with less protein than when it left the table.  My fries well lets just say limp and cold.  My friend asked for a Medium Rare Filet it was Blue Rare.  The two stars are for the waitress!  Not the food!  I would never recommend this place!!  I truly regret not insisting on Capital Grille!
Never in my dreams would I have paired bacon with Pizza.  5Church does this, and it's awesome.  My friend and I liked it so much we ordered a second pizza. I also had a lamb burger. Great stuff.

Food was good although portions were small for the price.  Our server was knowledgeable with the menu and wine list, although staff seemed robotic and nervous at all times.    Heard some yelling in the kitchen which I found to be very unprofessional.  Even saw an employee get fired and escorted out the door by the bouncer.   Definitely NOT a relaxed atmosphere.   Word has gotten out that 5Church is poorly managed and I'm a witness to that fact.

If you stay at the Ivey's Hotel (which is otherwise excellent) this restaurant provides your room service. Our room service order was brought by a young man who stood in the doorway and shouted, "Would you sign this please?", and he wouldn't budge until I first signed the check. He didn't bring a copy of the check for me, the order wasn't even complete, and he simply dumped the tray on the table and quickly left without bothering to check the order or even offering to open the water bottles. The managers are totally responsible for this perfunctory service. So, you might wait about a year after this review to risk trying the room service. The characters currently mismanaging this restaurant can't last long.

This place is phenomenal.  I was hesitant going in, mostly because everything else that's been at this location has faded quickly, but these guys have it down.  Went with a group of six and we were all very satisfied.  Appetizers - bacon pizza, black bean hummus, pork bellies and they all went real quick.    Entrees - Three of us got the grouper and agreed it was terrific.  Salmon was good, hanger steak was a little sweet for my taste but the girl that actually ordered it loved it.  Decor is awesome.  Not sure who's idea the ceiling was but that's pretty cool.  Service was absolutely spot on.  If you can get Ashley as your server do so, she didn't miss a beat.  Yeah it's not cheap but it's also not a Hardees.  Definitely feel like I got what I paid for and then some.  Great atmosphere, fantastic food, hit this place up.

For Thanksgiving, we decided to leave the cooking to others and was lucky to get a table at 5Church. Food was amazing, good cocktails, service was average (could have been due to the holiday), ambience and decor was very cool. Since it was Thanksgiving, it was a set menu. Soup was cauliflower, which I was a little skeptical at first, but it was very delicious. Salad was a butter lettuce -very basic. We did have a choice of main and desserts. Our party of 4 all had turkey with the fixings and it was delicious. More than enough food, I actually had leftovers. As for the desserts, we each tried a different one and they were all scrumptious. Will definitely go back to try their regular menu.

We come here all the time for brunch and it is always amazing. We stopped in for a late night dinner and ordered off the snack menu. The shrimp flatbread was amazing and had tons of flavor. The pork belly was over cooked and the chicken lettuce  wraps had an overwhelming Rosemary flavor. If we go back late night we would stick to flatbreads only.

Well, I have to say I was sorely disappointed! All the hype about 5Church is nothing but hype, most likely generated by their own marketing manager who also happens to be part owner, or at least that's the way it looks on their site. Some people are easily swayed I guess. My experience was that it was a garish, loud and unpleasant atmosphere. You can tell they are trying way too hard to be hip. The food was so so, my lamb burger was dry and tasteless yet greasy at the same time. This is just another bar in uptown, not a real restaurant. There are a few small locally owned places that are within a block or two that are much more appealing if you want some good food and drink without all the hype and noise. Nothing worth returning for here.

Stopped in after a long day of travel - service was awful and food not great. Took waitress over 15 minutes to take our drink order.....then order was wrong. she spent the entire time apologizing in an awkward, annoying way...not in a way that helps you forget a little mistake. Ouch.

I originally gave this place 2 stars based on my first experience: poor service & below average meal were the reason. Someone from their HR department reached out to me apologizing for my experience. I really appreciated that. Most places would not have taken the time, so it shows that they actually care about their customer's opinions. I decided to chalk my first time up to an 'off day' on their part and went back for a second time. I kept an open mind and was very pleasantly surprised. My meal was DELICIOUS. I had the breakfast pizza (can't remember the exact name). I brought along 2 friends of mine and they really enjoyed their meals, as well. We ordered the bottomless mimosas and they were awesome! The wait staff was great! Our mimosas never got below a half of a glass and they were very attentive and friendly. What a COMPLETELY different experience compared to the first time I went here! I'm glad I went back and I will definitely eat here again in the future!

A small group of us headed out for lunch today, and upon getting to our preferred restaurant, Basil, found they had a 30 minute wait to be seated. 5Church didn't have a wait, so we figured we would try eating there instead, since several of us had meetings after lunch. In retrospect, the lack of a wait should have been a clue.  We were sat immediately, and the server took our orders fairly quickly. The lunch menu is slim: sandwiches, flat breads and salads. Honestly, nothing that can't be thrown together with 5 minutes of time and a fryolator. One person ordered a salad, the rest of us ordered sandwiches, which according to the posterboard outside, came with fries and a drink for $10. (Our server never inquired if we wanted drinks, by the way. You got water only unless you asked for a drink specifically.)  Our orders were taken around 12:15. At 12:50, after seeing several tables that had been sat after us receive their orders, I finally inquired when we saw our server, who had been MIA for a long while, with runners delivering to his one or two tables. (One table sat down after us, got their meal, and left, before we even got our meal.)  My inquiry was far more polite than the curses some members of our table had lobbed into our discussion about the restaurant and our MIA server in particular after seeing everyone BUT US served in the 30+ minutes we had to wait for our pedestrian, easily-assembled sandwiches and fries.  Frankly, I couldn't blame my tablemates, many of whom had better places to be than sitting idly at the table of a missing-in-action incompetent server in an inefficient restaurant. Honestly, I was the least pissed off of all the diners, so I was the one to ask about our food, in the most polite, non-assertive manner I could muster - because to do so otherwise would invite spit from this type of place and our "Hack" server. Unlike half of my tablemates, I didn't have somewhere else to be an hour after I left for lunch (i.e @1:00).  My exact words when our MIA server finally decided to grace us with his presence were, "Hi, can you check on our order? Several of us have meetings we need to get to in a few minutes."   As soon as the words left my mouth, our aptly-named server "Hack" (according to my receipt) seemed deeply offended that we had the damned AUDACITY to inquire about food that took way too long for a business lunch.   Our server "Hack" stiffened and adopted a defensive and rude demeanor. "As you can see, we're very busy!" he huffed pompously.   Seriously?! Drop the attitude, sweetheart. You don't work at e2e or Blue and only one other table has been sat in your area in the last 30 minutes. Sorry, but 5Church isn't on par with Charlotte's classy or high volume restaurants like say, Basil, which actually had a wait - and clearly for a good reason.   "Your food is coming out soon!" he snapped nastily, as he trounced off.  Our food finally arrived about 5 minutes later, and soon after that a soda glass was wordlessly slammed down next to me, presumably to replace my drink that had been emptied while our waiter had been MIA for so long.We asked for our checks, which arrived after about ten minutes. Hardly prompt, but it was better than I expected from our "Hack" server.  The food was okay. The fries were overdone, but my sandwich was okay. We scarfed down our food and got out of there as quickly as possible. 5Church had way overstayed its welcome for those of us who had other things to do.  I'd seriously recommend you avoid 5Church during the day if you have any other plans after your lunch, or if you want a professional server. The food was okay but the unprofessional service was galling. "Hack" was a certainly an appropriate name for our server. We won't return. This location doesn't seem to ever hold a successful restaurant, and with this kind of service, 5Church seems to be yet another failure just working its way on through.

I'm not sure what's going on with the decor here. It's sort of gothic and kind of trendy, but mainly just weird. We were looking for a trendy and romantic spot to celebrate my bf's birthday, but the restaurant was loud and full of groups from a conference.  The food was good, but not particularly memorable. We started with the shrimp flatbread, I had the roasted chicken at the recommendation of the server (it was fine), and my bf had the filet (he was very happy with it). Our server also recommended the viper cocktail which sounded awesome, but was actually a bit boring. We ended our meal with the smores dessert, a very sweet brownie with marshmallow fluff on top...so not smores at all, but still good.  I love that they have a bunch of local brews on tap and hear that they have bottomless mimosas at brunch. I will definitely give it a try for brunch, but may not be back for dinner.
Great spot for a date, girls night or drinks!  I go all the time, love the food and atmosphere!
5 church is one of my favorite restaurants in the Charlotte area, along with numerous friends. I've never been disappointed by the food or drinks here.
Cool atmosphere. Great weekend hangout -however all 4 times I have eaten here the service was beyond awful every time.

Had a great experience there last night. Design and atmosphere was perfect for a special dinner. Server was exceptional. Food was great- as to be expected. However the new fall menu fell short in creativity and seasonal influence. Just my opinion though. Enjoy your dinner!

We had drinks there the other night and I was disappointed. It seems the place has gotten just a little bit full of itself. The bartenders were actually walking with their tennis shoes where they stack the fresh glasses. The bottles were high up and they had no ladder.  Disgusting.  Also my martini was finished and empty for ten minutes and finally had to wave to get another.  Not a big deal but they are in the big leagues.   And charge a lot for a little.

I've been to 5Church a few times. It's usually really good. We went to brunch for Father's Day. I was disappointed when I was told that they were not having the buffet because not as many reservations were made for Father's Day as Mother's Day.   I had the shrimp and grits. It was bland and needed salt and pepper. The grits looked and tasted more like risotto. My son had the steak and it was tough. The potatoes and fries were good. I'm not giving up on them yet, but Father's Day deserves the  same respect and buffet as mothers day.

What words come to mind when describing 5Church? Well, maybe... Hot, Chic, Artsy, Delicious, Fashionable, Trendy, Modern, Funky, Sexy, Elegant, and seemingly a little bit ahead of the curve for Charlotte. After opening what seems to be the largest doors in the world... we were promptly greeted by a 5Church hostess and got our seats within seconds.  An attention to detail, art and design runs rampant throughout the restaurant. After a slightly lengthy wait... we were finally brought a basket of slightly salted bread. Crispy and salty on the outside, fluffy and delicious on the inside. The crispy Szechuan pork belly and spicy cabbage came out next and was one of the best things we had for the night. The pork belly was nice and crispy, without being too fatty. The cabbage had the perfect crunch and acidity to balance the pork belly. The biggest draw back... there were only a couple bites of the pork belly :(  Ella started her meal with the Tomato soup with aged cheese and crouton. The soup was pretty good, but she's had better. What we did really like was the crunchy cheesy crouton that added a nice texture to the soup. The bacon pizza came topped with shaved vidalia onion and fromage blanc.. or in lamens terms, white cheese. This was a pretty good pizza for being an app, I don't think I would recommend it be anyone's entree because its pretty thin and not very filling.  The best plate of the night was the C.A.B. hanger steak with roasted potatoes, marinated tomato salad, and J-1 sauce. In case you're wondering what C.A.B. is, its "Certified Angus Beef". The steak was cooked perfectly and rubbed with an awesome blend of spices that added a mountain of bold flavors, especially with the J-1 sauce. The steak was served with crispy roasted potatoes which were really tasty, especially with the J-1 sauce, I could have done without the marinated tomato but it was pretty good with the   J-1 sauce... oh yeah and the J-1 Sauce was pretty good too :)  The 5Church lamb burger with grilled onion marmalade, gorgonzola cheese and arugala came stuffed between a house-made sesame bun and served with a crispy confit potato. Coming in just barely as a strong third, the lamb burger was juicy, fresh, and a little bit of eye fluttering / toe curling deliciousness. The crispy confit potato sticks made for a cute start to a log cabin but might have been better (for me) if they weren't so "log like" and more fry like. Its not that I don't appreciate the originality.. its just that the best part (for me) is the crispy exterior, not the squishy potato interior. The smaller the fry the more crispy and less squishy there is :)  The chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream and cherries was not on the menu, but probably will be soon because it was delicious. The cake was super moist and topped with gooey rich chocolate glaze and cooked cherries. The ice cream (which i am pretty sure was home made) was the perfect addition to the rich chocolate cake and made for a great dessert. The smores trifle was on point and looked delicious but the depth of the cup made for a difficult mixture of equal flavors. Each bite was either too chocolatey, too marshmallowy, or too graham crackery.. even if none of those are real words you get the point.  5Church left a memorable impression on us and we definitely recommend you check it out.

My husband and I visited 5 Church for the first time for lunch on a Friday.  This may have been our first but will not be our last.   When you walk in the large glass front door, you can't help but look around in amazement.  The d√©cor is beautiful!  Look up on the ceiling and you'll even find art.  A local artist painted/wrote the words to a novel on the ceiling (plus a few small hidden words/phrases special to 5 Church).  So cool!!  My husband had the lamb burger and absolutely loved it (I tried it too and have to agree).  I had the fried chicken sandwich which was not a normal boring chicken sandwich.  As sides, we couldn't decide so we got three: chickpea salad, hand cut fries, and something we had no idea about, quinoa tebouleh (which came highly recommended by our server...it did not disappoint).  The entire meal was start to finish (including a few adult beverages) was great.  We highly recommend and can't wait to get back for brunch (drooled over the menu) or dinner!

5Church has always been one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte for it's great food and atmosphere.  It's the caliber of a high end steak house without the formality that most have.  Their NY strip steak is one of a kind and I highly recommend it.  Their cocktails are also fun - I had the shot in the dark and it's fresh, fruity, but not overly sweet. My boyfriend and I decided to celebrate there and the staff went above and beyond to make me feel special. Their dessert is out of this world -- highly recommend the smores truffle brownie (or something like that).  It's everything you could want in a dessert -- and I usually do not like desserts. I will definitely return to celebrate other life moments, but also for those just because moments!

5Church was definitely the highlight of my recent (very rainy) trip to Charlotte-especially since it's Open Table friendly. Not only was the service eccentric and down to earth, but the staff was extremely constructive on recommending dishes as well as my cocktail decision for the night (the Viper=awesome).   The atmosphere was very swanky and filled with mid to late twenty somethings. Perfect place to graze before a night out, have a pleasant intimate dinner, or just to get dressy with some girlfriends. The menu is straightforward Americana and is extremely reasonable for those of us on a budget.   Favorite dishes:  -The House Cured Charcuterie Board - as odd as it sounds, the P√¢t√© was the star of the bunch -Braised Beef Short Rib - perfectly cut portions that fell down from heaven and onto your plate; it's also large enough to split into two!  -Crispy Beet Sliders - sounds a little weird, but these scrumptious two biters are perfect for those who are not meat lovers (and even those of us who are!)  Overall, this twenty something gives this an A.
Come for the LAMB BURGER which is AMAZING.  Nothing else.  The duck confit "pierogis" are not pierogi (and there was only 1).  I can't even remember what my husband ate, it was that unmemorable.

Best way to describe 5 Church is that it has gotten too big for it's britches. Upon arriving I went to the ladies room and the lock fell out of it's screws and onto the floor. Bar scene and bartender both solid. Received drinks quickly while waiting for a table. We were sat promptly and greeted shortly thereafter. Our waitress described the portions of the appetizers and quickly ran off. We ordered artisanal cheeses and calamari. Calamari was decent but did not come with any cocktail type sauce only a tasteless mayonnaise and the "artisanal cheeses" were laughable with 4 olives, a few apple slices, untoasted baguette slices and soft cheeses all tasting the same. The waitress most confused me though when she came back and asked at least 3 times very abruptly, do you know what you want to order, without giving any specials or recommendations on entrees. If I'm paying over $30 for an entree....I'd like to be at least warmed up on a couple options. Finally I asked her for some recommendations and she basically tried to up sell us on adding crab cakes or scallops to our entrees. I ordered the scallops, why would I want to add a scallop? Shortly thereafter a manager looking lady came to help bus the table. Maybe our waitress was overwhelmed, but it felt like the place is just trying to get you in & out and squeeze you for as much $ as possible, while lacking quality.

My best friend and I came for the last night of restaurant week and could not have been more satisfied. Michelle our server was awesome and gave us perfect recommendations. Everything was delicious and we didn't feel rushed. I take my family here every time they are in town and never have any complaints. Can't wait to come back!

My girls and I had a really nice experience at 5Church today for their Thanksgiving meal. Our waiter was very sweet and knowledgeable. One of my daughters has celiac and I have had a chef at an upscale restaurant be really awful about it, but they were so nice and helped her decide what to order and made suggestions. (I'm not one of those awful people who asks for special accommodations I just need to know what she's eating!) Just wanted to give a shout out to everyone at 5Church! Thanks for an incredible meal!!

Unfriendly hostess resulted in poor first impression. We arrived on a Thursday at 4:50. We planned to have a drink while waiting for coworkers to join us. The first thing the hostess said to us was, "the kitchen doesn't open for 10 minutes." - We didn't ask about the kitchen or placing an order.  The hostess led us to a small table and added a chair to the end of it to accommodate our party of 5.  We asked if we could be seated at a booth since the restaurant was empty and we were the only customers. Hostess informed us the booths were being held for those who made reservations. We were there from 4:50-7:30pm. During that time, several booths remained empty. We ordered appetizers and dinner. I would give the food a 5/10.  It was a little pricey but didn't meet expectations. The only positive about 5Church is the decor. The decor is trendy and inviting. I wouldn't recommend eating here but it is a nice atmosphere for Happy Hour. I don't think we will be returning after the cold reception and mediocre food. There are much better options uptown.

Co-workers raved about this place and their signature 60 second steak so we met there for dinner during a recent business trip.   The place is stylish and cozy with lots of interesting things to look at, including the patrons.  The cocktails were pricey but delicious.  We tried a few apps while at the bar waiting for our table - the lobster claw which was literally two bites of lobster for $17 - the sauce was interesting but totally not worth the price - and the meatball, which was very good.  Once seated we ordered dinner - I tried the 60 second steak - which is supposedly the dish that got the chef his job, but didn't impress me one bit.  Seared on one side and totally uncooked on the other, my steak was like cutting into shoe leather on the cooked side and basically flavorless.  We also ordered a few sides, probably the brussels and yukon potatoes but I honestly don't remember them.    Overall a 60 second experience for me and one I probably won't repeat anytime soon.

I liked this trendy little bar that is nicely decorated, (don't forget to look at the ceiling), and serves up decent food.  We went in for the $10 lunch that includes an entree and a non-alcoholic beverage for the price.  It was a pretty good deal.  I, however, went for something with whiskey in it.  In their offerings for lunch, they have Beet Sliders that are pretty good, but they are served up with skinny fries that looked like they'd been out of the freezer too long before they were cooked.  All in all, we enjoyed the experience, we enjoyed the food, and we like the server except that she forgot to bring the iced tea we ordered.  Ooops!

Not going back.  This place is way over-hyped.  When we arrived we were promptly seated upstairs.  The atmosphere is really interesting and fun.  We were seated at a table barely large enough for a couple of plates.  And, we were seated next to another couple whose table was less than 6 inches from ours.  This may not have been an issue except that we were two of only about eight customers in the entire place (about 6pm on Friday).  Our appetizers were good.  We ordered the mixed salad, quinoa tabouleh, and beet slider.  Again, all tasty.  We also ordered a couple of beers and were promptly told they were out but they had a replacement.  So, we ordered the replacement only to find out the beer was twice as expensive.  Five beers, $40.    Our main course was NOT GOOD.  It tasted like salt had been molded into various shapes and colors.  We ordered the Terriaki Tofu and don't recommend it.  This was our first visit so I'm not sure if all the main courses are this salty.  But ours was bordering on inedible.  Again, we were seated right on top of neighboring customers so we were eager to pay our bill and go have a drink or two down at the bar.  I had a full beer remaining from dinner and took it with me.  We got to the bar and my wife ordered a drink.  We finished our drinks and attempted to flag down a bartender for nearly 20 minutes before we got their attention.  When the bill arrived, they charged me again for the beer I brought down from dinner.  I told them I had already paid for that drink.  One of the bar tenders gave me a dirty look and spoke to two other bar tenders.  I guess they were "investigating" the issue.  Anyway, 15 minutes later, a manager adjusted our bill.  It was really nice being treated like we were trying to get away with something.  Long story short.  This place is average at best, service is hit and miss, and with the number of other great places in town, we won't be going back.
