Been here twice.  This place is cool in an upscale hipster kinda way.   I had the lamb burger the first time and the Duck the second. The duck was ok and if memory serves me well so was the lamb burger. The wine list is quite impressive and the cheese plate is one of the better selections in the city.   Ok so - 4 stars because the food and the service are great.  No 5 star rating because for the price I wasn't blown away either time. I left on both occasions not really caring if we ever returned. Beyond that if you are already in that part of town the Dandelion Market easily wins out over 5church.

Took my girlfriend here on 2/24/14 and had an unbelievable experience. Manager gave us personal service, waiter Doug was awesome. Food was great couldn't have asked for more. Highly recommend this establishment.

Beautiful decor. Good food. Horrible service. I only wish I could remember our waitresses name.  My sister had her bachelorette party here and we were seated in a nice large booth in the back. She is not a loud person and no one would have even known we were celebrating. Before long we were asked to move! I mean within 15 minutes of arriving and still waiting for other guests to arrive. We had to squeeze in way too close to one another so they could take away a table and seat 3 other people who came in after us. It was awkward and uncomfortable to be packed that close together. My water glass was never refilled. It was empty more than half of the night. She pressured us into ordering right away. As soon as one friend sat down she was waiting to take her cocktail order and the friend asked twice for time to look over the menu. She didn't give us much time to look over the menu but continued to press everyone to order. So, she was hovering around waiting to take the food order but when it comes to refilling water, god forbid we have anything to drink...I had to pile up everyones bread plates, appetizers, bread basket on my side, even after we were through with our meals because our server never came to take away the plates. I had to ask her to please take away the empty dishes so my sister had room to open her gifts. As she was handed the first present, the waitress came over and asked how to split the bill making my sister wait. The friend who organized the party said to put "her's" and pointed to my sister, on he bill. The waitress rudely responded "Who's "her"?". and the friend had to point to my sister again. When my sister was about to open the last gift the waitress came back and passed out the bills, not even bothering to say excuse me or maybe wait until my sister is obviously done, but everyone had to fumble around with their money during the time my sister was supposed to be able to enjoy fun gifts. We felt so unwelcome that we just got up and sat around the couches in the front for 30 minutes until our reservation at Crave. I noticed the other tables were waited on properly and I was disgusted with this horrible experience. Our waitress, an african american lady with black and brown hair (she was also wearing red lipstick) made this is a bad experience and my sister and her friends deserve better. Don't waste your time or money.

I'm a big 5Church fan. Their polenta is amazing. In fact, I love just about everything on their brunch menu. Sitting at the bar is a great atmosphere as all of their bartenders are so friendly and talkative. I love hanging out here.

Ive eaten here twice for dinner in the past year, and been very impressed with the food both times.  Apps, entrees and desserts were all delicious, and the wine list is above average.  I will say though, 5Church has somehow earned the reputation of "a place to be seen in Charlotte," and I think that attitude among the servers and other patrons may detract a bit from the restaurant overall.  The servers take the "hipster" vibe just a bit too far, and I cannot find words to describe the outfits women wear to this place; honestly, it's ridiculous.  If you are looking for good food uptown, you will find it here.  Just be prepared to look past the "We wish we were in Manhattan or LA" vibe from everyone else in the building.

Apart from the decor and atmosphere, I don't see what all the hype is about.  Went here the first night of restaurant week and the food, at best, was mediocre.  The pork belly spring rolls were tasty, but nowhere near "phenomenal" as the waitress described. The seared scallops were over salted and gave me heartburn. The best part of the meal was the chocolate pretzel bar for dessert - perfect balance of salt and sweet, bit not overtly sweet.

This was my 2nd experience at 5Church. I haven't been here in a few years.  However my first experience was good.  My husband and I decided to celebrate a late Valentine's dinner here on Saturday evening.  This was not the food nor service that I remembered.  We ordered the beet salad and tuna tarter to start.  The beet salad was an extremely small portion and lacked flavor.  We both felt the tuna tarter was the best choice of the night.  My husband ordered the filet and it was cooked to his liking; but nothing special.  I ordered the deckle steak cooked medium well, which was served nearly rare. Our server sent the steak back and returned with the steak nearly exact to how it came to our table initially.  It was uneatable. To top it off, with just 2 small starters, 2 steaks, and 4 drinks our bill totaled over $200.  We left hungry and extremely unsatisfied.

A few of the negative comments I've heard about this place all relate to the trout and yet for some reason I still ordered it and I coudln't agree more.  The trout is not fresh and very disappointing given that everything else was excellent.

The decor is very on trend. It was obviously a popular hangout but it was nice that it didn't feel crowded or overly noisy. The food was tasty. I started with the cauliflower soup which was exceptional. Typically not a fan of brussel sprouts but these with bacon which was also exceptional. The creamed spinach was tasty as well, however it was over salted. Typically not one who orders steak but I decided to this time. Perfectly cooked but like the spinach, over salted. The smore dessert was out of this world and could easily have had 2nds or 3rds. What really made this experience was the wait staff. We were a group of about 20 last night and had two young men assigned to our table. They were on top of their game and really made it an enjoyable meal.
Surprisingly good. Excellent service. Very friendly and great comfort food.

The service ruined the meal here. Unfortunately the waiter neglected to tell me they were out of the dish I or ended until 20 or 30 minutes after I ordered it. When my second choice arrived it was very good, however. The interior is modern and pleasant and the food is interesting.  All in all, I think there are better choices in uptown at the same price point.

This is a beautiful restaurant from floor to ceiling. The finishes are very cool.  We had a reservation through open table for Sunday Brunch and were seated immediately. Then we waited a ridiculous amount of time for coffee and our food. The presentation of the food is wonderful but the actual flavors were not great.  The combination of the wait and kind of bland food made this a disappointing experience. I would definitely go for drinks and enjoy the beautiful decor.

First, the atmosphere is awesome. If you only came to sit at the bar to have a drink, you'd be pretty happy.   We were lucky enough to sit for dinner and enjoy several of the menu's delicious offerings.   Our small party of 3 ordered several appetizers to share.  We started with the Bibb wedge, which the kitchen kindly split on 3 plates. This salad is fantastic! It's not has heavy as many other wedge salads we have had.   Next up was the octopus, poke and mussels. While the octopus wasn't our favorite, it wasn't bad and the poke made up for what the octopus lacked. The poke was fresh and had the perfect flavoring.   We finished with the wild mushroom flatbread. Wow! We loved this so much that we ordered a second one.   We washed all of this down with more than our fair share of Vipers, their signature cocktail.

I visited this restaurant for Sunday brunch after making a reservation. We walked in and were seated right away which was nice and the place was not full. The menu has a wide selection of brunch items to choose from and I had a hard time making my decision! I ended up ordering the Irish Breakfast and although the food was good (not great) the poor service ruined the experience for us. Our waitress hardly ever came over to our table to check on us and we had to ask why our food was taking so long instead of her apologizing. It took almost an hour for us to get our food and when it was brought to the table they forgot part of my order. The manager even stopped by towards the end of our meal to ask how everything was but did not seem apologetic about the poor service. I really enjoyed the atmosphere however the lack of service and extended wait for our food caused us to be unhappy with the visit. I probably would not go back to this place but it may be worth a visit if you get better service than we did.

Visiting my sister, with my wife, and we read the reviews on Yelp! and decided it looked and sounded too good to miss out on.  Pork Chops, Pork Chops, Pork Chops!  Were outstanding.  Mushroom ravioli, small plate, super delicious.  "60 Second" NY Strip Steak, was one of the best steaks we've ever tasted.  Grouper was really flaky, and moist.  Tomato soup, was tangy, and more on the bisque side, and the crouton was buttery goodness.  We sat in a really fun area, it was kind of a private small landing up the stairs.

I read about this place on Yelp, and stopped in for lunch before my flight home from Charlotte.  It's a trendy place with very nice decor.  Carrie the bartender was super cool, and the hostess was also very helpful & friendly.  I order the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich.  It was very good.  The bun was toasted, but at the same time very soft.  The chicken was cooked perfectly... inside was moist and juicy with a good batter.  It was topped with wicked pickles and aioli which had a tangy bite.  Their seasonal side was green beans... disappointed.  They were simple green beans with some onions, small portion and costs $4.  Next time I will go with the black bean humus.

I went to 5Church for brunch this past Sunday with a group of 5. The service was decent, and the food was even better. The decor of 5Church was gorgeous and I loved the mimosas. One thing I would've liked was the server to have come to the table more to check on my empty mimosa glass at times.

Not sure how or why this place got 4.5 stars. I feel the menu is too limited and the selections aren't diverse enough.  That said, my food was good. I had the shrimp and Boursin flatbread with a side of the broccoli with garlic and red pepper flakes. My guest had the turkey sandwich, which she said was good, and fries, which were served in a bowl and were very soggy.   The decor is interesting and hip (this might be a fun place for happy hour) but service seemed slow, even though there weren't many people there for lunch.  I'd probably give them another shot, but they need to step up their game to compete in the very crowded Uptown CLT restaurant scene.

The food here has never disappointed. There is a reason the menu is a little pricier than usual and it's because the food and drinks are phenomenal. The ambiance too really is ideal for a wonderful dinner before a night out with friends. The menu isn't huge, but has everything from a light snack to a heavy dinner which I LOVE! If you haven't been, I highly recommend. It is by far me and my friends favorite place in Charlotte!

Really enjoyed the atmosphere of this location. Overall I think the cocktails were beautifully presented and tasted great, and the server took time to understand my needs of what I wanted in my drink and modified my choice accordingly so it wasn't too sweet. We split a handful of apps, and a couple were good but nothing too outrageously special but I was a huge huge fan of the Tuna Takaki. Go here with friends and enjoy apps and cocktails and even their great list of daily specials and regular items. Everything looks good and would be a great date night spot as well!

Wow, what a tremendous place to enjoy dinner. The atmosphere was ideal for a slow and leisure dinner. Of particular note was the Charred Octopus appetizer. It was amazingly delicious and I'd encourage everyone to give it a try as this is not your mother's chewy octopus. I was disappointed by the S'mores Trifle dessert which was a basic brownie and Jet-Puffed marshmallow toasted by a butane-flame. Also, my wife spoke highly about the Caramelized Sweet Potatoes so give them a try as well.

A friend and I went here for restaurant week. Overall, it was good but I'm not sure I would come back to sit down and eat - the crowd that was there for drinks and apps seemed to be having a better time.

From the moment we walked in the door the staff there was so nice.  Doug, our server gave wonderful food and drink recommendations and was very attentive. The food was AMAZING, I loved the roasted corn soup.

I REALLY want to love 5church. I've been twice and wasn't a huge fan of my meal either time. However the atmosphere is amazing and it is a GORGEOUS restaurant. Also the 5Church signature cocktail is the best cocktail I've ever had. Definitely will be back in the future in hopes of finding something on the menu I love

I came here for brunch yesterday and I thought the food was pretty good. Highly recommend the Crab cakes and poached eggs. The sangria at $2.50 a glass is hard to beat. However, the Bloody Mary comes in a short glass and was not my favorite. Overall atmosphere is great and decor is beautiful! Will be back soon!

I moved to Charlotte about 5 months ago and heard so much about 5 Church. I went with my girlfriend to sit at the bar, have a great dinner, drinks and caught up with each other. My friend was able to find seats at the bar on a Saturday night so I was pretty excited. i joined my friend and we started talking. The bartender (Brian G) walked by me multiple times without recognition until I called out to him for a water and a menu. He gave me a water and by that time my friends drink was brinking empty...you would think Brian would ask if she would like another after setting down my water but to my surprise he walked away. Brian seemed to be down with the servers the majority of time laughing; so when he walked by again I asked him if we could order. Now meanwhile I am trying to catch up with my friend but have to keep tabs on where Brian is so that we can get what we need. I also want to mention that the bar was not busy so that can not be an excuse. I was not pleased to say the least but loved my meal. My friend and I have been back multiple times despite the bad service. We sat in the cocktail area and had a much more pleasant experience.  We just went back late last week and had to sit at the bar because it was busy in the cocktail area. Once again Brian was our bartender but there was also a girl behind the bar so I was looking forward to having someone new, hoping for a better experience. My friend got there first and she already had a drink so once again I knew I was going to have watch for Brian just to get a drink unless the girl came up to us. We did get Brian. He gave my friend a menu but after setting down my water he started walking away. I had to say to him before you leave could you please provide me with a menu, I mean come on! Then as per usual we had to track him down for refills, wanting to order, your check, ect. I thought maybe it was just us but as my friend and I started watching, the other patrons would have their food dropped off and he just left. Or get their drink and have to ask for menu or get their drink and are ready to order but he never even asks. I wonder if he knows his job description. They had to wait for him to walk back by to ask for condiments or anything else. Then you see the other bartender on her phone texting away while the customers are having a bad experience. My friend and I were getting livid. The icing on the cake for me was when I finally mentioned that it was like an icebox in here and I was so cold, was there any way to turn the air up. Immediately without any hesitation he blurts out "No". Are you serious? At least pretend you are asking or trying to get it a more pleasant temperature...he can not even do that. To top it off, you would think his personality would be great being a bartender. he is very shjort and to be honest seems very cocky. My friend and I left there saying we will never go back unless we are craving the duck or scallops....and we will ALWAYS be sitting in the cocktail bar area and NEVER at the bar again. My suggestion to you is to try this restaurant because the food is good but please do not sit at the bar...you will be there a long time to get what you want!

This was mediocre at best. The food was good but nothing memorable. The service was good too. However do NOT make a reservation here. They give you a bar table! They said that was their "reservation table" which seems like a joke to me. Also the place is very noisy which is fine for appetizers and drinks but not for a nice dinner. I will probably not come back here again unless it's for cocktails.

From the moment you walk in the door you feel like you might be in NYC as opposed to NC. The d√©cor and energy are both great. Modern industrial with very unique lighting fixtures, a bit of a brocade vibe and the entire novel "The Art of War" is written in chalk on the ceiling- assumingly to not be outdone by Michelangelo's Sistine Chapel.   Service was good. And the food impressive, depending on what you got. So choose wisely. Here's a list to help you do just that...  First, the starters. Skip the jerk chicken lettuce wraps. They do not live up to their Jamaican roots. The wedge salad is a solid good. But the perogies were my favorite. Nothing was sensational, however, just yet.  But the lamb burger, now that's a different story. So well seasoned with a complex blend of herbs and spices. The cheese. The bun. It was excellent. The fries were also pretty great, but less fry-like and more like a 2x4 of potato. And the sauce they give you to dip them in is a beautiful aioli of flavors. I put it on my burger too.  As for dessert, completely skip the Peanut Butter cake. Not worth it. And the Banana Pudding is just okay. But the S'More- ohh the s'more.  It's campfire heaven in a glass.  So, 5 Church gets 3 stars. A touch hit and miss, with a slight edge going to the hits.

Absolutely delicious, and excellent ambiance. Had the tuna tartare, wasabi crusted salmon, and the coconut lime mousse. The tartare and the salmon were fantastic, and the mousse was pretty good. Service was great. Unquestionably five star experience.

Sorry for the rating as there's no way for me to remark without really able t try their food. I went on yelp to look for a place to eat before we went to a meeting close by.  Seeing a few good comments as well the place said open till 2 am, I was excited as we will have a place to eat late. As we were late for the reservation we made, we decided to first go to meeting that we could not miss then go back to eat since it said it open till 2 am. The reality is not.  The bar opens till 2 am but the kitchen closed early.  I ended starving and I had to find somewhere else.

Great food, a couple hiccups with the service, but the staff definitely made up for it in the end. Went here to celebrate my husbands birthday; they acknowledged it with a card and coupon for 10% off the next visit. This place was trendy with a slightly hipster vibe. We had the szechuan pork belly snack which was delicious. Complimentary focaccia bread was good. I ordered a wedge salad and the wasabi encrusted salmon while my hubby ordered the "chefs special" 60 second steak. The entrees came out with no hint of my salad, and our waiter noticed and got it sent out compliments of the house. My husband's steak also came out without a knife, and when my salad came out finally, it lacked one also. However, the food was delicious! We also got the Smores dessert, which also was comped for the birthday! That was unexpected, and it was tasty to boot.

If you're coming for drinks or a rehearsal dinner, this place is great.   If you're coming for a regular dinner, look elsewhere.  I've been to rehearsal dinners and to get drinks and the experience was so good I decided to book our anniversary dinner there. I was severely disappointed.   I booked it well in advance with the note that it was for our anniversary. We were sat in between two loud, drunk parties, one being a bachelorette party. First strike.  Our mussels were bad and were amongst the worst we've ever had. Strike 2.  I ordered a $50 Ribeye medium rare. It shows up charred and brown completely through. It took so long to get there and at that point we were already over it.

I love eating brunch here, my first time was their first brunch and I couldn't wait to come back, they have this pizza with eggs on it that is to die for! I've had a few meals here and I always get the special that they have for the night, I have never returned anything and have cleared my plate! The bar tenders are awesome, and the staff is great and friendly! Only thing is I wish outside seating was an option but that's something that I don't think can happen with the location, and honestly the inside of this place is almost as appealing as the food. The owners are fantastic and I've met them a few times. I always walk by here on my way home and see the cooks getting everything ready and I must say you are all terrific!

The interior, menu, atmosphere was up to par. But the food was not. I was really looking forward to a great brunch, but what I got was mediocre. The Belgium waffles were literally just waffles and syrup that I could have made at home. The restaurant itself has a cool vibe, but the food isn't worth it. I would go back for a $2.50 mimosa or sangria at the bar, but that's about all

I've been here multiple times and the most recent was when Top Chef Katsuji visited. The service is good at dinner, but can be slow at lunch.  Jamie did not visit our table but visited lots of others, but Katsuji was nice enough to stop by and take a picture.  The food has been consistently good. Katsuji made the tongue mole, which was the favorite of the night. We also ordered the ahi tuna, chicken adobo and the sea scallops. I also recommend this place to get a drink at night.

Ambiance is nice and drinks are still good (but overpriced). Service is excellent. My downgraded review is due solely to the lack of variety for vegetarian options. While the other meat entrees change over time, there has only ever been one vegetarian entree since 5Church opened: kimchi tofu. And it's not good at all.   PLEASE offer a new vegetarian entree!!
Pretty good I wouldn't say great but it's the type of place that is trying to push class yet the people have none. The staff does though . Also good on a sat night to find older women

Had a wonderful meal at 5Church for restaurant week! I had the scallops with citrus sauce that was amazing! The app of pork belly spring rolls was delicious with a tangy sauce. The dessert was a deconstructed chocolate mousse, sort of like a mousse but arranged in bits, crust, sauce & cream--across the plate. The scallops were my favorite!!

Not impressed at all!!   Sat at the bar for dinner.   5 bartenders and not one if them knew specials.  Vim style stood around and complained to each other.     The only time they were attentive was when it was time to pay.     Food is ok..  Far better choices in Charlotte...  My advice... Skip it..

I love the food here. I tried several of the items from the yelp event that was held on their opening and the mini crab cakes with quail eggs were GREAT! The sliders were also delicious as well and I went back to have a happy hour cocktail with a side of humas and it was fantastic as well.   The interior of this place is decorated in a very upscale manner and it for sure isn't a jeans and t-shirt type dining experience. As you enter there is a impressive wall of wine over the bar to the left and they have several tiers of seating areas throughout the restaurant. I hope they do well as they are located at the corner of 5th street and north church which, for whatever reason, seems to be a bit of a cursed spot for businesses in Charlotte.   The one downside is that the prices are a bit on the high side. They seem to have tried to price the menu out reasonably for the on-the-go downtown lunch crowd but dinner tops off at 20-30 a plate before you get into wine and drinks. But there again, the food is awesome so if you are looking to treat yourself to a great meal on a night out this would be the place to stop in.

Read the other reviews. Came with 4 kids and 4 adults for brunch .... Server was nice but extremely slow....food was ok. Best things where the fries and the donuts. We ordered 5 entrees to split. She messed up on the order... Food was well put together  but one note. Best was the lamb burger. Others where just ok and not hot. Suggest for the scene not for the service of food

I indicated that it was my birthday when I made the reservation. My mother also let the server Gabriel know that it was my birthday and all we got was a half smile. I watched as Gabriel checked on the two tables behind us to only walk by us after. At the end of the meal, after we paid, was when he finally acknowledged my birthday. If the restaurant does anything for birthday's I didn't receive it.   The food left a lot to be desired. I was excited to have brunch here having had a previously great experience for dinner with friends. I won't be returning. Diner style food at twice the price. The mimosas are cheap but so is the champagne and fake orange juice they use.   I should have had my birthday breakfast elsewhere ...   Visited 12/17/17

A group of us girls reserved the room upstairs to celebrate one of our colleagues going away party. Upon entering the restaurant we all commented on the inviting ambiance and eclectic decor. We were quite pleased with our choice! Our waitress, Alyssa, was cordial enough as we settled in for dinner and cocktails. All was going well until the end of the evening.That's when a chain of events began that left me running out the door, never to return again... and prompting this review. One of my employees had excused herself to visit the ladies room. Upon her return she mentioned that the floors were extremely slippery and she almost fell several times. She cautioned us to be careful. Shortly afterwards, my other employee was served a martini with a long stran of black hair. The drink was replaced, but no apologies or discounts were offered. In fact, Alyssa chuckled at the idea. I had then excused myself to visit the restroom and upon taking one step from my seat slipped on the floor and came crashing down, almost impaling my arm on a nearby chair. My entire body weight was hanging from the back of this chair! My staff rushed to my aid while the waitstaff stood in awe behind the bar. Mortified, I scurried along pretending to be fine while the pain in my arm progressly intensified. Alyssa was waiting at the table upon my return, but NOT to offer her apologies.  Only to inform me "that's why she's glad they get to wear Chucks because the floors are always so  slick" (mind you I was not in heels, nor intoxicated) and to communicate that she was only able to run 80% of my bill on the gift card I had presented for payment (I was awaiting a new debit card in the mail and only had a gc to pay). "It's something about restaurants and gifts cards. I dont know" was her response.  My employee was also given the same information. However, in fact 85% of my bill was charged to the gift card so this blew their theory out of the water and I'm left to think that the entire thing was a scam. We soon exited the restaurant, highly disappointed with the turn of events,  to fetch our valet and head home. A manager was never involved and I am in so much pain today that I'm considering visiting my doctor to examine my arm. I guess I just would have expected a bit more from an establishment that presents themselves to be upscale. Instead, I left $47 in the hole for a drink, a fried dough and a prawn that was so fishy I couldn't eat it, still hungry and writhing in pain. It's too bad that the focus got shifted away from the farewell party and on to the poor service.

Loved it!! We came in on the Grand Opening and we had such a nice time! The cocktails were great and we definitely had our share!! The decor is absolutely gorgeous and totally different from any other restaurant in Charlotte - a lot of money and attention was put into this place! All the different light fixtures were really eye catching and of course the ceiling with the whole book of The Art Of War on it- was really a nice touch!!   Onto the most important part for me- the food! We first started with the below and had coursed it out so it wasn't all at once:  Grilled Flat Bread w shrimp- Perfect, light and had great flavors! Bibb Lettuce- Nice and light  Mushroom Gnocchi- My Favorite of the night!! Cooked perfectly!! Crispy Szechuan Pork Belly- Crispy and delicious had a nice little crispy cabbage salad that it was served over St. Louis Style Toasted Mushrooms- were good!!  Indian Spiced Potato Pierogies- they had English Peas and Emulsion with them and they were really Tasty!!   For my Entree I had the Tokyo Noodle Soup- which had Crispy Pork, a Poached Egg and Veggies in a nice Smoky Broth- Delicious!! I honestly don't remember what the other two had, I was more focused on my food!!   Our Server was really nice and explained everything to us! The only bad thing I could say is that the music was a little too loud for dinner service they should hold off on putting it that loud until like 9 or later - I know i sound like an old lady but we found it difficult to hear the server or even runners when they dropped the food off- ok that's all I can think of this time I will be back soon!!
Atmosphere is very eclectic. I ordered the 3 egg omelet and was not a good value buy. Adding ingredients with the three is way too expensive. Overall the place is okay but I wouldn't come here again.

Arrived at the restaurant at 7pm for a 9pm reservation knowing me might not get seated before 9, but was worth a shot. Didn't mind sitting in the bar until 9 if we had to. BUT WAIT, at 9:15, no table, 9:30, no table, then at 9:45 we were seated at a small table in the bar and not in the restaurant! We could have sat there HOURS ago if we wanted. THEN when we confronted the owner Patrick Whalen, he told us to leave! He even ran to the back to hide while sending a bouncer out to remove us. Did I mention we are all women celebrating a 40th birthday and never stepped out of line? So we can't review the food, but the service, WAS HORRIBLE - along with the owner.

5Church is a really cool spot with good food and great ambiance.  I had the "Local Mixed Greens" and the "60 Seconds NY Strip Steak." The local mixed greens was a very nice starter salad with great fresh goat cheese. The 60 Second NY Strip Steak is probably the most uniquely prepared steak I have ever had. The steak is grilled to very very crispy on one side, is pink through the middle, and on the other side is left essentially not grilled (rather raw). This leads to a very unique flavor which pairs nicely with the BBQ sauce and grilled vegetables. I've honestly never had anything like it and was pleasantly surprised.  Overall, this is a very cool place with a hip vibe that would be perfect for a date or night out with friends. Would highly recommend this spot!

For appetizers Bread, meats and cheese 4 Meat balls 5 Octopus 5 I've never had octopus before. It tasted great but warning the texture is very chewy if you've never had it before Flat bread 3 standard flatbread with cheese   The meal was the lamb 5 As far as lamb goes it was great. I didn't love the horderves.   Lighting 2 it was dark Noise 5. Conversations were easily heard Service 4
Friendly bar staff and great craft cocktails. Stopped in for a cocktail to wrap a business meeting. I'm a fan of the Old Fashioned but 5Church's New-Fashioned was a interesting and pleasant change.

We had a delightful meal last night. The wait staff was knowledgeable about the menu. The steaks were cooked as ordered and very tasty. The lamb shank was juicy and delicious. The scallops were crisp on the outside and tender on the inside. Interesting decor, relaxed and enjoyable. They even made our special occasion worth celebrating w a big surprise!

Came for brunch. Ordered the salmon, which was could have been mistaken for pickled herring and the portion of fish was incredibly small. Then the waitress fought with me about how many $2.50 sangrias I drank. I won't be back any time soon.

5Church was a beautiful venue but the service and food were extremely mediocre. The prices were way too high for the amount of food received. For example, the wedge salad had literally 7 pieces of lettuce on the plate and it took the waitress nearly 20 min for an additional side of salad dressing. If you are looking for a nice meal, I would highly recommend researching different locations.

Okay this place was recommended to me by a colleague. I was told it was a fun Uptown restaurant with great food and drinks. It was a Wednesday night in Charlotte a few weeks ago and I got there around 7:30. It was pretty busy and I opted to sit at the bar and have dinner. I was in town on business and was there solo. There were a number of other solo diners at the bar that night.   I had the best server, Serena. She was very attentive to everyone at the bar that night. I could not decide between two wines and she offered samples of each. Then I had a delicious beet salad. For my main entree, I ordered a bolognese pasta. Though it looked yummy, the pasta was too al dente...basically crunchy. Serena asked me how I was enjoying my meal. I did not want to be difficult but I was hungry and I could not eat more than a few bites of the pasta. So I asked if if I could which it out for something else. She said yes. Next I got it exchanged for grilled octopus. Serena was so gracious and did not charge me for the pasta. Btw the octopus was so tasty and grateful it came out fairly quickly.   Definitely a big fan of the food, wine, and atmosphere but an even bigger fan of the service. Look forward to getting back there on my next visit to Charlotte.

Trendy, chic, but yet still having a chill approachable vibe.  Right in the middle of downtown and having a great variety of eats from $3-30 something.  I'm a fan.  The food is great and its a great place for groups.  I've never been somewhere where I can eat what I want and not feel guilty inviting my broke ass friends that need to eat on the cheap.  The whole right side of the menu is under $10 apps and $3-4 bites.  There is even a $13 lamb burger entree.  All the while you can get the "60 second" N.Y. Strip that apparently is one of the best steaks Bryant Gumble has had in a long time.  You will see the huge windows when walking up.  I'm not sure what you'll notice first when you walk in, but I love the ceiling.  Local artist Jon Norris(buddy of mine) painted Sun Tzu's art of war among a couple of other works up there.  Next, my eyes take me to the bar.  A long white marble looking bar that goes down the left side of the place and gives depth to the entrance.  The booze is fair priced for downtown and have no complaints with wine list, tap list, or cocktails.  Some good malbec's, Triple C's baby maker, and a "new-fashioned" being my fav's.  Anyhow, back to this place.  As I walked to my seat I went up a couple of stairs off to the right.  There are booths, regular seats and combo's of both.  More artwork as well.  Then here comes my waiter.  Spiffy white shirt and Chuck Taylor's.  NICE.  Yet again, trendy/chic but chill and maybe should I even say "laid back".  I mean that in a good way, our service was spot on.  As we were in a group and it was a friends birthday, I just ordered the whole right side of the menu.  I wanted an entree but my counterparts don't get out a whole lot, so I wanted them to try it all.  I knew I could snag a few bites off there plates anyhow.  Here we are, the food.  So close to being spot on, but not quite.  Everything was good, the mussels were really good.  Cheese and meat plates both great.  The regular salads, chic pea salads, and quinoa/tabouleh were some of the best bites per $ in town.  I even enjoyed the pierogies and gnocchi.  But it ends there.  The Szechuan pork belly did nothing for me.  While my counterparts loved there brined chicken so much that I didn't get a bite, I was underwhelmed by the lamb burger as well.  It seemed like the lamb wasn't that flavorful while the onion marmalade had too much worcester or A-1 even?  It wasn't bad, but what should I expect from an entree that is a third the price of many others.  It did have some potato logs, aka confit fries that had a mystery sauce.  Some kind of cumin, curry, something.  Need to take some of that home and figure out what it is.  Bottom line.  I need to go back, and do it often.  I know they can wow me.  I can feel it.  I just need to try it all and I'm sure I'll update with a 5 star review.

We had Brunch at 5Church and was impressed with everything from walking in to leaving. The building has a nice upscale look but still a comfortable place to relax and enjoy food.The all metal tree at the door is very impressive art work. Also the art on the walls was very different in a good way. I had the Shrimp & Polenta with a Bacon and Tomatoe Gravy. The tomatoe was a bit different for this type of dish and rounded out the smokiness of the bacon perfectly. Drinks were good as was the serive. The mgr made his way around to most tables and talked to most of the customers, which is always a nice touch. Would definately recommend and visit again

AMBIENCE Dimly lit, great for parties less than 8. Harder to accommodate many more given seating arrangements. The whole restaurant smells like a wet rag... I've been here for lunch a total of 5 times in the past few months and EVERY single time, it smells like a wet rag. Something should really be done about that. Service is great, the waitresses are super friendly. The kitchen is really off-and-on. Sometimes, the food is great. Sometimes, it's pretty terrible. I don't really understand why since I only come here for lunch and there are almost never more than ~25 people in the restaurant at one time.   LOCATION Off of Tryon kind of by Dandy, across the street from Basil Thai. Parking... I know nothing about. Sorry!   FOOD The food here is pretty good. There are things I like and things I hate. I've never chosen to come here... always seem to come here when Basil Thai is super packed and can't accommodate our party. Their lunch menu is strangely limited and the appetizers are listed on the wrong side of the page.   Fries - kind of oily but good. Sometimes, the fries are delicious. Sometimes, they come out stone cold.   Black bean hummus with pita - Get this. The black bean hummus is ultra-smooth and a strange purple-ish color but super delicious. The oil and tomatoes they add on top really add to the dish. The pita, again... sometimes cold and almost always stale when I've had them.   Jamaican chicken wraps - 2 mini wraps for just under $10?... this is a rip off and not worth it. Don't order it.    Chicken wrap - It's pretty good but again, nothing crazy. All sandwiches come with a side of fries.. (the menu sucks and doesn't mention this)   Ham and cheese - this sandwich is enough for 2 to share. It is HUGE. the bread is really thick and the amount of ham in there really makes it more than just some sandwich you make at home. It's buttered and grilled/toasted. Someone on our table ordered it and the bread was borderline burnt.

Love the atmosphere, which was lively and upbeat... Loved the service, our waitress was fabulous and able to advise us on food allergies and what was the best on the menu... Steaks were cooked perfectly... We were able to have a business conversation while enjoying the great food... All-in-all, delicious! I recommend the lettuce wraps for an appetizer (note: there are only 2) and steak/potatoes for dinner.

Dining alone while traveling for business can sometimes be less than fun. These folks made it an outstanding experience. Great atmosphere, and the friendly hostess and bar staff had awesome suggestions from the chef-driven menu that changes weekly.  I have some peculiar dietary restrictions and they made it very easy to have a phenomenal dining experience. And have Bret at the bar make you a Moscow Mule with your choice of bourbon rather than vodka.  Outstanding!  Will come here again and again when in Charlotte.  I eat out almost every night and this was, by far, the best dining experience I've had in a while in any city.

We stopped in for lunch on our last day in Charlotte and were happy with our selection.  The Great:   +  $10 lunch special - any sandwich (other than the lamb burger), fries and a drink.  I got the chicken souvlakia sandwich.  Delish.  The fries were crispy and fresh and the bottomless iced tea was a nice touch. +  Our server.  I don't remember her name, but she was short and blond and completely awesome.  Friendly, funny and helpful.  Boom.  The Average: o  It was a bit dark inside and with the place being so large it felt really empty.  Overall, a solid 4-star lunch experience.

This is a great restaurant for a nice elegant evening out.  Nice ambiance and decor, professional staff that knows the menu and specialties extremely well,  and delivers good service to boot.    The dishes offered have been consistently well reviewed by my guests,  from crab cakes to chicken to desert everyone has loved what they've ordered across the whole menu.  To complement the food they have an excellent bar with unique cocktails (my favorite is the viper a tequila cucumber-water and cayenne masterpiece).  I suppose I could ding them on price,  they aren't cheap,  but the overall experience makes it worth it for me.  Don't go in expecting an inexpensive meal.  Overall, I'll be back, and I will keep leverage five church in particular for our of town guests that have never visited Charlotte before to help drive a positive impression of our city - they help a great deal in that effort.

I met my girlfriends here for brunch Saturday afternoon.   I loved the interior. Especially the storybooks written on the celing! Very nice touch! However, I was a little underwhelmed by the brunch selection.  I started with the Bottomless Sangrias. Best part of the whole meal. I really loved that they included all kinds of fresh berries. Delish! I'd definitely recommend them.   For my meal I went with the Three Egg Omelet. For my three toppings I went with goat cheese, spinach and shrimp. Meh...it was just okay. It definitely wasn't as fluffy and as filled with toppings as I'd hoped for but it was edible.  I also substituted the home fries for french fries. That was not a good idea. They were not the best fries I've ever tasted. A bit crunchy and burnt not a good combination. I wouldn't order it again.   So two stars for the food, an extra star for the sangria. If I come back I'd like to try their dinner menu. But for me there are plenty of other places with better brunch options.
We have been here a few times for drinks and the staff just did not seem interested in serving us. We have not eaten here so can not really comment on the food.
Unique spot! Breakfast was great! The entire "Art of War" is painted on the ceiling. The French toast hit the spot and the coffee was served perfectly!

My husband and I went for Thanksgiving and the food was biblically tasty. The atmosphere, the service, the food quality and interior design is just NY in the Queen City. So wonderful! Go! Ignore people who don't give this place 5 stars.

Not super impressed with 5 Church - it doesn't hold much of a candle to some of the better, more unique and local restaurants in Charlotte.  I've been to 5 church on three different occasions and each time I've left saying "it was ok." Most recently, I had the jerk chicken lettuce wraps for an appetizer, which had a poorly matched ratio of chicken to lettuce - needed more meat! For dinner, I had their lamb burger, which sounded great with the gorgonzola cheese and arugula. The crispy confit potato just didn't work for me, and though I asked for medium, the burger came out medium well. The sesame bun looked pretty but didn't taste fresh. The service wasn't great and though we didn't wait long for a table, the service for food and even drinks was relatively slow.   I think the space in 5church has so much potential. It's a great spot for lunch meetings and the bar and inside is beautiful! I have been here for group events as well (large birthday parties), and I do have to say they did handle the large group well. I think their main attraction is the inside space area. I just think they have a little ways to go on their food.

Heard this is a hotspot in downtown Charlotte so checked it out on a recent visit. Was not at all disappointed.  Very friendly and organized front of the house despite a very loud and slightly chaotic open concept bar and dining area. We were a bit early so started at the bar. I had the "new" fashioned, which was good but not any better than a well made "old" fashioned.  We ordered the tasting menu with wine pairings which was delightful, and added a couple of extra courses so we could have some items not on the tasting menu. Only slip up was that I asked for the Tokaji instead of the moscato for the dessert course, and they gave me the moscato anyway.  Lot of good options in Charlotte, but I will be happy to visit 5Church again.

Just left brunch at 5 church. We loved the cozy atmosphere, delicious food, and great service. We left our card at the table and Kevin sprinted down the street to return it. Class act establishment. Overall great experience!

ONLY reason I didn't leave a 5 star is the noise. This place is so loud. Granted I did come on a Friday night. Shout out to our server Michelle. Awesome service for being busy. New fashion cocktail had crushed walnut on the rim tasted like cherry pie. The viper was a nice alternative from the really sweet cocktails. We had the Waygu ribeye, lamb burger, pork belly spring rolls and gnocchi. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. I'd highly recommend the Gnocchi.

Food was good, however the ambiance made it a bit unpleasant.  We were seated right by the door (on one of those 15 degree January nights) and had to wear our coats the entire meal.  Service was very slow, and we were shivering by the end!  We had a reservation and watched as they set a table up for us right by the door...I wouldn't really recommend this restaurant, it wasn't worth having to be so cold for an entire meal.  I've definitely had better food and service else where in Charlotte.

Another one of those places a lot of 20 something's go to because they think it's cool.  Food is very average, service was great and the ambiance was pretty cool.  Not upset about this place just had my hopes a lot higher.   Here is why.....  Lamb burger was recommended by the staff so I got it and it was GREAT.  Szechuan pork belly was unflavored fried pork belly strips with a decent shredded lettuce type bite on the side.  It was not bad but nothing I'd order again.  Tomato soup was almost flavorless and had ONE small piece of fried cheese or something (I forget).  It was also warm, not hot and when I order soup it should come HOT.  Pierogis tasted decent but weren't bursting with flavor at all.  Gnocci was actually pretty crappy and didn't have a good solid texture at all.   I would never go back here unless someone else was offering to pay.

Eggs benny. Fries. Coffee.  Color me happy. My brunch at 5Church was a solid meal with friends. I loved my crab cakes benedict, which had some sort of magical jalapeno hollandaise sauce for dipping. The fries were tasty, but the order was a little small, and most of the fries seemed to be broken little nubbins instead of the nice long fries everyone really wants.   Negatives: One of my friends said her omelette had an "obscene" amount of butter, and another friend ordered the special meat pie only to find that her entire meal was about the size of a sand dollar. Service was also disappointing -- we had to wait forever for our bill, for ketchup, and for attention in general. But my meal was so good that I'll give it a pass this time. Maybe they were just swamped that day?  The bottom line for brunch at 5Church is this: Expect good food, but don't expect a huge meal unless you order a few items, and be prepared for a long meal because service ain't speedy.

5Church has good food, but a very limited menu, and but the service is horrible. I have been there several times and it's always the same. Three of many examples:   1. Workday lunch: hostess aloof, got a table, sat down for 10 minutes, no one came over even to get us drinks. Got up and left and no one noticed. They weren't busy it was before the rush  2. Another workday lunch: Came again before the rush at 11:30. In fact I was the FIRST customer. I sat down and no one came to say hello or get my drink order for nearly 10 minutes until I got tired of waiting and went to the bar and complained. At the same time, a large group came in AFTER me, and the server got their drink orders and drinks and took their order for their meal.  3. Drinks and small plates: I went there for drinks and small plates with a group of friends one evening. The food and drinks were good, but took forever and half the time we had to get up and get drinks from the bar instead of our server.

Had a girls night out at this restaurant. The food was excellent and artfully prepared and presented.  Service was slow.   We were supposed to go to a show but hadn't even received our food so we cancelled the show and decided to linger and make 5 church the evening, which turned out great anyway because our company was great and ambiance at 5 church is awesome sexiness.  I had ordered a bottle of prosecco for the table to make a toast, but never was asked if I'd like a glass of something with dinner.  At some point our server acknowledged his lack of attention and made a good effort to redeem himself after entrees.   Last point... Dessert here is a culinary achievement!  Don't pass up on it!  Skip your 300 calorie latte after lunch and save room for dessert!  It is worth it !.. I had the espresso mousse with chocolate sorbet.  Ah. Mazing!

Great Service, Great food. I came here when my parents came to visit. We wanted a nicer dinner and were not disappointed. I did their one of a kind 60 second steak. They sear it in a really hot pan for 60 seconds. I typically like my steak med-rare, I wasn't sure how I was going to feel about having one side of my steak completely uncooked. The texture wasn't not bad like I expected. It tasted like a med rare steak and is cool to look at.   The best thing I had however was the s'mores dessert. It tasted like a fresh s'more. The down side was it wasn't warm like the real thing. I would go back just for the dessert.

I went on a Friday night during restaurant week and tried the: 1 - pork belly appetizer - delicious but tiny  2 - tofu and edamame succotash entree - pretty good but the tofu was a little bland and the sauce a bit heavy for the yummy fresh veggies  3 - banana walnut dessert - yummm, nice sea salt touch  4 - side of potatoes - not good.   My dinner mate LOVED her NY strip.   The bread has some sort of cheese in it - ok, but a little strange.   The noise volume is OUT OF CONTROL! But matches the very cool and trendy ambiance - nicely decorated.    The service is decent - attentive but a little slow.   I would recommend as a place to see and be seen uptown but not necessarily the best food I've ever had.

Went here last Sunday fro brunch with my family. There was no wait, and the service was good. I usually got at night for dinner but the brunch was nice. The bottomless mimosa and sangria are a nice topping to the unique brunch menu.

We really enjoyed this restaurant. It has a great upscale casual ambience. Although there is lots of conversation, it is not noisy so you can't have your own conversation The food was excellent, very tasty, and the presentation was perfect. I had ahi tuna, and my wife had steak. The waitstaff is very helpful and attentive. This experience is well worth the visit.

I came to 5church with a party of 11 today for Brunch.  My family was celebrating Father's day for three fathers and my Mother's Birthday.  I have been to 5 church in the past and have enjoyed the food and the service, which is why I was excited to share the experience with my family and friends.  Unfortunately the experience was not pleasant.  After waiting 30 minutes to have our order taken, it took more than an hour for our food to be served.  When it arrived many of the items were lukewarm and most included items that were not ordered (ex. three people ordered homefries but got french fries instead)  In addition, when I mentioned this to the manager she indicated that she would check on it but never came to the table to offer an apology or ask about our experience.  It was a really disappointing brunch experience.

5Church is my kind of church, I could see myself being in the congregation every Sunday.  Shrimp & grits, breakfast pizza and crabcakes with poached eggs. Yes, can I get an Amen?  Pastor Chef Jamie is kicking ass.  Of course, Sunday isn't complete without bloody marys or mimosas, bases covered.

Went to this place for a conference. I read reviews that said a lot of people struggled with finding the restaurant because of location & it's true. If it wasn't for me being hyper vigilant I probably would have missed it. We got there before 6 & valet wasn't working yet so we parked in a parking deck a 5 minute walk away & it was only $6. The restaurant is beautiful and a really fun place to go out with friends. I started with the 'Bibb Wedge' salad, which was good there was a sweet dressing on the salad I wasn't too crazy about. For my main meal I had the Filet Mignon with crushed potatoes and the chef specialty sauce. I got my meat cooked medium well & it came out just that way. The food was really good I just wasn't feeling the sauce because maybe I was expecting A1 but the sweetness threw me off. I like to separate the savory and the sweet (obviously). For desert I had the S'mores Trifle which was delicious! The presentation of the desert was beautiful & it was the perfect amount. The brownie (?) part of the bar was really good & chocolate-y. I couldn't finish everything so I had to take it home. I hope to visit this place again soon.

Went for a company dinner and ordered the New York strip. In their defense, they did describe how it was cooked (only on one side) and told me people loved it that way. That it was a technique they used there. Ordered it medium rare. It came out raw on the top. And burnt on the bottom. The top, uncooked part was cold and raw. Absolutely disgusting. And for $39? No thanks.   Also, none of their wines have vintages on the menu. If you're at all a wine drinker, this would drive you crazy.  Cool looking space, but food and drink falls short big time. Everyone in my group agreed that we wouldn't recommend his place to any of our friends.

The food was a-ok, but the service was not. For the price-point (dinner entrees ranging from $16 - $34) I expected much better service and really outstanding food.  For me, this is an ok place to stop in for a couple of drinks & appetizers with friends if you are in no hurry, but for serious dining, it is not my first choice.

Really love this place! The vibe and decor is great for a special occasion or just for date night. The drinks are good, but a little pricey. The food can be beat. I've never had anything I didn't like here, but the crab cakes and the lamb burger are personal favorites. It's not the kind of place that you would order a takeout plate from, as much of the appeal is from the ambiance, but definitely a spot to try in Charlotte. And, if you're into the club scene, it gets much more "see and be seen" on Saturday nights after 10pm. Plus complimentary valet!

Visiting Charlotte on business. Asked hotel front desk clerk where can I find good seafood and a good beer. He pointed me to this spot. Not bad. It was nearly empty on a Sunday evening which I thought was unusual, but not familiar with Charlotte so maybe people stay home and cook Sunday's. ? Anyway, they had upbeat music playing. I sat at the bar. The bartender was really nice, knowledgeable, and helpful. I had a local draft beer, the beet salad and the yellowfin tuna. Good eats. Not superb, but good...and reasonably priced. Curious to know what the experience would be like on a busy night.

Went for brunch and it was delightful. The entire atmosphere is beautiful and clean. Our waiter was so knowledgeable on every aspect that we really didn't even need menus. While it is pricey, for the true uptown dining experience, it is worth it.

My boyfriend lives a block away so we used to come here a lot when he first moved to Charlotte. Over time, we asked ourselves what the heck we were doing. We now walk right on by and go almost anywhere else for a meal. The first time we went to 5Church the host was bragging to us about how many famous people and athletes dine here. We couldn't care less but it was hilarious nevertheless.   5Church's main problem is that they think they're something they're not. Pretentious is an understatement. The think they are Cut in Las Vegas when in reality they are a trendy version of Outback. If they can get a reality check and lower their prices and make their food taste better, it would be better for everyone. Another problem is it's too loud and crowded. It's more of a bar than a restaurant. But the food isn't any better at off peak times.   Onto the food: overpriced, overhyped, not good. The only good dish on the menu for dinner is a steak if it's cooked well. The only reasonable choice on their menu for lunch is the lamb burger. I've tried about half of the dishes.   Last time we came here was for brunch (party of 4) and none of our meals were even edible. I'm not overreacting. The charcuterie plate was ok actually but that's where it ended (and it's hard to mess up sliced cheese!). It's a shame because the descriptions sounded so good on the menu but just didn't translate in reality.   5Church is probably a good place to pick up drunk girls on the weekend, but that's about it. If you're coming for dinner, keep walking half a block and Capital Grille is on the left. You'll get a much better meal for the same price.

With all the hype surrounding 5Church, I expected more, but sadly, I was let down. And I should preface this review by saying I am not a fan of grossly upscale restaurants with high prices. So if you're like me, then read on...if you're not, you may want to save a few minutes & read another review. ;)  Dion L., Katie M., Simone M. & myself dined here on a busy Wednesday night. Dion had made us 7 PM reservations, which I was glad to say they kept that time.  First impressions: the place is pretty well laid out, with two bars - one in the front of the restaurant & I believe I saw another one in the back area. VERY loud - wouldn't advise bringing a first date here.  Also, the darker it got outside, the darker it got inside. Additionally, you had the blinding lights from traffic outside, since the majority of the restaurant is surrounded by windows.  This was a bit annoying, especially when two cop cars rolled by.  Not sure what the theme they're going for in there, but there's lots of gray/silver & fancy lighting fixtures. Waiters & waitresses are dressed down, mainly in grays & blacks. It was clean inside & they're pretty quick to clear off used plates.  The menu itself is somewhat limited. I would argue to say they have more wine, beer, & liquor choices than they do food items.  Due to being on a budget, we all decided we weren't going to ball out on our meals.  While our waitress gave us all recommendations & laid out how big "first courses" & "snacks" were, she was way off base with what I decided upon.  I asked about the fresh angel hair pasta (first course at $10), to which she said it could feed two people. I was really hungry, so I ordered that, along with the crisp Szechuan pork belly with spicy cabbage (snack at $4). For the snack, the waitress said it would feed one.  Dion & Katie ordered a first course & snacks.  Simone ordered the lamb burger.  We waited quite a bit for our food, which was a bit annoying since Dion was on her dinner break from work. Finally our food arrived & I was a bit disappointed.  The pasta was in a small bowl, with an even smaller portion of pasta, five cherry tomatoes, & 2 medium sized shrimp. That was not enough for two people.  The pasta tasted OK...the angel hair was heavy on the wheat taste.  The pork belly & cabbage was pretty good. The pork belly was crispy & cooked thoroughly. It indeed was only enough for one person. The girls were ok with their choices, although Simone did comment that her lamb burger seemed to be bigger when she had it there for brunch one day.   While we ate, our waitress was kind of scarce, but as we were finishing up our meal, she came by quite frequently. Luckily, Dion had time to finish her meal and pay her bill.   At the end of our meal, we decided this spot is better suited for drinks & a snack...not full on dining.

Finally made it in for dinner! We've been jonesin' to try this place after hearing about it from friends and other Yelpers. It was slammin' on a Wednesday night around 8pm and the food, drink and conversation was flyin' all around. Every seat at the bar was filled, all of the high-tops, the lounge areas and pretty much every table. Definitely one of the premier places to check out.   The art throughout the restaurant totally makes you think twice, buffalos and cherry blossoms, really strange lamps, incredible ornate wing-shaped lampshades over the bar and sweet mural of a $5 bill in the upstairs. The best, by far, is the steel tree near the hostess stand. It really stands out and blends well with the rest of the decor. It doesn't stop there. Check out the ceiling tiles. The ENTIRE book of the The Art of War is painted on them. Yep. I said it. You'll have to see if for yourself. So crazy.   We started with the pirogies and goat cheese with spinach. Both were fantastically flavorful and perfect for a table of two. Pirogies were almost like Indian samosas with the spices inside. The dough was flaky and had a slight chew. The pea mixture on bottom was to die for. Definitely both worth getting again!  Wow. 5Church still has me astounded and still trying to find the right words for the "60-Second" Steak. I can barely describe the difference in texture from rare steak to crunchy, crispy and perfectly seared bottom. Each bite was a perfect savory balance hit with the tangy, malty, barbecue-y steak sauce resting at the bottom of the plate. I don't order steak, pretty much ever, but this has stolen my steak-loving heart. Goodness gracious, it was incredible. A fantastic NY Strip. I'm still having daydreams about it.   The staff hoofs it. Up the stairs and then back down. Huge trays, drinks, server books...they never stop moving. All with a smile and very knowledgeable.   Can't wait to visit again! Chef Jamie and the team really have something going here. Totally chic and swanky but with a casual appeal. Bravo, gents. My hat's off to you for a fantastic evening of flavor and fun.

So 800 plus of my colleagues are visiting the QC for our annual Chef's conference.  An old friend and chef asks us to join her at 5 Church on a Tuesday night at 7.  I'm looking forward to catching up and trying this place for a second time, since the first was for lunch and was just okay. We were escorted to our table on time.  The waiter did some research on our friend and creepily told her where she was from, who she worked for and what she did for a living.  He up-played that she was also a chef and that he had high expectations of himself to serve her. (Is it getting smoky in here?). He then told us his work biography, like why should we be hearing this? So I asked what the specials were for the night. He left to get beverages. I really like the chairs at the tables. They do not look comfortable but they are nice. Our waiter told us about portion sizes and servings for apps, and was very knowledgable. We enjoyed the pieroghis, though the dough was a bit thick; the hummus was just that; and the pork belly sliders were tender but too much bread.  Would have been better a top of a crouton and called an open faced slider.  We placed our order for entrees. My wife and our friend ordered a salad with country ham; I order duck in mole sauce.  A little slow in service but the salads are served in less than 10 minutes.  They are kindly waiting for my entree to start eating but no entree!  After 5 more minutes our server apologizes to us stating he did not fire my entree but will be right out.  A total of 20 minutes pass and they serve me.  Strangely it looks nothing like duck or any sign of mole sauce.  Of course no one to be found to ask so I tell the others to please start eating and, embarrassed, go find my server who is talking to the manager.  I tell them that they served me the wrong item and that I did not want to cause a scene in front of our friend/host, and to please just remove the entree w/o any questions.  They pleaded with me that they will have the duck served immediately with apologies.  I cave in.   Upon returning to the table my wife and friend stopped eating; my duck was served.  They said the salad tasted like some one had shaken a salt shaker over it(and both of them love country ham).  My entree was luke warm.  Manager told us that they would comp my entree.  When the bill was presented to our host, it was not taken off the bill. No desserts ordered. Spoke to the manager when leaving and gave him my business card.  Never heard a thing from him.  Would have been a nice touch inviting back for something to be hospitable. Went home for snacks. Lucky they got 3 stars. You take your chances if you go there.

This review is for their kiosk at the Charlotte Christmas Village in Romare Bearden Park.  Firstly, the Christmas Village itself is downright depressing and disappointing, not that many people. Having said that, there weren't that many people on line at the 5Church vendor.   So, 5Church should be glad that they actually had a small line queuing up for their bratwurst. But when it was my turn to order, the young lady taking my orders had an attitude, seemed displease, and felt as if I was intruding in her time. She just shoved the bratwurst and sauerkraut I ordered to me. And when I asked for mustard, basically just threw it at me with no eye contact and thank you. (Nice Christmas Spirit and Southern hospitality.) This after talking to what seemed like forever to the other people in front of me, even offering them mustard after their order and giving them a lot of mustard in mini-cups. But me? Just one. And I practically had to beg for it. And I gave a 20% tip on my card. If I would've gotten the food and service first before paying, I should've left No Tip. But I always tip..  Regardless, I don't know the five churches to where they derive their name from, but based on my experience at their Christmas Village kiosk, seems like the five churches in 5Chrurch are where The Grinch, Scrooge, the Anti-Christ, Beelzebub, and Lucifer reign.They should name their business the 666Church.   You're a mean one Miss 5Church. You're a nasty wasty skunk. Your heart is full of unwashed socks. Your soul is full of gunk,Miss 5Church.You're a three-decker sauerkraut, and toadstool wurst, with arsenic sauce!   Pathetic!  *****UPDATE***** So, I got a "compliment" from Joanne S (of University City, Charlotte, NC https://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=Ki1UVO0eP9qmoyugKPqNKQ), on Christmas Eve I must add, saying: "Get over yourself. Your complaining about an 8 dollar sandwich. Oh wait a 9.60 sandwich after your 20% tip"  Firstly, I didn't just purchase a sandwich.  Secondly, regardless, how much does one have to spend at your blessed business for one to be treated with respect as a customer and without the contempt and attitude from you or any of the 5Church staff?  Lastly, thank you for confirming of your disdainful attitude and 5Church's supercilious standpoint on running its business.  And a Merry Christmas to you too. At least the Grinch and Scrooge had a change of heart after realizing their immodest ways.

Reviews for 5Church seem to be all over the map, and so I was a bit hesitant to make a reservation for a Labor Day weekend dinner with the family.  Well, let me tell you something, 5Church is incredible!  Between their unique contemporary vibe, impeccable service, and perfectly executed dishes, I declared the evening epic success.    When I made our reservation on Open Table, I specifically requested a table in a quieter area of the restaurant, as I heard that it can become very loud.  The noise wasn't any problem at all when we arrived at 7pm, but some louder music with a heavy bass made the restaurant notably loud around 8:30pm.  Still though, we were able to have conversations without feeling as though we were yelling.  For appetizers we shared the cheese plate and mixed greens salad.  Our waiter offered to split the salad three ways and we were impressed by the portion size of each plate.  The marinated mushrooms, dressing, and cheese are a great combination.  The cheese plate came with three generous sized wedges of cheddar, blue, and feta cheeses, along with tons of olives, a beet pesto, olive tapenade, and candied raisins.  My only complains would be that the "fresh" bread basket they serve was not at all impressive, tasting either stale or just simply not good.  Our entree selections included NC Grouper, Wasabi Crusted Salmon, and Lamb Burger.  The grouper was served over a bed of succotash, popcorn shoots, and a red pepper emulsion.  It was very fresh, light, and generously portioned.  The salmon dish was nothing short of perfection.  The combination of the wasabi crust, rich miso emulsion, seaweed salad, and bok choy left us savoring each and every bite.  Finally, the lamb burger with it's grilled onion marmalade earned lots of oohs and ahhs.  At just $13, it's certainly a steal of a deal.    Since the entire meal had been incredible, we couldn't help but order dessert.  We shared the S'mores selection swooned with each bite.  Think warm decadent chocolate cake, crystalized fudge sauce, and homemade marshmallow.  Again - a huge portion that is easy to share between several at the table.

I struggle between giving 5Church 2 or 4 stars.  5Church has the potential to be a great restaurant; it has a great vibe, found in a charming location, and entrees riddled with flavor.  But some days the kitchen struggles and outright fails to provide a quality and consistent experience.  Furthermore, a good night might be derailed by a waitstaff that seems to disappear hours on end.   Will I go back? Probably.  Should you go? Probably.   ...but you've been warned. You may receive a 4 star night or a 2 star one, it just depends on the whims of the kitchen and the waitstaff.

Finally made it to 5Church after hearing a lot about the food and ambiance.  Add me to the list of people that are a fan of this place.  Went to lunch with a coworker.  First impressions are very good - comfortable, cool decor, a clear artistic vibe with local artists paintings and the text of "Art of war" on the ceiling.  Service was excellent from beginning to end.  Had the grilled prosciutto di parma, which delivered on all fronts - fresh mozzarella, tomatoes full of flavor, all surrounded by grilled white bread that was perfectly chewy on the inside.  It went from good to great with the balsamic served on the side.  In addition, had the tomato soup, which was quite killer.  Pure tomato puree, no cream, just tons of fresh flavor.  Had a taste of my coworkers lamb burger - perfectly cooked and tasty.    All in all, a great lunch spot (prices are very reasonable for the quality of the food and experience).  Looking forward to returning for dinner, may have to evaluate my rating and move to 5 starts if that experience delivers as well.

I love it here! 1) The place is sooo beautiful! You can tell there was a lot of love, sweat and care put into the design of the space, just look up. There's no other environment like it in Charlotte. 2) The service staff is great. I was greeted pleasantly by the hostess up front as I walked in the door. My server was friendly and on point all night. Justin was amazing and funny! The bar service was also fast (which means a lot to me, haha) and we didn't wait long for food. I really enjoyed the chickpea salad and black bean hummus. 3) I love that there's a late night menu, so that I don't have to resort to going to a bar or a diner if I want to eat a meal at midnight. I can't wait for them to open for lunch!  Seriously, you need to go into 5Church or you will miss out on something great. I am so excited for Charlotte to have a beautiful and refreshing restaurant as such. As one of the few, an actual Charlotte native, it make me proud to see such a great establishment right in the heart of my city. 5Church is here to stay people, the second you walk in the door you will see.

What a gem of a place. Service was great and the food phenomenal. We had a spinach salad - delicious and fresh. Then we had a 60 second steak. OMG! One of the tastiest most innovative steaks I've had in a long time and Chef's version of A-1 was A+. The lamb burger was outstanding. It comes with hand cut fries that were fantastic. Chef also sent a complimentary hummus and house made crackers - we were appreciative of such a nice gesture. We stayed at the Ivey's and couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel and the food! Charlotte, you are lucky to have such great food and wonderful Hotel.

5Church has three locations, and I have been to two (Atlanta and Charlotte). I've never been disappointed. Their brunch and dinner menus are incredible. I highly recommend their 60 second steak. The interior gives a calming prohibition style vibe and is very welcoming. I find that service is slower at brunch, but nothing too bad. Great dining option for business dinners as well. They are also available for party rentals.

Had an incredible meal tonite at 5Church. Charred octopus & wasabi crusted tuna were delicious. Both dishes could be good but loved the added nuance that made these dishes great. The spice that pushed the octopus to another level & the wasabi crust on the tuna elevated an otherwise plain piece of tuna; yummy with that flavorful seaweed salad. Then there was dessert. I am not a sweet eater but hubby ordered the red velvet cake. The contrast of the salted pistachios w/ the cake was divine. Now to service. A+. From the friendly hostesses to the manager checking on tables. A special treat was our waitress Cathrine. Friendly & to top it off we once both lived on the same street in Chevy Chase, MD!  Loved that the hostess offered to take our ticket out to the complimentary valet while we paid the bill. No waiting.  A perfect evening for our 22nd wedding anniversary. Can't wait to return.

Went to 5Church with a buddy after a 5K one evening.  As this was my first time there, I was unsure what to expect.  I had heard lots about this new, jumping, spot Uptown, but the descriptions were always a bit vague as to why exactly it was so good... ....well allow me, if I may, to go into some detail about what exactly makes 5Church pop...  ...First, the service;  its top notch.  Our server was extremely pleasant and polite and she was very understanding of the fact that we were with a hodgepodge group of friends and that people were ordering food and drinks at all different times.  Yet and still, she was on-point with the service and she was very accurate with the checks at the end of the night as well - no problems splitting the check.  She was quick to refill drinks or to ask if we needed more adult beverages, which of course we always did.  Second, the food.  The food was excellent.  We split the "Bacon Pizza" as an appetizer.  It tasted very fresh, and made to order.  It was thin slice/flat bread, which I am not normally a fan of, but the bacon really made the pie explode in my mouth (That's what she said, LOL).  For my main course, I ordered the Grilled Hanger Steak.  The words savory and exquisite come to mind when I think about the Hanger Steak  It was cooked perfectly, and had a wonderful grilled, smokey flavor to it.    Third, the uniqueness.  Though they had plenty of tables, my buddy and I sat on leather couches with the rest of our friends and had a very enjoyable dinner.  I have never been to an establishment that married the lounge/tapas vibe with that classy, restaurant taste, and service, as well as 5Church.    I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for something different, and a little hipper than you standard, upscale steakhouse.

I went to meet some friends Uptown for drinks and dinner at this really cute place.   We got there earlier than one of our party and spent some time in the bar area. It had lots of seating and good specialty drinks. I really liked The Metropolitan and The Wildberry Mojito (try them if you like tart and sweet drinks)  We were seated at a nice little table and ordered our apps - Appetizers that I liked - the cheese plate and the hummus, both were really good.  We ordered dinner and I had a wedge salad and a Lamb Burger. Now the salads were less than impressive, but I loved the Lamb Burger! Really yummy.  The fries that come with it are huge and really flavorful.  The sauteed green beans are amazing as a side - I would totally order those instead of a salad.  The dessert menu had just been changed for winter - so we decided to try a few of them. I really liked the sorbet and the marshmallow parfait (I can't remember it's exact name) but it had chocolate and creme in a glass. OMG - so good.  We ended with Cappuccinos.. nice and foamy..   Over all, a very good experience. I will update on my next trip.   Oh and they have complimentary valet as well. That is always a plus.

Had lunch here a couple days ago.  Excellent atmosphere, comfortable.  Casual service in an upscale surrounding.  I had the beet slides, great meal, good size for a lunch.  They served pickled vegetables on the side, very good.  Prices appeared reasonable.  Lunch partners had a crab cake sandwich and lamb burger, both looked good.

This was my first time at 5church, but we wanted a nice meal while some co-workers were visiting in town. I have heard great things, but it was still different than expected.   The atmosphere is very upscale, romantic and intimate, so it was a little weird to be with a large group of co-workers while couples had romantic dinners next to us, but that's not the restaurants fault.
