The menu is a little sparse and many of the options were the same types of meat. There was only one chicken dish and one vegetable dish. I typically stay away from red meat so I had to settle on one of the two. I went with the chicken. OH MAN. So to be honest, I didn't eat a ton of the chicken because I got so side-tracked by the deliciousness of the rice that accompanied it. I have no idea what it was, but it was different and better than anything I had ever tasted.   I will also say, one coworker ordered a side of Brussel sprouts and another coworker attempted to order another one and the waitress told us that it was enough for the whole table. We had 6 people and it definitely was not. When the first order came out we put in an order for a second. The two orders were prepared entirely different. The first just roasted and seasoned and the second were roasted with a sweet glaze. Don't know what happened there.

First impression: WHOA BOUGIE, HIP, CLASSY, WOW.  The entire space was just so lively and I love how the decor was specially designed for the restaurant itself. I love the seats, it was just so cozy and very different!   We came for brunch, so I ordered the Crab Cakes and Poached Eggs. The presentation is stunning! The crab cakes were much smaller than I had expected them to be. It needed a little bit more salt because there was (I believe spinach) in the dish too (btw I LOVED THAT). I tried a little bit of the waffles from my cousin and she said it tasted like Christmas, and it legit TASTED LIKE CHRISTMAS.   Our waiter was super friendly, kinda awkward but that made it interesting. It was a nice place to enjoy brunch and wasn't too crowded when I went!
pasta size is very big! Charred octopus is spicy and salty. Broiled oysters are only two oysters.

OK - I'm upping my rating because brunch at 5Church is great. I had the crab cakes with poached eggs. I love crab and I love eggs and these two worked so well together.  The eggs were perfectly poached - the perfect amount of runny-ness.   The mimosa was great.  They have bottomless mimosas for $12 but I didn't partake in that because I probably wouldn't know when to stop - but that's a great deal!  I'm glad to be won over by 5Church by their brunch - the ambiance is great and makes for an enjoyable Sunday.

One of the best bars I have been into! What a gem for Charlotte! I was in town for 3 days and this was hands down the best bar we went to.  The decor and ambiance you can not beat. Love love loved the hand painted ceiling! And the chandeliers and paintings were all very fitting with the decor. They played great music! And it was just music over a speaker and it was better then the live DJ we saw earlier in the night and the live band we saw the night before. We even made our own dance floor.  The drinks were great! I had everything from a martini to a Margherita to a Moscow Mule and they were all delicious and well priced. Nothing was over priced like all the other bars in Charlotte. I unfortunately did not eat here but after looking at the menu I wish I would have. Will definitely return to try out the food.  The service was the best part! Everyone was so attentive. They were so busy but we still never waited longer then 3 minutes to get a drink. We talked to 3 different bartenders and they were all great. Even the back of bar staff was friendly and noticed we were standing and tried to help us with seats without us even asking! Can't beat the location either it was right beside my friends apartment in a great neighborhood downtown.

I visited this restaurant on opening night so I was prepared for potentially sub par service and slip ups. Not the case! Our waitress was extremely knowledgeable about all the menu items as well as the restaurant overall and continually checked on us to make sure all was well.  The food at 5Church also exceeded expectations. The lamb burger was incredibly juicy and flavorful with a hint of maybe Indian or Mediterranean flavors and the gnocchi (a small plate appetizer item) was so rich and creamy - without a doubt the best I've ever had. Menu items in general seem to be well-executed dishes with a twist.   The ambiance is modern and trendy. A great spot for a special occasion. The bottom floor has tables, a bar area and a large shared high top table seating. The upstairs loft area has lounge areas and an additional bar for the late night crowd.

I've come here on multiple occasions and I've had the lamb burger, filet mignon & the pan roasted Tile fish. The lamb burger was cooked well, but way over seasoned. It was way too salty that I couldn't enjoy each bite I took. The filet was cooked to perfection. It was tender and almost melted like butter. Now the tile fish blew me away. I've personally never had tile fish, and this was my first time really ordering fish at a restaurant since I'm not a huge fan of seafood. However it was amazing. It was a little crispy on the outside and the inside was soft and light. I thoroughly enjoy coming here for dinner as well as coming here to grab drinks every weekend before heading to the epicenter

Yes, I am a sucker for trendy and hip d√©cor! And, "YES!"  It was the feathery light fixture photos on yelp pulled me in. lol! Of course the food has to be good too. The reviews were mostly good so here I am :)  As soon as I walked in, I knew we were under dressed. It said "casual" under "more info" on yelp so I thought jeans and a sweater was okay. Before she even sat us down, I knew we were going to get a not-so-wonderful table.  We were sat in the bar area at the very end within a stone's throw (more like a toss) of the bathrooms. Sigh. We passed a couple empty bar tables that were in the middle of the bar section on the way to our seats. Most people were in business attire since it was 5:30 and they probably just came straight from work. I griped a little about our seating but the bf didn't think it was a big deal so we stayed put. Note to self: when in doubt, dress it up a little if you want to get a nice table.  Restaurant industry people, is that how it goes? But honestly, I hate getting dressed up :/  Jeremiah was our waiter and he was very friendly and attentive. I also liked how other waiters and Mark, who I will assume was the manager, came around and filled our waters and checked on us as well. Whenever I dine out, I also usually notice if/when waiters seem disappointed when customers don't order alcohol (more drinks, bigger bill, larger tip). I didn't notice any change in their attitude when we declined cocktails (we're trying not to drink during the week). The service was solid throughout the whole meal. They were perfect!  I ordered the prime grilled bistro steak with horseradish mashed potatoes and glazed vegetables ($27) and he ordered the wasabi encrusted salmon with bok choy ($19). My dish was good but not spectacular. The bf's dish was exceptional. I wish I had ordered his dish. I have been burnt out on salmon for a couple years now but the wasabi and miso flavors made it superb and I would jump back on the salmon train (or is boat more appropriate? lol) for it. Don't get me wrong. I liked my dish and it was GOOD but it was nothing compared to the salmon. I also think it was a bit heavy for me with the potatoes. I think I would've liked it more if it had more vegetables. We ended the meal with the vanilla cr√®me brulee ($8) with berries for dessert.  I can't end my review without talking about the d√©cor. Definitely my kind of place. I loved all the light fixtures and art. And those feathery light fixtures above the bar ARE beautiful. The photos on yelp don't do it justice. Don't forget to look up at the ceiling. I love the little details. We sat on the wooden high tables in the bar. Next time I want to sit at the black leather button tufted booth or the tables with the clear acrylic chairs. I guess I'll have to wear my Sunday best so I can sit there when I try their brunch one of these weekends...and I'll order cocktails for sure! ;)

I always have great service here but I've never had a meal that I thought was worth the price. The atmosphere is upscale and it's great for dates. The food is just not that special. Ive tried the French dip, bread salad, waffles, and curry tacos- all fine but nothing id be excited to order again

Friday night we headed to 5Church with some friends since he previously had said he wanted to check it out. We had made birthday reservations for 7:30pm. 5Church had some things going for it and some things going against.  The first thing against? We didn't get seated until 8. I know, it was restaurant week. The place was bumping. I get it. But as a restaurant goer, I'm not cool waiting thirty minutes for a reservation. Just not cool.  What about the first thing in their favor? I'd made the reservation so long ago, I totally forgot I'd told them we were celebrating a birthday! They gave us a round of drinks on the house just for the occasion. That was a pretty stellar way to start - and it made up for the wait.  I had a seasonal salad to start that wasn't bad - it included squash and beets with Boursin cheese. Then for the main course I had a filet with mashed potatoes and brussels. The main course was decent. I've had better steaks elsewhere, but I love brussel sprouts and not a ton of places embrace them so I was down. I'm not sure I would order the filet if I went back though. I have a feeling their regular menu offered other things that would have been better. What I'm saying is - don't go just for the filet  Go for the desserts. We ordered the s'mores trifle and the chocolate pretzel bar. Droooooool. Superb. Highly recommend. And my blackberry drink was also spectacular so... at least go for drinks and a dessert.

Such a cute, trendy lounge type of bar/restaurant.  I love the decor and there are great cocktail options.  Plates are all small, but great for just a snack or some apps.  DJ and good music on the weekends as the night gets later.  I love going here with some friends for drinks and a good time!

I have been to 5Church twice. and I enjoyed it both times for lunch.  I would recommend getting the lamb burger and fries.  The lamb burger is cooked to perfection and is bursting with flavor.  The secret sauce on the lamb burger really brings the flavor out of the sandwich.  Also, the French fries are really crispy and good.  For 10 bucks you can't beat it for lunch, this includes a sandwich, fries and a drink.  It's a really good deal and the service is awesome.  Also, I was not a fan of the black bean hummus.  It's hard to describe but the taste was a little off me.  I will definetly be going back there.

Large portions and great food resides at the swanky decorated 5 Church.  I can't remember what was here prior to 5 Church as most restaurants don't seem to last in this location but I know it was not as nicely decorated as it is now.  I've only been for lunch and the chicken sandwich was gigantic and probably a bit much even for my large appetite but it was good, as was the black bean dip appetizer.......looking forward to trying the brunch.

5 church is probably one of the best date and meet up spots in Charlotte for 30+ professionals. I would rate the food 4 stars and the atmosphere 4.5 stars. It is crowded and a little loud on the weekends but worth a stop.
5Church is a Solid Date Night spot. Not too loud, great space, and friendly service. Get the Sea Scallops. Maybe the most delicious thing I've ever eaten. .

Very nice elegant restaurant, business casual attire is a suggestion. They had a wide selection of wine and I got a glass of ghost pines. The jalape√±o butter served with the bread was amazing. I ordered the short ribs which just fell apart they were very delicious, with a side of handout fries. The fries were really fresh and on point. Overall very good from start to finish.

The d√©cor is amazing!!! It doesn't look like it belongs anywhere in the NC I grew up visiting every Summer. I stopped in for brunch with my cousin and sistah-friend while visiting Charlotte. I had shrimp and grits, they were pretty good. My friend and I also shared a lamb burger after we saw how delicious the one my cousin ordered looked. It was very good. Will definitely stop in again during my next trip to the Queen City.
I really really really wanted the food to be awesome because the menu sounds so creative and delicious. But it was just ok for me. Nothing spectacular.
Went for lunch today and it was fabulous! Yummy food and such a neat place the atmosphere is great can't wait to go for dinner there next time!

5 Church is such a wonderful addition to the Charlotte restaurant scene.  The food is consistently great, the cocktails are interesting and perfect, the ambiance can't be beat. I would DEFINITELY recommend this place to anyone, especially people visiting Charlotte and looking for an uptown experience that's classy & hip, not cheesy.

I'm addicted to mussels but I have the hardest time finding a place who truly can make a great dish. I wasn't anticipating it to be the best dish I've ever had, but I was hoping it wasn't a slump. Welp, one best mussel dish I've ever had later and we're writing a 5 Star Review.   Jamie is outstanding at what he does and the dishes available at 5Church are a must try.  Oh - and anywhere that has complementary valet in Charlotte deserves more than 5 Stars!

Kudos to the owner of the resto, who made our extremely poor service better by comping the whole meal... and then some! Most management would skirt around the truth about what happened, but the owner was up front and honest and did all he could to salvage the rest of our evening. That is how you run a business. And once we got the food, it was delish!!!

I really wanted to try this restaurant because it's owned by a former Top Chef contestant, Jamie Lynch. As a huge fan of the show, when I travel I try to hit up restaurants owned by these contestants. It did not disappoint! The decor was beautiful, and the food was phenomenal. I ordered the shrimp and grits and my friend ordered the lamb burger. We both tried some of each other's food and they were both so good! The best part? A giant glass of sangria was $2.50!!!! Again, I repeat. $2.50!!! That in itself is enough reason to dine at this fine establishment.
Colleen was awesome in hosting our event! Food was delicious, service was great, definitely coming back to host another event! #SoFi

5Church seems to be a very happenin' place.  The name denotes the intersection where the restaurant is.  There's music, lots of cool-looking people, a great place to hang out for the after-work crowd.    Never one to turn down short ribs, I went for their braised version.  The meat was tender and flavorful.  I'm not exactly sure what the chef's specialty sauce was but I liked it.  It was done right without being too salty.  There was also a choice of potatoes, and I got the fries.  They were perfectly crispy, so I ate the whole lot of them.  Others at my table had the salmon and lamb burger, and they seemed to like their dishes as well.  The meal wasn't cheap, so expect to spend about about $35 each before drinks.
Unbelievable design one of the best salads ever the first 5Church is located in a church in Charleston electricfying atmosphere local IPA's get yourself into some devine intervention.

The highlight of my day was brunch at 5 Church.   The crabcakes with poached eggs were superb.  The presentation was interesting with two stacks comprised of a buttered toast, saut√©ed spinach, meaty crabcakes, and topped with a perfectly poached egg.  A light sauce with tomato and green pepper garnish finished it perfectly.   Loved the deco...interesting finishes and service was perfect.  This is the kind of culinary experience I have a hard time finding.   I'll be back to try some of their "snacks" and dinner entrees.

The food was pretty good. I had the Crab Cakes and poached eggs which was really great but really small :(   Server was fantastic but the kitchen managed to mess up the order somehow (I watched her write it down so I'm not sure where the error happened) and some of the food was cold. There was also a sewer issue upstairs that had an odor in the restaurant that was not pleasant.   All in all- it was simply ok. Better spots with less odors ?

My sister and I traveled to Charlotte to attend to some family business. Make no mistake, what we were doing was work. But we made time for meals and the occasional cocktail or three. We Yelped, of course, and found 5Church.   Damn were we lucky to have stumbled onto this gem. It's located just off the Tryon commercial strip that offers a number of upscale chain restaurants. Not what we were looking for, nor were they serving, to our good fortune.  5Church was serving their all day Sunday brunch menu. We sat at corner of the bar where they served the full menu- a limited selection, but with a number of interesting possibilities. I opted for the hanger steak and fries, which came with their own C-1 sauce. It was delicious. The beef was perfectly seasoned and seared. The sauce should be bottled.  Bob, the burly bearded bartender, asked for our drink order. I asked for a margarita with whatever tequila he recommended. Bob asked if I wanted the best margarita I'd ever had. He did not disappoint. He muddled fresh limes and oranges, covered them with ice and simple syrup. Then he added a good measure of (wait for it) Cuervo Gold. Cocktail shaken. Glass rim salted. Drink decanted, fruit and all. Fantastic.  We returned Monday night to our same seats and met Evan, a young mixologist on a mission. After Goose martinis, we extolled Bob's awesome margarita. Evan took that as a challenge and produced a signature cocktail he was perfecting, The Peppadew Pepper Lemonade. Muddled lemons, vodka, Peppedew pepper juice, cayenne pepper. Shake to a froth. Top off with a splash of ginger ale. Garnish with the pepper. Sweet, tart, spicy, refreshing. Delicious.  The food was as good as on Sunday.   We went back two more times in the four days we were in town. We had a lamb burger (me, awesome) and crispy beet sliders (she). I'm not a fan of beets, but the sister loved these fantastic bites. Met the owners who told use they'd been open for just 6 weeks. 5Church should break the curse of other establishments that had failed at the corner of 5th and Church. I'm looking forward to returning as soon as I can find a reason.
Lamb burger.  Eat it now!!!  Service isn't astounding, but the food is quite good.

I've been to 5Church a couple of times now and it's A-OK in my book.   The one thing that stands out to me is the great smelling candle that was burning in the women's bathroom. Aside from that, I'm not sure 5Church is really for me. Clearly it's received great reviews and I quite like it's sister restaurant, Nan & Byron's, but just because I like one sister, doesn't mean they are both alike. The restaurant itself is a bit dark and doesn't have a warm, inviting feel. The first time I was here was during a Yelp event and it was too crowded making the second level hot and stuffy.   This last time I went, I made reservations before a show and they got my guest and I seated promptly. We both ordered the lamb burger and it was good, but it doesn't really work as a burger. We both found it to be messy and ended up eating it with our forks. Also, the energy of the place was dull. Perhaps it was because it was cold outside and during the afternoon. In any case, I just wasn't feeling it. Although, I can definitely see the appeal for an early 20s crowd on a Friday or Saturday night.  The food is good, the location is close if you are seeing a show at the Belk Theater. If, however, you are looking for a more warm and inviting place, try their other restaurant.

In town for work during restaurant week in Charlotte (how lucky am I!?), I opted to check out 5Church my first night there. I had the following from the menu: - Black Bean Hummus - grilled flatbread, cold pressed olive oil - Wasabi-Crusted Salmon - saut√©ed bok choy, marinated seaweed salad, miso emulsion - Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake - Guinness chocolate cake, peanut butter buttercream, salted caramel sauce, bacon peanut brittle  The hummus was by far the smoothest and tastiest hummus I think I've ever had. I wish I could buy some and take it home with me. The Salmon was cooked to perfection. And the desert was amazing. The only thing I was less than impressed with was the bacon peanut brittle. I know people say bacon is amazing in everything but I would definitely argue otherwise in this case. This was the best meal I had in Charlotte that week. It's too bad I had it at the beginning of my weak rather than the end.   Finally, the decor is comfortable, cool, inviting with an artistic vibe. The service impeccable.   Oh and the Old Fashioned Redone was good too!

I'd say this was a 4.5 star experience, but am upping it up to 5 because of the service!  Date night Friday and we started with the duck confit perogies. Who puts duck confit on a perogie? 5Church that's who. And they were savory and delicious....But the cheese plate stole the show! I've had a LOT of cheese plates in Charlotte, and this I have to say is THE best cheese plate I've had so far. Why? They put Burrata on the plate that's why! If you don't know what that is, Google it. It will change your life! Then the put a Hungarian style Feta cheese with a tapenade, and a very delicious Italian hard cheese (similar to Parmesean but better) paired with a sweet apricot compote. Wow was that ever delicious combo!  Entree's - my date had the scallops (always good) and I opted for the 14oz bone in ribeye at our Waiter's suggestion. Well he was RIGHT! Good one Doug because the steak was outstanding! Cooked to med-rare perfection and served with their house made Bearnaise sauce! Wow was that like liquid gold.   Dessert - we decided to split one, and Doug our waiter said that their Smores was "by far" their best dessert! So we got it, and it was delicious! They said something about a brownie, but it was more like a flourless torte. Who cares, it was AWESOME!  They have a nice wine list, but it is pricey. You may want to see how much their corkage fee is and bring your own bottle of wine when you come. But overall this was a marvelous dinner! Highly recommended!
Good Tile fish but not great.  Good wine selection and a cool atmosphere.  Just an above average value!

I am ashamed to admit that I have been to 5Church A LOT and have never written a review.  I think mostly because I'm always so blissful after that I completely forget.  The good news is, I can write about almost every meal - during any time of the day.  Ahh, so much to write and so little time.  5C is one of those places that you not only live for in the city, it's one of those places that you want to show off when people from out of town come to visit you.  There are just so many fun and funky things - the ceiling poetry (Art of War), the cloth wrapped chandeliers, the servers all in chuck taylors, the layered seating, and the people watching - wowza!  5C packs a punch in all the right places.  First things first - make a reservation or prepare to have a nose or two turned up.  It's not a snobby place, but it's busy and reservations are your friend here.    The cocktails are made with care.  I typically stick to an Old Fashion, but there is something for everyone - even the non-drinkers.  Not to mention an espresso bar with homemade biscotti.  Appetizers - the Gnocchi Parisienne (of the day) is an absolute must.  You can share, but just know you are going to want to make love to this pasta.   Each table is also given fresh bread made in- house (swoon).  Entrees - it is impressive, and I mean REALLY impressive to make someone come back for Salmon.  Their wasabi crusted salmon is (my mouth is watering as I type) outrageous.  It is savory and buttery with the ever so smallest hint of heat from the wasabi baked in.  The chef recommends the medium, but I usually do med-well (just my preference) and literally lick my plate clean.  For everything I just said about the salmon, the Prime Beef Bolognese is better.  This is hands down the best pasta I have had on the east coast.  It's surprising, I know.  But I'm Italian and therefore an official authority on the matter and I am telling you this bolognese is to die for.  Like, last meal worthy stuff.  All that said, it's not for the faint of heart - this is a big meal.  Come hungry.  Wondering what else to tack on to that last meal?  The s'mores trifle.  I literally cannot even... it is heaven in a baking dish.     The strawberry poppy seed cake?  Pass.   The service has always been great.  We like to sit at the bar, but on the occasions we have sat in the dining room we have had wonderful service.  Alyssa is wonderful!  5C is killer and you won't regret it.  Just don't get in my way - I would maul someone for that s'mores trifle.  You've been warned.  xoxo

5Church lives up to the hype. When new locations open in former revolving door space you never know what to expect. 5Church is very on trend and is the type of restaurant Charlotte should be proud of. I was able to sample several things last night since I dined with a group of friends who all shared snacks and small plates. Yes, they have a section on their menu called snacks. See they are fancy smchancy but don't take themselves too seriously. Their servers are dressed fairly casually for the black and white interior and general music video set vibe. I thought the bunch of you guys were just old saying it was loud in there. But, man. I was there for a 7:15pm dinner and I was holloring like I was out at a club to my table-mates.   The Food:  Sampled- Bacon pizza, shrimp flatbread, backed local goat cheese and spinach, meat plate, cheese plate and the heralded lobster mac and cheese.  While some of my friends disagreed I loved the borsin cheese on the shrimp flatbread but I guess it is not for everyone. The bacon pizza was solid- as was the goat cheese albeit small. This is something to know going in. The snacks menu are just that snack size, not appetizer size. The biggest disappointment was the lobster mac and cheese. At $9 for a small bowl I expected angels to sing when it passed my lips. There were noticeable pieces of lobster but they could have been more generous and the mac and cheese could have been more cheesy or strongly seasoned or something. The meat and cheese plates were thoughtful and contained some of the best prosciutto I've ever tasted.  We also shared the chocolate torte and pots de creme which was cold and chai flavored. The latter felt more like a breakfast item than a sweet treat but, it may hit the spot for those that don't like to end their meals with decadence.   I would love to come back and try the 60 second steak or the lamb burger. The cocktails were divine. I would come here again and often for drinks. The free valet parking is nice because parking uptown can be tricky.   I do want to comment on the service. We were celebrating a birthday and mentioned that twice but we made the reservation and I guess they assumed we would want space throughout our meal. Our waitress left our water glasses empty for most of the meal and never once told our friend happy birthday or offered something special for her. It was a special night out but 5Church isn't five stars yet- but it is getting there.
Typically solid food (especially the Lamb burger, pasta dishes, and most appetizers), delicious drinks, and a fun atmosphere. All in, one of our go-to places in uptown.

I don't know what's happened lately. Last Saturday was my 2nd trip to 5Church and while the first was an extraordinary lunch service, the latest  brunch left a lot to be desired.  Arrived around 1pm and was seated by the hostess, we got to our table and our waiter...you know what, I don't think I caught his name. I'm sure he said it but the music was too loud to hear him. On top of that, he really couldn't hear us... at all. Every other thing he said to us was "what" or "could you repeat that." It got very annoying throughout the brunch service.  Drinks arrived, I ordered sweet tea... well they didn't lie. It was WAY too sweet. It was almost indiscernible from just sugar syrup, no tea flavor at all. No big deal, I asked the waiter to take that one and bring me a half & half tea to cut the sugar... well 15 minutes came and went and not only had we not ordered yet, but I still didn't have my tea.  Waiter arrived again, without my replacement drink. We placed our brunch order and I waited once again for my drink, which arrived 20 minutes into brunch...  The food arrived and was...OK. My poached egg and crab cake was cooked well but was under-seasoned. My nephew's french toast was good. The Shrimp 'n Grits were good but again, under-seasoned. Nothing horrible, but nothing great.  So after a non-impressive brunch, we waited on the check... and waited, and waited. To note, the restaurant was at about 1/4 capacity... there were at least 4 waiters and waitresses covering about 10 tables. After we finally got the check, it took another 10 minutes for the waiter to come back with the receipt, this time it was a different waiter. I'm not sure if the other one was just tired of my constant requests for drinkable beverage or got tied up on another table. In any case, we really didn't receive a farewell from anyone at the restaurant besides the hostess who said bye to us.  ...so yeah, that's that. It seems like the standards of service were in a free-fall this Saturday. Next visit will probably be with friends who want to go, because I can't see myself going on my own accord any time soon.

This restaurant was so good!! Our server helped us decide on what to order and was very helpful is describing the menu.   We started with the romaine wedge which was delightful and enough for two to share. We also had the pork belly gnocchi which was amazing!! For our main course we had steak with Gorgonzola fondue with mashed potatoes.. Simply amazing! Will definitely be going back again!!  They have a DJ that starts playing on Friday/Saturday nights at 9pm. He was very good. Would be a fun place to meet up and have drinks as well. Will definitely be going back!!

Decor was divine, but it stops there. Service: so-so. The waiter says our po-boy sandwiches dont come with anything on the side. The sandwiches come: with fried potatoes on the side! Our drinks came 3/4 through the meal. Also, the table was not clean. A pet peeve: crunchy, toasted baguettes on a sandwich, which crumbles and scrapes the roof of your mouth. Chefs, please! Leave the baguettes alone. A po-boy should have a nice soft bite.

A little pricey? Sure. But the food is delicious, and the ambiance is quite unique.   The Szechuan pork belly was a great starting bite, the wine list was more impressive than I was expecting, and the salmon with polenta was perfectly tender and delicious - despite the understandable skepticism about smoked and then roasted. And because I'm a huge sucker who can't say 'no' to a dessert, I packed the chocolate torte in every available remaining cranny. Painfully stuffed, but unbelievably satisfied, I almost forgot that I had work to do the next day.  Next time I'm in town, this place will definitely be on my short list.

Another great evening at 5Church. This time rather than the big group, there was just two of us. We sat at the bar. Service was great. Drinks were awesome. Food was excellent. Nice to see that nothing has changed in the 9 months since I was last here. This place is earning a spot on my "every time I am in Charlotte" list.

First time to restaurant and was not impressed. Went for lunch with colleague   Had burger with fries. Fries were greasy and cold. Colleague had French onion Roast beef sandwich and left 3/4 as he said tasted funny.  Waitress did not ask if issue nor if we needed any thing else.  Would not go back

I've been here for lunch a few times so far. I love the atmosphere of this place. Very chic. They have different menus depending on the time of day so expect a slightly fancier menu if you come here for dinner. The lunch menu is less expensive ($9-14) and includes a variety of mostly sandwiches.   Off of the lunch menu I've had the chicken honey mustard wrap and the Ruben (they were out of rye bread so I got white). They were ok- nothing to rave about- I would probably try something different next time. Some people with me ordered burgers and they looked awesome. For sides I got fries. The fries were actually pretty good- tasted fresh cut, which I love. I've also had the tomato soup and it was served with a goat cheese filled crouton, which was an awesome touch but the soup was served cold. Not sure if it was sitting out long or was suppose to be chilled.     The true reason why I'm giving this a 3 star is because of the service. Every time I've been here the service has been very slow. Not refilling our water glasses, forgetting silverware or taking ages for our food to come. I don't mind waiting, but when I order a basic burger or sandwich I expect it to not take longer than 30 minutes.
Great food! Fantastic service! Unreal atmosphere! The zucchini sliders were outbid this world! Enough said.

After being here a few times 5Church's offerings continue to leave me unimpressed. How disappointing. Granted this latest time was during the clusterfuck that is restaurant week. Walking in we were greeted and promptly seated which was a nice surprise as we were a bit early for our reservation!  For this visit during restaurant week I started with an asian flair and went for the pork belly bun. It's alright, very big, very filling, the coleslaw helped balance out the richness of that pork belly but nothing really shone through. I think the pork belly was kind of bland, I'm not sure how but I can't even remember it. One of my poor dining companions ordered the split pea soup though and it was unfortunately more water than pea it seemed.  Moving on to the entrees we had a wasabi crusted salmon, and hangar steak. At no point during the order did our waitress ask how we would like either to be cooked. Maybe she was frazzled. I usually like my salmon to be rare, but this salmon was quite on the medium well side which while still palatable was not pleasant with the panko crust on top that somehow actually got softer instead of crispy in the oven. I scraped all that mess off.  Dessert was a super sweet candy bar. I took only a few bites before being overwhelmed and called it a day.  I think next time I come here (which might be a very very long time) I will definitely skip restaurant week's menu. It was tedious and a chore to eat here, the whole point of eating out is to skip the chores!

Came here for Sunday Brunch at 11am. Made reservations online. Coffee set up was cute with the pirouette cookies, sugar cubes and jelly bellies. For Brunch we ordered the Apple Smoked Bacon Omelet and the Crab Cakes with Poached Egg. The food was delicious and the ambiance was very chic and fun.  5 CHURCH is located behind the Ivey at the corner of 5th and Church. There have a few on street parking spots but they fill in fast. I have seen rave reviews about the 2.50 mimosas and Sangria but they're not available until after noon so we were a little too early to try them. Will definitely be back.

I try to go to places a few times before I review them.   I really liked this place before my last visit. I make reservations every time and tend to try a new appetizer and get the same steak.   So I may be to blame for part of this I may not be. I knew ahead of time I would be a few minutes late and called on advance to let them know. I was told no problem. I had requested upstairs as it is a nicer atmosphere and a little quieter than downstairs.   We show up 5 minutes late and they ask us to wait a few minutes. They come back a few minutes later and said it would still be a few minutes. Well finally they take us to a table but low and behold downstairs right between multiple groups of people. No explanation or no asking us if That was ok.   So I'm upset my girlfriend said it would be ok. Then she realized we cannot hear each other talking. The asked us what we wanted to drink and of course out of the one beer I wanted. At this point I was ready to leave but it was my girlfriends birthday so we stayed.  We ordered the chicken wraps ( I did have these once before) and wow they were nasty this time. Whatever spices they used this time was inedible.   She ordered the pasta and said it was ok not great. Ate about half of that and was done.   Now I love their 60 second Strip and wow did they screw up big time. I don't know if they have new cooks or what but half of the steak was inedible. I could not even cut it.  It was way to thick for a strip and not cut properly or anything. Someone really dropped the ball on that one and being a pricey steak you would expect the best.  I got fries this time as a side and they came cold...   Well unfortunately I will not longer recommend this place as That was just a cluster of things gone wrong and they all could have been avoided.

My first and last time coming to this establishment.   Pros : Decor . The decor is beautiful I love the set up its very nice  Cons : *there is no mirror in the women's bathroom  *We were seated in a corner right beside the bathrooms like pure trash  *Our waiter had a party of 10+ right beside us and had no interest in our experience at the establishment. He greeted us poorly. He took forever on bar drinks(we were right in front of the bar to see the drinks being made) & water refills. He did not seem engaging or suggestive to us when asking him questions about the items on the list *It is probably the worst brunch menu that I have ever seen in my entire life *Chicken salad was absolutely disgusting and had a bad aftertaste *my side order of fries& glass of water were probably the best things  *He messed up our checks, but we were so ready to leave that we just paid him and left  *As someone in the food industry, I have never ever ever left a restaurant without leaving at least a 20% tip, until this day     I will never ever come here again and plan to express my experience to others. Please do not waste your time or money. Waffle House has better breakfast.

Okay I can totally see why everyone likes this restaurant. This is a cool place to hang out with your friends at the bar and enjoy the atmosphere. Just others have said in their reviews, it can be a little noisy and its lighting is low but I like it that way as long as you know what it's like going in before hand. The dinner service took longer than most restaurants because they want you to enjoy the appetizers, your drinks and conversations. I took the advice of ordering the black bean hummus with vegetables along with pita chips and it was really good. Our table ordered the bacon pizza which was really good with pork belly spring rolls, I highly recommend it.  I ordered the wasabi encrusted Salmon and I loved it. The seaweed salad was served on top of the salmon which made the crust a little soggy but otherwise it was delicious! I suggest that you should ask for the seaweed salad to be served on the side to keep the salmon crust crunchy.  My wife ordered the prime beef Bolognese and it was rustic, meaty and reminded us of Italy, great job! My daughters ordered the Maryland crab cakes, they had a lot of crab and we're very crunchy. My other daughter got the venison with a reduction glaze, it reminded me of when we had a cordon blue chef from France cook this for us when I was younger, you will love it. All in all a great time, delicious food and a trendy restaurant.

Not much to like about our experience.  Maybe it's just me but if you are going to spend $100 plus on dinner it should be a great overall experience.  Reservations mean nothing, ours was at 8:45, got seated around 9:15 and after speaking to a few people at the bar it was the same for everyone.  Got seated and didn't get a waitress for 5-10 minutes, even though several walked past us.  Honestly she didn't seem too happy to be there.  Food was nothing to write home about, although we had the pre fixe menu for restaurant week so maybe the standards were lower.  I had tuna which tasted ok but servings were small.  Not sure if we will return, but if you like loud music and overpriced food all while getting bad service then try it out.
If I could give them less than 1 star I would.  Service SERIOUSLY sucks - and that goes all the way up the chain.  Nobody cares, everybody says the same thing but nobody takes action to change it.
Hangar steak was tough, pork belly spring rolls were very good. Ordered veggies and didn't get them until we were done eating. Don't think we will return.

I only had calamari, a lamb burger, and a salad so probably a premature review but, the food was not good at all. The waitress was very nice though and there wasn't a wait to sit during lunch. I'll try again for dinner eventually if someone suggests it.

We had a hasty brunch here right before we made a mad dash for the airport because 5Church happened to be open and convenient.  The standout for me was the bottomless sangria, naturally.  It had me at "bottomless" and me secretly wishing our flight had been booked for later in the day.  I ordered a mixed green salad and a roti potato cake - it resembled a thick cake of hash browns.  Both were decent and did the trick, but I was a bit sad that the current-at-that-time seasonal menu didn't advertise more veggie-friendly options.  From what I understood, everyone else's selections were fairly competent, although nothing was especially noteworthy.    The service was quite prompt and attentive - you know I tried to inhale as many glasses of that delicious sangria as humanly possible.  Definitely a cute little spot and was great for our large party of 12 or so . . .

Wow, impressive in every way!  Ridiculously good food and service!  The atmosphere is wonderful!  Extensive wine and cocktail list .  Recommend the steaks and wedge salad.  The red velvet torte is like the best ding dong ever!

Overall, a really good experience, especially for restaurant week. The salmon was spectacular; perfectly cooked and flavorful. The portion size was quite large yet the dish wasn't heavy. Many recommended the s'mores dessert, which was good but a bit rich for my taste, my date and I agreed that we much preferred the pretzel bar dessert despite our general dislike for pretzels! This is definitely a fun and special place to go, though the booth seating was a bit awkward and uncomfortable, especially while wearing a dress.

Great cocktails (the gin fizz was a hit with both me and my husband) and the little snack plates are a fun way to kick off your meal while you peruse the menu. My husband ordered the catfish and loved it while I got the crispy tofu which was tasty but I'd probably order something else next time which might be saying something. We had great service (very friendly!) and our meals came out fast! Would be a great place to take out-of-towners.

It being St. Patricks Day weekend, most of the restaurants had become Irish pubs for the weekend. Luckily 5Church was not one of these. The atmosphere is upscale and trendy. The music was loud but it was 9pm and it helped drown out conversations around you as the tables are close together. We got a loud guy beside us but that could happen anywhere.   Since we were not overly hungry we split the black bean hummus and a marinated tomato salad to start. The kitchen was gracious enough to split the salad for us. The salad was a tasty surprise. The draft beer selection had something for all beer taste. I always try to go local with the beer when I can.  We opted to split the grilled salmon as well. Again the kitchen split for us. It was still plenty of food. I don't think I could have eaten the whole thing alone. The jalape√±o salad on top had a nice kick but had cilantro in it. The salmon was cooked perfectly with just the right amount of tenderness in the middle.   We opted not to get dessert.   On a side note, we did see Ruben Studdard from American Idol fame 3 tables away. We did not bother him as it looked like he and his wife were having an evening out together.

This is about the coolest restaurant in uptown Charlotte.  From the interesting menu options to the decor to the scene itself, this place has it all!   One of the first things I noticed when I walked in for the first time was the words all over the ceiling. Apparently it's the Art of War.  But don't try reading it all or you'll make yourself dizzy!  There are all sorts of other interesting things going on inside this place: the cool lighting, the metal tree beside the bar, the art on the walls, etc.  The food is awesome.  I've had a few different things and haven't found anything that wasn't great.  I really like the tofu dish (and I'm not normally a fan of tofu), and the salmon.  There are also burgers, steaks, chicken options, and other seafood.  They really make some interesting dishes with all sorts of eclectic ingredients.  The cocktail menu is pretty sweet too and it has lots of cool concoctions.  If you make it to dessert without falling out from appetizers and the main course, you'll get to choose from a s'more situation in a glass, banana pudding, and a chocolate peanut butter cake among other things.  All good!    Cool atmosphere in a great location, good food, and not too expensive given the quality.  You gotta check it out!

Not what you expect from a place that wants to be upscale. The loud music makes it impossible to have a conversation.   The server gave our table a 5 minute sales pitch (or more) when we hadn't taken a look at the menu and was not very knowledgeable when it came to wine (many words were mispronounced among other things). He was very inattentive, got orders wrong, and the food took a very long time. He was not new, if that's what you're thinking. He claimed to be with the company for quite some time.  The food was great though but given my options uptown, I won't be coming back.

A-OK sums this place up perfectly.  We went for restaurant week, and oddly enough ended up ordering a bunch of apps (not on the price fix menu)....so major fail on that end.  Reservation was for 6:15...girlfriend arrived at 6, I was there promptly at 6:15.....and we waited and waited and waited for our table.  What is the point of a reservation I ask you.  Now I'm not a fan of pushing people out, but not once as we were sitting at the bar did the hostess check in with us.  We had to go up to her at around quarter to 7 and finally ask what was the story.  This is why I did not give them 4 stars...the hostesses just couldn't be bothered.  Very young and trendy, or what CLT calls trendy, so probably 'ovah' in a bigger market.  But I digress.  Our waiter was also ho hum.  It was loud in there and he had difficulty hearing us.  Instead of perhaps bending down to get a little closer, he rather annoyed like told us to speak louder.  Ok deafy mc deaferson...I'll scream my order next time.  I'm sure the people at the table less than 6 inches from our table will really enjoy that.  So onto the food.  It was good.  The bacon pizza yummy, as was the pierogie.  The salad was just meh as was the jerk chicken wraps.  Dessert was good according to my girlfriend - she got the smores trifle.  I got the red velvet.  I wasn't feeling the chocolate ganache but that's b/c I'm not a chocoholic, not b/c it wasn't good.  The mussels were good but not very large.  So my closing tip to 5 Church...Get rid of the wanna be hipster staff and you'll have a true fan in this yelper.

This place has such amazing food. My girlfriend and I ordered the octopus (as an appetizer) and the  whole fish and scallops meals and they were just absolutely delicious. We sat at the bar and the bartender took such great care of us. He was very professional and nice. Very relaxed environment. In love with the food and will definitely be back on our next visit to Charlotte.

So, I am so sad to only give this place 3 stars.  I was really hoping for a 5-star experience with as many awesome things as I have heard about this place....and the buzz about town it has caused the last year.  The only reason I am giving it 3 stars is because the atmosphere is really cool.  Great place to grab a drink and hang out with friends....  I had been here once before, but only for drinks.  And it was so much fun.  I been waiting to come back and try some of their food and really excited about doing so.  We stopped in late night and we were not super hungry, so we ordered a handful of their "snacks" and "first course" items.  I didn't like any of them.  So much so, that I barely touched my food.  Everything was crazy salty and over seasoned.   One of the items, "the black bean hummus" is described on the menu as coming with "grilled flat bread"...and what I got was greasy fried chips.  When I asked the server about it, he told me it was grilled and then "flash fried".  Doesn't make much sense to me.   I sure hope their steaks and main dishes are better.  Maybe I will try them out again.  Or maybe I will just stick with the bar.
This is one of my fav restaurants in Charlotte - modern, upscale but not uptight. Great food and energy. And, if you want a fab cocktail, I highly recommend the Viper. You're welcome.

The Lamb burger was tasty, but nothing over-the-top-hell-yea-lamb-be-damned good.  I love the decor with all the crazy writing on the ceiling.  The place was empty after 3, I think they stop serving lunch right at 3, they were cool and mad ean exception for me and my buddy bc we had been to 3 other places and they all stopped lunch.  Come on Charlotte! Keep a food menu open the entire day! sheesh.

This place was amazing!  We had an awesome server named Andrew which did a fantastic job not only serving us but creating an experience.  He made suggestions from cocktails to dessert which were all absolutely delicious.  The New York Strip may be the best steak I have ever eaten.  Cooked to perfection!  It's been a long time since I have received that kind of service and quality.  I left there a raving fan and will definitely be going back and requesting Andrew!

We had dinner at 5Church the other night.  We had a reservation and were seated immediately.  We had our 12 and 13 year old kids with us.  The food was great.  All of us were happy with our choices.  Service and drinks were great too.  I am glad we dressed up because the majority of diners were dressed up as well.  Highly recommend!

Second time I had been in two weeks for work related lunches. First time food and service were good. Second time the food was still good but service terrible. We were a party of three and it took almost 40 minutes to get club sandwiches and side salads. We all ordered the same thing and there were maybe 15 other patrons dining at the same time.  We asked the waiter to bring our checks when the food came out and he didnt. I ended up having to get my food boxes up since I was there longer than should have been along with requesting my check again, which took another 10 minutes.  It was quiet and food wasn't complicated...no plans to go back anytime soon!

After living in Manhattan the past five years, I was skeptical that a "trendy" restaurant (in Charlotte, no less) could have great food.  I was pleasantly surprised and will be sure to book a dinner reservation later, next time, in order to absorb the music, beautiful people, and the scene.    There are two levels to the restaurant--- one with bar and dining; the other with all dining.   I sat upstairs with my mom- her first time out since a serious operation.   Noise level, even when the place was full (after 7:30) was not a problem.  And, the free valet outside was perfect.  The waitstaff  was very knowledgable, patient and even excited  to answer numerous questions regarding the menu.  To start, there were so many interesting choices on the cocktail list.  I  decided on the Bourberry- a bourbon based drink with rasperries that I LOVED--- and, I am not even a bourbon drinker.  I ordered from the  "snacks," section -  pork belly, chickpea salad, and toasted ravioli- (approximately $3- $4 each and enough bites for two).  My mom got a kick out of the fact that I created my own "tasting menu," which it was.  Although  initially saying that she would not eat any of my "snacks," she enjoyed.   I ordered a salad (dressing on side, as an added bonus I received two) and my mom ordered the seared sea scallop entree--- which we both loved!!! The scallops were large and juicy, displayed beautifully on leek mashed potatoes with yummy tomato, corn, and zucchini salad.  I ended up eating most  of her veggies (and scallops as well).  We also split the shrimp, arugula, flatbread pizza appetizer.  The crust was so perfectly dietetically thin, that the true shrimp, arugula, red onion, and boursin cheese flavor took over--- heaven to a foodie.  We were so full (and my mom tired) that we did not get to desert.  I can't wait to go back next time to try  more of their menu and also hit up the scene downstairs.

We're in town from Winston Salem for a show and made reservations here for brunch.   Started with a Bloody Mary and sangria. Bloody was good a peppery, the sangria was excellent, a red sangria w berries, really tasty. The ms had waffles and I had crab cake w poached eggs. Both were fantastic. Ms said the waffle was the best she's ever had. I think she was right. My meal was excellent. We had home fries that were perfectly seasoned to soak up the egg goodness.    Great location for a show at blumenthal   Great brunch. We'll be back for beauty and the beast in the Fall

Awesome brunch spot. Super cute decor! Hey you can't go wrong with bottomless mimosa and sangria for brunch! The food is cheap and pretty good! Ladies this is the place to get your girls together for drinks and convo! #SexandCityVibe

Sat down for a quick business luncheon with a customer.  The service was great, the Calamari appetizer was good, the French Onion Roast Beef sandwich was delicious.  Excited to return for dinner in the near future!

I have been wanting to try this place since it opened, we finally got the opportunity last weekend. We decide to go as part of restaurant week. I never am sure what to expect during restaurant week. We have been to restaurants before during this time and the menu has been tweaked (small portions, very limited choices). 5church had a decent selection.  I opted for the tomato soup, hanger steak, and banana walnut cake, my wife had the Bibb salad, hanger steak, and chocolate torte.  All was good including the complimentary everything bread.  Stand outs were the medium rare hanger steak, Bibb salad and chocolate torte.  My next visit I will have to get the bison sirloin or the lamb burger.  The restaurant had a cool trendy vibe and would be nice for just a drink at the couches or bar area. The only complaint I have is the noise level, since there we just 2 of us, we were seated at the large community table that seats 18.  It happened to be in front of the bar so it was extremely loud, however I plan on going back for lunch soon.

We recently had the pleasure of celebrating our wedding reception at 5Church Restaurant, 06-10-17 to be exact. Alexa (event coordination) Erin (management) and the team left me speechless. Talk about rolling out the red carpet. Alexa and Erin are so personable, patient, fair and kind. Alexa met with us multiple times until I was comfortable, left no stone unturned and most importantly she listened. She works smart to ensure that no details are missed! Erin fed us until we were stuffed at the delicious food tasting and even spotted me outside the day before to help carry decorations inside.  On our big day, we were dashed to our own private area to eat & have alone time before greeting guests. They also left us such thoughtful notes and gifts as well. Not to mention checking on us throughout the event asking if we needed drink refills, food., etc. We were able enjoy our guests and did not have to think!  Chef Jamie whips up a delectable brunch menu. Steak, tuna poke, mushroom flatbread (my fav), steak, chicken and waffles and shrimp & grits - YUM. Also, the decor in the restaurant is very modern, clean & classy.  This venue makes for a phenomenal party. I highly recommend booking 5Church for your next event!
I've enjoyed every visit and had my wedding reception here. The food and customer service are phenomenal! Alexa and Erin really took care of us!

The brunch was so good! Not only did it look good, but everything tasted good as well! The only thing that would have improved my experience would have been not being seated under the A/C, as the A/C is constantly on at 5Church because the building is 100+ years old. I'm definitely coming back, but requesting a seat that's not under the A/C!

Came here with my family for Mother's Day. I'm not from the area so I relied upon other reviews to chose this place. It's nice and trendy and the good was very good. I'd recommend this place for drinks with friends more so than family. The bartender/server upstairs was a cool guy.  Watch out for the Viper cocktail. That drink has bite!

Yikes! I really hate to give anything one star unless it's absolutely warranted----and, in this case, it was.  I went with my family for a quick lunch at 1:00. We waited about 5 minutes to be greeted and were finally sat. (The restaurant had maybe 6 tables occupied).  Once seated, we waited about 10 minutes to give drink orders - 2 unsweetened teas, a glass of wine, a beer and a water-- we decided to go ahead and order our mains to speed up the process. Finally, we ordered a side of chips to arrive as an appetizer. My sister and mother are vegetarians and specifically requested that their spinach salads came with the vinaigrette dressing instead of the garlic bacon dressing (they also shared that they were vegetarian at this time).   About 20 minutes later, our water pitcher was empty, unsweetened teas had been consumed and, wine and beer were gone. We flagged over our waiter who apologized for "difficulties" but assured us "everything was on track" and that our chips would be out soon as well as a manager. 5 minutes later, the manager plopped down soggy cold chips and walked away (leaving all drinks empty and never apologized/ tried to make things right). Our waiter finally brought the meal about an hour after we sat down and, unfortunately we noted that all three salads were totally covered in bacon.  (I re looked at the menu and no where does it mention the spinach salad come with bacon) My mother and sister sent the salads back before they were even placed in front of them and told our waiter they didn't want  anything more--- they'd lost their patience and left to walk up the street for wraps.  The waiter apologized and said the manager would be back to talk to us. The manager (I assume) came over a few mins later with two new salads and tried to offer them however, my mom and sister were gone. He huffed and walked away without apologizing.  My salad which was covered in bacon was 1 star - portion was small and chicken was not very good. However, my husband and dad enjoyed their lamb burger and beef burger respectively.  To top off the bad experience, it took the manager at least 12 minutes to get us the check. Stay away from this place if you can- and a note to management-- get it together, acknowledge when you've made mistakes and, make things right (don't hide from us and pretend nothing happened) $70 for a poor lunch --- woof !

5Church certainly has a lot of hype.  It seems to pride itself on being glamorous and chic.  In my opinion, the food puts way more emphasis on form then taste. Great example, is a scallop dish was plated incredibly fancy, but the scallops were under-cooked and the favors didn't meld well.  All in all, the dish fell flat.   They did have some good small plates - think tapas - and that is the only thing that prevented it from getting one star.   If you want a fancy place with bad food, this is the spot for you. If you like tasty food, I'd look somewhere else.

I have visited this restaurant a couple of times for lunch and once for dinner.  Every time the experience has been amazing. All of their dishes are full of flavor &  desserts are Delightful!  Lunch: I have tried their CHICKEN CORDON BLEU for lunch. Perfectly crusted chicken, the mashed potatoes were super creamy & topped with delicious lemon caper butter sauce.  Dinner: This place gets really packed during evenings but you can grab a drink or two at the bar.   We started our dinner with ROASTED BEET SALAD & BLACK BEAN HUMMUS. The salad was Marvelous, hummus was ok. I ordered HERB-BRINED & ROASTED CHICKEN, this dish was one of a kind & perfectly cooked. My husband ordered WASABI CRUSTED SALMON it was flavorful.   We finished our meal with ESPRESSO FROZEN MOUSSE & S'MORES TRIFLE. Best ever! Yummy.

I went here today with a couple of friends of mine from work. I ordered the $10 lunch special that includes a sandwich, a side of fries and a drink. Food was good.  Definitely worth the $10. The highlight of the meal though, was the absolutely divine flourless chocolate cake, served espresso creme, salted caramel and toasted hazelnuts. I almost licked my plate clean.  I didn't quite get the theme of the decorations of the place but I didn't mind it. The ambience was pretty good. Seating was comfortable and almost private.   Overall, a great experience, I definitely will go back again for the dessert.   I give 5church a 4 star rating. I didn't give it 5 simply because of the not so great first time experience with them.

Went for dinner with family. Service was attentive. Had a weird water taste in one of my pitchers.. I'm not picky but maybe they didn't rinse well or something.  Local beers on tap (had the local kolch) was good.  Most of the stars Goto the ambience and potential for a friend get together with tapas or appetizers and drinks.  Dinner... Was ok.I had the pork chop and it was a little undercooked. The sides were good, the mashed potatoes were delicious. That's my other star.  Bottom line: dinner was good not great. Music was a little loud for intimate dinner with family. Ambience was wonderful and modern. Meeting for drinks with friends and appetizers would be great!

We had dinner Saturday night at 5Church. We had 8:30 reservations and were seated right away. The decor was stylish, tasteful and the restaurant was packed with a young hip crowd.    Service was great throughout the night. Our waitress greeted us within minutes of being seated and promptly took our drink order and described the nightly specials.  We started with a bottle of pinot noir, a beet salad and bowl of tomato soup with fried goat cheese. All were very tasty.  For entrees we went with two of the nightly specials, the Wagyu ribeye topped with a southern crab cake and a bearnaise sauce and the seared diver scallops over polenta.    The Wagyu steak was a big big big disappointment. Especially after hearing our waitress describe how tender, juicy and flavorful it was going to be. Mine was everything but good. I order it medium rare. It arrived closer to medium. Wagyu is expensive, so I expected a small cut. However, I was very surprised when a 6-7 oz steak arrived. For $56 dollars, I expect little more. Worse, my steak was tasteless, chewy and tough. No flavor at all. The crab cake was a bit on the fishy side and the bearnaise was served room temperature. Simply put.....it was terrible.   The scallops were much better, well cooked but only seared on one side. The polenta was flavorful and perfectly seasoned.   Overall, 5Church was good, but not great. We really wanted it to be great. We plan to give it another try in hopes that it will be better on our next visit.

Private event for corporate business:  Hello from sunny Florida! After scrutinizing many restaurants in the Charlotte area for the most unique and creative restaurant, known for great, seasonal and also creative menus, that HAS a private dining room and is NOT a chain and easily accessible....all roads led to 5Church.  Their decor and ambiance are impressive and strikingly different from others, the private dining room (upstairs) has a fabulous view of the main dining room below. It also has it's own private bar and a DJ booth (if that's something that you need).... but most importantly and justly notable are the staff and the FOOD!!!   Let's talk about the STAFF: The group sales associate, Alexa, was such a pleasure to work with and was extremely helpful throughout the booking and planning stages for my VIP corporate event. Correspondences were very clear and came very promptly which is extremely important to me. Just as important is the service to my clients at execution. Angela and Taylor were our servers for the evening and I was floored by their excellent service coupled with their charming personalities and warm hospitality. These ladies are wonderful at what they do and seemed very happy to be there too! There was never a moment of tension or unease I felt from these ladies, not a glimmer of them feeling stressed or pressured in any way (although, we were a pretty easy-going group to handle in the first place).   . . .and finally the FOOD: The timing of each entree were delivered with logistical and operational perfection. Every dish, every taste, were satisfying to all the senses. As I looked around the room that evening after each entree served, there was clear evidence that I was not the only person that loved the food, as I found every person in my group had a clean plate. No leftovers, nothing pushed to the side. Clean. I still dream about the Wasabi Crusted Salmon dish that I was served. Can I please have that recipe, Alexa???   I want to give everyone at 5Church a jumping hi-five for a perfect evening and BIG hugs to Angela and Taylor...and on a more personal note: Whoever approved the design for all the words of 'Art of War' to be written throughout the ceiling and having Converse sneakers as an approved uniform footwear for its' staff needs to be given a shout out as well. You are awesome, my friend, and yet one more reason why I LOVE 5Church.

Round two! I came again last night after making an Open Table reservation for my boyfriend and a client who was in town from San Francisco. I was impressed by the food last week and decided to give it another whirl- interesting menu options and great ambiance. We were a little late (10-15 minutes) but they didn't blink an eye- our table was ready for us and we were greeted right away by our server. Definitely an improvement from last time! We ordered the mussel appetizer (delicious) and I had the scallops (was torn between that and the NC flounder) and BF got the famous lamb burger. Everything was delicious. Our server was super nice and delivered everything quickly, wasn't obtrusive yet friendly. All in all, great dinner. I think our company enjoyed it very much, too.

This is a short review.  Went in mid day on a Sunday, party of three.  Hostess greeted immediately and seated.  We waited TEN minutes, and never were acknowledged by another employee.  We decided that if that was the expectation of service that we would pass, and went across the street to Cowbell.

5 Church has been my favorite restaurant since they opened their first location right down the street from where I live here in CLT. I can't even count how many times I have visited and I would write a 5 star (10 stars if I could!) review for each and every visit - I have never been disappointed. The ambiance and decor is second to none, check out the ceiling when you visit, it's something you don't want to miss!  The drinks are always on point with a friendly and knowledgeable bar staff that is able to answer any questions you may have. Last night, the bartender walked me through each bourbon they carried and what flavor profiles I could expect from each one. Amazing!   The service is all around incredible at 5 Church. I have had many, many servers throughout my visits and have always been impressed with their knowledge and attentiveness. Over time, I have come to have a favorite server named David, he knows everything about the menu and ensures everyone at the table is enjoying theirselves. David is such a good server that I have chosen to wait additional time just for a table in his section - make sure to request him!    Now, the food. I am always speechless. I have tried many things on the menu but my favorite (my partners favorite as well) is the 60 Second Prime NY Strip. The flavors that are captured by this dish are incredible. I have visited all three 5 Church locations (others in Charleston and Atlanta) and still always order that steak.   I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone that asks for recommendations, and trust me it is often. Since being a concierge at the Ritz-Carlton, to managing retail stores, I have had lots of opportunity to work with CLT residents and visitors alike and 5 Church is always top of the list for suggestions.   Last night was my most recent visit and I'm already craving it again! Can't wait to return.

I tried out 5Church last night (1-25-14) thanks in part to restaurant week. My friend had arranged for reservations and when we both arrived, we were seated right away. The lighting was a lot darker than I expected and we kept getting a huge gust of cold air due to the fact that we were seated near the entrance.   As a part of the restaurant week menu, I ordered the tomato soup as an app, grilled hanger steak (medium) for entree, and smore's trifle for dessert. For a drink, I ordered a glass of sauv blanc (which was delicious and crisp). The tomato soup was my favorite portion of the meal. It had a hearty consistency, topped with a long, thin crispy bread that was coated with cheese and pesto. It was the perfect utensil for dunking in the soup. The hanger steak was a little chewy for my liking, (I'm not the biggest steak fan though), served with a potato risotto which was perfectly fine. The smore's trifle was good but very sweet! I tasted more chocolate flavor than graham cracker or marshmallow.  The most notable aspect of our meal was the attentiveness of our waitress and other waitstaff. Like, EXTREME attentiveness. They all take the job seriously of re-filling your water glass(es), bringing new utensils, 'fluffing' your napkins, and making sure that you're enjoying your meal(s). In a restaurant as busy and as popular as 5Church, the staff makes you feel like you're populating the only table.

First let me say the food at 5Church was great. We tried the hummus appetizer and the pork belly appetizer, and they were both very tasty. The salmon and chicken entrees were also very delicious. However, the atmosphere wasn't really my style. We're in our mid-30s, and most of the diners were in their early 20s; the girls were decked out in 5 inch stilletos and micro minis and the guys were in suits. The decor is very modern, and the music felt like house music with some serious bass. As much as I loved the food, I felt really old! Looks like it's definitely a great new hotspot in uptown... I may just need to stick to lunch.

Basically as lackluster as you can get for such a great location.  I live in the building and have been disappointed time and time again.  Slow service. Blah food that often comes out the wrong temperature. There are too many better options uptown to waste calories and money here.  What totally kills it for me is that the parking garage that it is attached to reeks of garbage and it is noticeably stinky in the restaurant. It smells of old beer and dirty restaurant floor, but I'm pretty sure it's the garage.  One nice thing:  they have Jordan Chardonnay.
bottomless sangria and mimosa brunch. enough said. ... good food too.

The decor was lovely...drinks were fab. Wasn't particularly crazy about the menu. Had been hearing such wonderful things, but was slightly disappointed. I love fancy food, but  just didn't find anything small that sounded appetizing and didn't have pork or an expensive price tag that I felt was worth it. I did try the lobster mac and cheese, which was quite tasty! The service was great though. Nice spot for friends to hang out or a date. But I would stick to drinks only. Just my opinion :)
Good food and vibe,l but stay away from the monkfish

I've been to 5Church for brunch three times now and the brunch menu is one of the best I've ever seen. Though the menu is not necessarily long, every single item on there sounds fantastic. In my three visits, I've ordered something different every time. The brunch burger is amazing!! Definitely the best hang over meal. The crab cakes and poached egg is also to die for- definitely lighter than the brunch burger if that's what you're feeling! I also have tried the mushroom omelette and it was also really good-- the breakfast potatoes that came with the omelette were the best part. Oh yeah, make sure to order the double mimosas! The mimosas were great but last time I ordered a mojito and didn't enjoy it as much. As for the ambiance, this place has one of the best decors I've ever seen! Definitely gives off a super chic and posh vibe. Overall, 5church is a great restaurant. I haven't been for dinner but I'm sure it wouldn't disappoint.

Came here last saturday night and had a good time. It was crowded but that was expected since this is one of the most popular restaurants in uptown charlotte. The restaurant is designed really well with a ton of detail. I had their signature lamb burger but I wasn't impressed. If I had another chance, I would order a different meal.

Disappointing evening at 5 Church!   Service was terrible.  On a bright note the cauliflower soup was very good.  However, the rest of the meal was a disaster.  I had the roasted chicken which had good flavor but it was not hot.  The mashed potatoes were practically cold.  My husband's hanger steak was also served cold.  For desert, I was supposed to get a brownie with toasted marshmallow on the side.  Without any explanation, they decided to serve it with ice cream, not what I ordered.  Will not be back.  Even the decor is looking a bit tired, there were rips in the seating.

I LOVE the decor here! (Esp the handwrittings on the ceiling) Ive been really excited to tryout their brunch since I heard it's really good! Our waiter was really friendly, everyone here is really friendly lol! The food took a while to come out, and when it did it wasn't warmed, it felt like it had been sitting out for a while. I had the waffles w/ the chia syrup & oh lord it tasted like straight up Christmas!! I was so shooked, I really like the caramelized fruit that it came with. I tasted some of my cousin's crab Benedict, it was good but like I said it wasn't warmed up and seafood starts to taste fishy when it's cool down. I think I would come back to tryout their dinner menu because I really enjoyed the ambience here but the location that it's located in isn't ideal for me!!

Went here for dinner and was so happy with the choice! The ambiance is a cool, hip, contemporary vibe. U have to check out the ceiling! As for the food, it was perfect!! We had a variety of things from steak, chicken, salad, pizza and everything was fantastic! Great flavors and presentation! The drinks were awesome as well. The only thing we didn't love were the indian pierogis but everything else, including the dessert was spot on!

Exceptional. This is possibly the best work lunch I have had in Charlotte. Food is great and decor is amazing. The detail and care given to the food can be seen as soon as the plate lands in front of you. From the first to last bite, it does not disappoint in the complexity and correctness of flavours.  Went with a party of 4 on 7/13/2012. I had my eyes on this place when they opened, but they only had dinner service. By chance, I learned they started serving lunch and got a group of friends to go. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food, four different entrees.  The only remote thing that was poorly executed during lunch was the wait staff's attention. It seems like they might have just recently started lunch service and we had to ask a waitress to come take our order. But when the actual food came, that was long forgotten.  If you enjoy good food, this place is a must visit in Charlotte.

Tried 5church on a Saturday night with my bf, didn't make a reservation so we had to wait about 20 minutes but the time passed quickly as we sat at the bar, enjoyed a drink and the ornately decorated interior.  It was restaurant week so we got to order three course meals for $30 (or so we thought...had a few hidden fees including $7 bottle of water and $7 up charge for filet which was not mentioned on the menu or by the server)  The service was very slow and the server was unapologetic for the amount of time that passed between courses. She did little to enhance the dining experience in the mean time and messed up our appetizer order but corrected it with out any remorse.  I thought maybe it was because we were sitting outside and therefore easily forgotten but the tables around us were getting an average amount of attention. Then we thought it was because we were younger and perhaps she thought we didn't have much money to throw around. Whatever the reason, the experience was not a good one which is a shame because the food is very very good (and a bit pricey). As a vegetarian, the only dish I could have was the fried tofu and kimchi, but it was great! Very different, very tasty.  Next time we are in Charlotte, we will be trying other places before returning to 5church.

We ended up at 5Church after the Liverpool vs AC Milan match. It was absolutely packed and the wait was 30-45 minutes for inside seating. They had tables available outside that weren't being used so we asked to sit outside.   Honestly, the staff seemed completely overwhelmed EXCEPT for our 2 waitresses who appeared to be tag teaming the outdoor tables. We ordered appetizers that the runners ended up taking to the incorrect table and didn't realize it. We ended up getting the Calamari and lettuce wraps after our entrees came out but the comped them so it was fine.  The real stars were our lamb Burger and Bolognese. Absolutely amazing

Good food but over priced. The lamb burger was good. My friend had the chicken and another had the steak. I think there menus is limited and your meal only comes with one side. And additional side is 8 dollars.

I've only ever been for brunch and definitely like it. The sangrias and mimosas are only $2.50 and the atmosphere is so cute! Which they had some cool benedicts on the menu. Also a tip, you can sub out toast for a biscuit. It may cost more but it is so worth it!

Updated review: came back to 5church for restaurant week (unknowingly) and then for dinner again when some friends were visiting from out of town. Both experiences were good. We got a proper table this time, the drinks were decent, I'm not a huge fan of the crushed nuts on the rim of the old fashioned, but the bourberry I think it's called was really good. The food was delicious, obviously well plated, I would say I thought the appetizers were a little small portion wise, the lobster starter we ordered was maybe 3 bites max. But again, quality was great, service was good for the most part for a busy restaurant.

First let me explain that I am picky eater! With that being said, I always view the menu online so I know what I am getting ahead of time.
