This is exactly what I did, but unfortunately the website menu was not updated (according to the waiter it had not been updated in about 1 year).  After a let down and endless questions, I FINALLY pick what I want. A few moments later our waiter informs me that they do not have the  pasta to make that specific dish.  so back to the drawing board.   Eventually I just asked for the  manager; who was SO professional, nice and understanding! We ended up creating a dish that I knew I would enjoy. Everyone in our party enjoyed the food and the DJ was great! He even shouted out the birthday girl in our group!

So I came to 5Church with some of my girls...it was great! We snacked on the local heirloom tomato risotto, chilled asparagus, crisp Szechuan pork belly, artisan cheese selection and the roasted mushroom gnocchi. Everything was great!!! This place is very cool, young & old mixed!...even Cam Newton was here. Check it out, great food, atmosphere and drinks... Come enjoy it as much as me & my friends have!!! Good eats!! -SK

Where to start?!! Amazing atmosphere! Great service! Our server was Grace and she was always there to greet a new guest at our party. The crab cakes are insane with hardly any filler I could taste. The 60 second steak is a must try if you enjoy a rare steak.  Calamari and the shrimp flat bread were a few of my guests favorites at the party as well.  One of the best bars and restaurants you can go to in uptown to get an amazing wine list or classy cocktail without breaking the bank. There really is something on the menu for everyone. I can't wait to back with a group of friends. Thank you 5Church for a hosting a great evening!

Finally had the chance to have dinner at 5Church on Saturday night. It is my new favorite; the food and service was some of the best I have ever experienced.  I had the scallops and they were incredible; everything on the plate had a role to play. My wife very much enjoyed the filet. The filet had a perfect crust on each side and was cooked to temp perfectly.   The corn soup was also perfectly balanced with a rich creamy texture.   I find myself craving the soup and scallops now. Can't wait for our next visit. All the recognition and awards 5Church has received is well deserved.

Ever eaten inside a work of modern art before?  Well this is about how it would feel.  Not only is the food spectacular New American cuisine, but the decor is splendid.  We sat a a small table for two.  The small table was made of concrete that was made to look as if it had a table cloth draped over it.  The server had to tell is to be careful because it was concrete and not cloth.  Details abound and I can say that the chicken dish and the bison steak were both great.

The wait was a bit long for our food during lunch time. This was a bit concerning as the restaurant was empty when we arrived. Overall, the food was delicious once it arrived. The baby spinach salad tasted well, nothing special.

This place is a little hard to find. Its on the corner of 5th and Church (hence the name), not on Tryon St. Super hip and stylish decor. The food was good. Visited for dinner on a Tuesday night and the place was packed. Looks like a great place to host large parties since most of the tables were packed with 10-15 people. My friend and I had the bacon pizza, shrimp flatbread, short ribs (super tender) and the bistro steak. For dessert, the s'mores trifle. Everything was really tasty. I would definitely visit again if I'm in town. PS the staff is all eye candy. Enjoy!

First visit to 5church Charlotte, love it  I have been to the location in Atlanta twice and these guys really have it together  Beautiful restaurant, food is outstanding and friendly staff I hope to visit the other location in Charleston  Love the 5church

I love this place. I love the location. I love the atmosphere. On the many occasions I have been to 5Church, my experiences have always been up to par. The one time I had a not so great experience, the management was quick to fix it and actually made me want to come back. The food is creative and delicious. The staff knowledgeable about the dishes and the wines that are served. I highly recommend this place to all my friends... oh, and especially for Sunday brunch!

Yes, this restaurant is really as good as people say it is. Although I was initially shocked by the clear plastic lawn chairs at the dining room tables, everything else about the experience was absolutely perfect. Except for maybe our too-cool-for-school server in his converse high-tops and skinny jeans. But I will totally overlook that because he was somewhere nearby when we needed him. Albeit with a totally blas√© look on his face. But our orders were perfect and we wanted for nothing.  We met some friends for dinner after the DNC cleared out of town and, truthfully, fourth ward was eerily empty. No worries ... plenty of room at the bar to enjoy a cocktail before dinner. Everything from drinks to snacks to entrees to desserts (we had 3...) were absolutely delicious. There was not one less than perfect plate of food that was placed in front of us. And, not surprisingly, every plate was sent back to the kitchen perfectly cleaned. Szechuan pork belly, beet slider, mussels, cheese plate, salmon, grouper ... you name it, we devoured it.  I cannot wait to go back and try out some more of their amazing food and lounge out in the plastic lawn chairs with friends.
The ambience is good but the portions are tooooooo small given the high price (you can finish the ravioli is three bites). The 60 sec NY steak isn't too good as well. Don't recommend it at all!!!

Had some drinks and appetizers at the bar- really enjoyed ourselves! Customer service was fab- great suggestions from the staff as far as what to order and held nice conversation. Nice decor inside as well. looking forward to going back and having dinner soon!
Service was okay, food and drinks were way overpriced for the amount you got. Probably won't be back.

Superb food and service. We went here for restaurant week and it was fantastic. I recommend the Vietnamese Meatballs, Scallops, Ahi Tuna Poke (huge portion!), or Wasabi Tuna-- I guess I recommend anything! I would, and will, come back when the items are full price because the quality of the food is worth it.

Been to 5 Church twice. First time with another couple who picked this restaurant as one of the choices to go to. 2nd time was on my birthday when we had plans to go to another restaurant which turned out they were closed. 5Church is just ok for me. To be honest, I wasn't impressed with it the first time and after the 2nd time definitely wouldn't go back. Its one of those Charlotte restaurants that their ambience prevails over their food. For the price and the attempt to please the sophisticated palate, I'd go elsewhere. I had scallops the first time there (it was okay- not memorable) and steak 2nd time. My steak and my son's pork chops both had the same "barbecue" tasting sauce all over it. For a price tag of $26 and it does not include sides other than the piece of meat sitting on top of mash potatoes and one broccoli. Cocktails were average $12 and not top shelf.

Before going to a show at the Belk Theater, six of us went to dine at Five Church.  The only slight complaint was the table where our party was seated, near to the front door, especially when the reservation was made several days in advance.  The service was outstanding.  We had the bacon pizza, pork belly snack, and mussels for appetizers.  All were very good.  The tomato sauce over the mussels was excellent.  We had 6 different entrees, all delicious.  My flounder was very good.  My taste of the duck, hanger steak, and short ribs was also very tasty.  Very nice experience!

Went here for lunch the other day with the ol lday and had the Lamb Burger. I can say it was mediocre" probrolly due to the fact that grease was running everywhere. Couldn't hold the burger and eat it-Had to cut it in half. When I cut the burger in half all of dressing and patty fell apart. Maybe I'll try something less messy next time.

The service was amazing along with the food. If you're looking for a place to wine and dine, this is the place. The manager is exceptional and came to make sure everything was going well. We even got champagne on the house because my friends got engaged. They made them feel so special, which is great.

This is not the place if you're looking for great food. Their cocktails are fab! The atmosphere is trendy and cool.   We ordered a table full of appies. Mussels, meatballs, lettuce wrap, pierogies and Brussels sprouts with bacon.   Mussels and Brussels sprouts were actually pretty good, not amazing. The meatballs, pierogies and lettuce wraps were incredibly dry and flavorless!   Us being big dessert people, we thought maybe if we ordered 2 of the waitress' favs, this place could redeem itself. We got the white chocolate cheesecake and the red velvet. Boy were we disappointed. Both had a lingering flavor of sitting in the fridge uncovered.   All in all, we would not return unless only to have cocktails!   **warning**  DO NOT ORDER FOOD HERE, YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED

5church has great service and atmosphere and that's where it ends.  The food is just not good.  We came for brunch. The menu reads very well but the execution is poor.  Biscuits are dry and hard, chicken salad is dry and flavorless.  The person sitting next to our table had to send back their lamb burger for some reason and ordered something else.  I feel as though this place would be a great nightlife spot for cocktails but the food needs a lot of help.

Came back to Charlotte and happened upon 5Church again, this time for brunch around 2pm on a Saturday. The place is not nearly as banging in the daytime but the food was still fanstastic and the service was great.   If you like boozy brunches, they offer a $10 all-you-can-drink sangria brunch special which was tempting...but I didn't want to be on the floor the rest of the day. We had fantastic food including an omelet, shrimp and polenta (with the BEST tomato gravy I've ever had...amazing!!!), extra homefries, and the crab cake benedict. YUMYUMYUM. The food was great and hit the spot- right on.  Love this place.

Went here twice on my trip to Charlotte. On Friday night, the boyfriend and I went to a late dinner. We immediately felt under dressed - this seems more the type of place where the uber hip go to meet. The ambiance is strange - trying a little too hard to be New York when were were looking for more authentic Charlotte.    Our server was friendly and attentive, even when he was seated with a loud eight top right after we sat down. We had the hanger steak and a trout dish - both were good but nothing to write home about.   Saturday night we were joining a birthday party and knew more of what to expect. Although we had to fight hoards of men wearing bedazzled t-shirts, the drinks and the music were good.
Really like the ambience. Food is ok, good local beers on tap.

We came here for brunch with our new airport friend who lives  in the area. The place is very spacious and has a chic industrial vibe, with exposed pipes and slate color walls. The blackboard ceiling was a very cool touch and I was a bit dizzy trying to read all of the writing up there. We arrived a bit late for our noon reservation, the place was pretty busy so reservations are definitely recommended. The host was very nice and so was our server, she patiently answered all of our questions and gave recommendations. We were all very hungry and everything sounded delicious so it was hard to make a decision, we ended up ordering the buttermilk biscuit, shrimp and grits, crab cakes, French toast and a side of bacon. The food took a while but we were enjoying our mimosas so we didn't mind. All of the dishes were delicious!! My buttermilk biscuit was so rich and the wild mushroom and truffle cream flavors blended wonderfully! This was my first time trying shrimp and  grits and I was very impressed! Overall we had a great time, service was good and the food was amazing.

Mother's Day Brunch was my first visit to this little secret.  Off the beaten Tryon path, the GPS took us to their mailing address at 127 Tryon & Trade.  5Church means 5th & Church!  It's right on that corner.  I fell in love with the look & feel of the place.  Great bar with a ton of wine selections.  A combo of leather seating & thrifty looking painted wood tables in the waiting area.  (No wait.)  I have to agree with other reviews that this is the best Lamb Burger for many, many miles around.  In fact, my daughter ordered it and we all ended up eating off her plate.  Crab cakes & poached egg was well prepared & tasty but more like a small plate size.  The belgian waffles also were very tasty but came to the table a bit cold.  Though the place was full it wasn't overcrowded so the service seemed a bit slow.  I will return to take a seat at the bar (my favorite place to sit) & try lunch and/or dinner selections.  But it will be very hard to order something other than that Lamb Burger!

I'm part of the group that dined with Fei W. but wanted to share my experience as well.   So I'm a casual resident of Charlotte, NC due to my husband living out there for his work, and a couple of my friends came down to visit for the weekend. 5church is really close to his apartment, so we stopped there for drinks and appetizerss to start our night.   Like Fei mentioned, the restaurant wasn't technically open for another 5 minutes, and I made some stupid joke about how we're willing to help ourselves to the back of the bar if we needed to. Maybe that set them off, but it was pretty clear I was kidding. Anyway, they said no tables were available, but we can sit at the bar. I checked on opentable because I could not believe all 5pm reservations would be taken (Where are these people with the reservations? Are they all late? It was already 4:55pm... Where's the mad rush of people trying to get in for their reserved table?) and lo and behold, a 5:30pm reservation was available. I went back to the hostess station and told her that we actually have a table now, and wanted to let her know that we are happy to hang out at the bar until the table is ready. She barely looked at me while I was talking to her, played with her touch screen reservation system and said, rather coldly, "Are you ready now to be seated?" I told her yes, and she took us upstairs.  Ok that struck me as kinda odd. Why were were all the way upstairs, when the main room was totally empty? Are we not worthy to be seen through the windows by the passerby?   I will say, though, that our server was excellent and the food we ordered was amazing. We ordered hummus, quinoa tabbouleh, beet slider, foie gras ravioli, fries, and i think the chickpea salad, as well as an array of cocktails, wine, and beer. We were very happy with the food and drinks and with our server, which is why this review gets 3 stars.   When we left, I went up to the hostess table and asked what was the issue with the reservation. By then, I believe the owner was there (Patrick Whalen), and he informed me that there was a glitch in opentable and they told them not to book any more tables. I can't remember if he apologized or not for the confusion, but then he made a joke about how it was actually because they didn't really want us there. I laughed (but didn't think it was funny...retribution for my bad joke?) and said "Yeah I could tell." We did tell him the food was great, but left it at that, and walked out.   Bottom line, I havent decided if I'd come here again, but the food is that good to make me even consider it. If I have another experience, I'll be sure to update my review.

Well, I'm visiting Charlotte with my boyfriend and ended up eating at 5Church per the interest of a friend of ours. I was hesitant, given the yelp ratings and expected an overpriced experience with mediocre food, but I was thrilled to be proven wrong!  We made a reservation Saturday afternoon for a Saturday evening table for 4, and got a table at a decent time with no problem.  Sure, the place is trendy, the downstairs area was popping. That's not really my thing. I like to eat, not party. But hey! That didn't take away from the deliciousness of the food.   We started with the pork belly spring rolls and gnocchi. Holy hell. They were FANTASTIC. The spring rolls come with 2 per order. So, we had to get two orders.  The boys both ordered the short ribs with shallot jus and mashed potatoes. My friend and I ordered the scallops on creamy polenta. The dish came with 4 large pieces of scallops. And was definitely filling compared to most scallop dishes, but... Me being me... I eat surprisingly more than most 95lbs females. I cleaned my plate up and ordered an additional pork belly spring roll app to fill me up! The other girl seemed filled with her scallop dish. The polenta was creamy and rich, the perfect complement to the light, fresh seared scallops. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.   I tried my boyfriend's braised short ribs, jus, and mashed potatoes... And if I wasn't so perfectly satisfied with my scallops, I would have had major food envy.   I cook short ribs a LOT. In fact, because I obsess over it in the kitchen, I can appreciate a well made braised short rib. Tender, fatty and falling apart. The shallot jus adding even more delicate juice and flavor. And the silky mashed potatoes just soaking it all up. Sigh. I might have to go back just to have my own plate of it.   Then came dessert. At this point, I'd eaten more than anyone at the table. But the lemon creme br√ªl√©e tart (if I recall correctly)... Our waitress lit up when I asked about it. And it was fantastic!! Not overly tart to where you're puckering up. Not overly sweet to overcompensate for the tartness. Perfect texture and complimentary crust. My boyfriend who despises lemon treats absolutely loved it.   And the s'mores dessert. Which I wasn't expecting to be as delicious as it was also had me eating past my limit even AFTER the lemon tart.   Fantastic service from our waitress who was kind, honest and attentive.   Fantastic experience all in all. And possibly my favorite meal in Charlotte yet!

had my first meal here last night.  owners did a great job with the up fit as the inside has a sleek trendy feel- very modern but comfortable decor.  started out with some kind of muddled lychee drink which was AMAZING! can't remember all that was in it but i know it had lychee, vanilla vodka and ginger ale- very refreshing and easy to drink.  i had more than one... our table shared several of the "snacks" which were all very good with exception to the st louis mushroom ravioli which was just ok. the chickpea salad was very good as was the black bean dip and pork belly. Now on to my entree.  I had the "60 second" strip steak which was amazing.  The steak sauce it comes sitting on was very good although they should warn (write it on the menu) someone getting a steak  or chop of this sauce.  I happen to love steak sauce but I know many people who don't.  The pork chop entree came with the same sauce so there is a theme.  btw,  i was told the pork chop was very good. Overall, the food was very well executed.  Service was average but adequate.   I will go back.

This was our Christmas dinner. We found a piece of black rubber in the coke. The waiter brought another cup after we told him. The weird thing was the manager walked by later like nothing happened. He did not apologize nor acknowledge it. The restaurant charged us full price for the coke. Their food was good, but the staff's attitude made us concerned that they do not take hygiene problem very serious. Serving a drink with a rubber in it should be the least thing we expect from an expensive restaurant like this. I don't think we will come back.

This restaurant is by far one of the most delicious restaurants of Charlotte. My boyfriend and I go here every time we celebrate something and there is a reason for that because going to this restaurant is an absolute treat. I've gotten the crispy tofu (which was divine) and the flank steak before and my boyfriend just recently got the brined chicken which you literally didn't even need a knife to cut with.   Not only is their good delicious but their staff has always been very generous and have seemed to care about their customers.  My boyfriend and I love coming back here because of a brilliant food, attentive wait staff and chic ambiance.

I went to 5Church on Saturday night with 4 others for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. The restaurant is gorgeous and swanky and fabulous, filling a spot otherwise unfilled in Charlotte. It was very crowded and only got more so as the night went on (we left at 11 when it seemed to be turning into a real bar!). Caution, ladies - the floor is VERY slippery, as in, I almost slipped in my heels a few times, so hold on to the railing (or the nearest man) and make your way to your table!  The food: Ok. I had very, very high expectations. I was blown away by the pork belly and spicy cabbage - just perfect. We also tried the quinoa tabouleh, as recommended by our server, and the lobster mac n cheese. Both of these were fine, but nothing special. I had the Coco Loco duck mole, one of the chef's signature dishes, and it was...alright. Very, very rich but not spectacular. My boyfriend got the 60-second steak and loved it and another friend had the scallops and raved about them. Our waiter brought a s'mores dessert that was really good.  Overall, I would come back but I have to be honest that it was a little bit disappointing. Still very good though!

I went to 5Church for restaurant week with a group of people. I loved everything about the restaurant. The ambiance was great, my waitress was very attentive, and the food was amazing. I order the Szechuan Pork Belly, the J-1 steak and potatoes, and the rootbeer float. I also had some food that my friends ordered. I enjoyed the hummus, but I would have to say that my favorite item that night was the lamb burger and fries. The ketchup had an indian flavor to it and it was perfect for the fries.   The food took awhile to come out, but everything is homemade and fresh, so I didn't mind the wait. I am definitely going back and I have recommend this restaurant to my friends and family.

Soooooo much better this time. Grease traps were clean and not stinking. The app special fig was incredible, the gnocchi app was very good as well. The apps. Were very good tonight and the atmosphere  was awesome.

Love Love LOVE this place.  5Church has been on my list of Charlotte restaurants to try pretty much ever since I moved here.  It wasn't until I walked in the door that I realized "OMG, I totally came here on a date and had the most amazing rosemary cocktail at the bar."  I'll be honest, I don't remember who I was with, but I sure do remember the cocktail!  So this was my chance to try the food.  I came for restaurant week, which is always a bit of a gamble.  I started out with the deviled eggs.  Not usually a huge fan, but these were by far the best deviled eggs I've ever had (sorry every Southern grandma out there with their "amazing deviled egg recipe).  Super smooth and flavorful and not gritty like you can get sometimes with egg yolks.  Then they came out with this awesome white bean hummus.  Yeah, we had two...don't judge.  Middle of the meal was an 8oz filet that was completely worth every bit of the $8 upcharge.  Meat was cooked perfectly and the sides were great.  Finishing off with desert, we tried the pretzel bar (it was pretty good) and the S'mores (BIG WINNER!!! I'm still dreaming about the brownies that came in this dessert).  Atmosphere is super modern.  Cocktails are fantastic (I tried the Rosemary Gin Fizz and the Viper).  Perfect for a date or business dinner where you want to impress, and you get a bit of that "Uptown scene", too.  Overall, I absolutely and highly recommend this place.  I'm glad I came back, because this time, my date and dining experience were both memorable.

I've never had a bad meal here and the service has always been superb. The most impressive thing about 5Church is that they aim to delight.  They handle situations the way they should be handled and make sure the customer leaves happy.  Fantastic service is hard to find these days.  They turned me from a fan into a raving fan in March, when we were there for my mom's birthday.  They went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect and treated her like a queen.  I was beyond impressed.  And then there's the food.  Oh, the food!  Chef Jamie is "da bomb."  First time for brunch?  Get the Lamb Burger.  Celebration dinner with your honey? Get the Prime "60 Second" NY Strip Steak.  The preparation of it will delight you.  For appetizer, get the mussels.  The sauce will rock your world.  Wash down your dinner with the Viper.  It's like a margarita, but with cucumber water, and absolutely delicious.

Visited 5Church for my friends Birthday Celebration and it did not disappoint! The decor is very different but yet very appropriate. My girls and I had reservations on a Saturday night and it was pretty packed! Many people hung out around the bar while others ate dinner. The drinks were very good, my favorites were the wild berry mojito and the viper. The viper however is strong. My friend ordered the cauliflower soup and boy oh boy was that soooo good! I had the the chick pea salad which was just "eh" I also had the hanger steak with mash potatoes! The steak was cooked perfectly and was flavored very well, while the mashed potatoes taste like they came from a box. The other ladies enjoyed the Herb brined roasted chicken and of course I sampled that as well! The chicken was so tender and juicy and flavored well with the natural jus on top! I must say this place does not disappoint! Perfect for date nite or girls night on the town! I hear they have an awesome brunch, will be back to try!

Went for restaurant week. Our server Kevin was awesome. The wine pairing was a perfect match for the three course meal and my boyfriend and I enjoyed every second of the meal!  Black bean hummus and the pork belly appetizers were lovely.  Hangar steak was flavorful and tender. Salmon crusted with wasabi was perfectly cooked and delicious. The dessert was phenomenal - s'mores and chocolate cake.   A must try!

Have been here twice now and wanted to make sure the second experience was as consistently average as the first before I wrote my review. Sorry to say, second time was no better.  I will hand it to them, the ambiance is very cool, in a hip "scene" kind of way which I don't mind on some occasions. Kind of a cross between something you would expect to find in the SoHo art district and a Vegas hotel.  Unfortunately, that's about the best I have to say... so much potential, it's almost there, c'mon CLT you can do it.  Okay, food is average all around. I think everyone lets the ambiance cloud their impression of the food quality because CLT is just desperate for a hot new place, but if you were just served the food, it would be just average. The lamb burger was the best dish and everything else was just ehh... pork belly app was over cooked and chewy and other dishes were nothing to write home about. It sounds good on the menu, but each dish (aside from the lamb burger) had something off... either one ingredient was off, it wasn't cooked properly, etc.    My next problem... you would think a restaurant that put so much attention and detail into the interior would at very least give 2 seconds of thought to the wine list, but no... I am a foodie and wino and believe the best dining experiences are created when the food and wine are in harmony - wine can make or break the experience, and it is so sad to say that this place has about the worst wine list I've seen... just makes no sense, doesn't go with the food and just seems out of place, like someone wearing a hoodie over a suit.  Here's what they should do... first, design the menu, then carefully select wines that go with the dishes. It's not that hard people. Pick the right wines, train your staff on what wines to recommend with what dishes, and then people will say your food tastes better - the best dish paired with a bad wine can make the dish taste awful, but an average dish paired correctly can make it taste better.  It's like the sauce... without it something is missing.  Apologies for my rant, but I find it difficult to understand how this place can get so much hype when there is so much lacking.

It doesn't have a 5 in its name for nothing. This place definitely deserves 5 stars for my experience. My wife and I met some friends Saturday night for dinner. We had excellent service from our server kaelee. I definitely recommend the New York strip you will not be disappointed!
Over rated. That is all.   I said over rated. Stop reading this and find another restaurant.
Amazing scallops!! And their lobster mac and cheese has frash chunks of lobster! Great date night atmosphere!  Richard the bartender took great care of us despite the fact that they were slammed.

The setting is stylish - but feels like they are trying too hard.  Everything is a little predictable.  That said, the lunch menu is not predictable and looked promising.  Unfortunately, everything was a little heavy and a little greasy.  There is a lot of potential, but lacking in delivery and certainly not worth the cost.

I went to 5Church on October 31, 2012 at the recommendation of the bartender at Black Finn. I, and my group totaling 8 people, were excited about going. The atmosphere was eclectic,upscale, modern and vibrant. We were a large party and were seated in a separate off the main area. We were treated warmly by the person who seated us. The restaurant was not very crowded but the service was very slow. The initial wait person apologized for wait and took our initial drink order. When our assigned waitress, Alison, came she seemed a little stressed and asked if we needed more time to look over the menu. We had already been waiting quite a while and were more than ready to place our orders. We ordered cocktails from their specialty cocktail menu and they were all terrible! We tried to explain to Alison what our issue was but she seemed not to understand and wanted to charge my wife an extra shot of tequila instead of just remaking the cocktail which would have been the appropriate thing to do. Alison became argumentative with my wife which was very unprofessional. Naturally, this interaction ruined the mood for the entire evening. The drink was eventually remade to my wife's specifications but the evening was already ruined at that point. The food finally arrived and was just "okay". I had the wasabi crusted salmon which had way too much wasabi crust and a small portion of salmon. My wife had smoked, roasted chicken which she enjoyed. My guest all enjoyed their meals. Overall, our evening way ruined by Alison's bad attitude. I would still give 5Church another try the next time we visit Charlotte.

Flawless presentation !! Enjoyed my meal of Hangar steak , crushed potatoes and spicy grilled broccoli for main entree . For starters did the grilled octopus and jerk chicken wraps . Nothing disappointed at all!! Atmosphere is grown and sexy dimly lit with great background music and crowd noise. The gin fizz with liquid egg whites was ordered by my date whom thoroughly enjoyed it. Tried out 2 wines before deciding on my final choice of Row 11 a Pinot Noir . The waitress Brittany was very accommodating and attentive to my parties needs . I would strongly recommend and plan on coming back .

I live in the neighborhood and want to really like and support 5 Church but, since my initial visit and review, I have made three unfulfilling visits back.  I travel around the country for a living and dine out about five times a week.  When I saw a recent listing, ranking 5 Church as a Top Ten spot in the U.S. for dining solo, I decided to try it again on a weekend where my fianc√© was out of town.  Congrats to them for that ranking - quite impressive and I'm sure it will drive new business to the restaurant!  I walked in to a crowded, vibrant atmosphere, found a spot at the bar, and waited...my hope was to enjoy a few drinks and a nice meal but, after five minutes of not being acknowledged by anyone, I left.   Good food will get frequent diners like me to a restaurant and back again perhaps once or twice but, with so many choices in Uptown and the surrounding area, attentiveness and a welcoming atmosphere is where I want to spend my money.

Wow, the food, fantastic, the decor, fantastic, the service fantastic.    Took my girlfriend here for her birthday last night and I was excited to see the new place.  This location has struggled with different owners and companies in and out.  I don't think that will be a problem from now on.    I had the Coco Loco Duck Mole and it was the best duck I've ever tasted.  Duck can sometimes be a bit over done but not this time.  Perfectly cooked!  We started the dinner off with the shrimp flat bread appetizer and even though I didn't think it was taking long to come out from the kitchen, apparently the chef did and brought out a complimentary plate of black bean hummus for us.  Nice touch if I do say so!  The decor, like others have commented is super trendy, sexy and cool.  I asked what all the writing on the ceiling was and was told it was the entire book Art of War.  Amazing.  The padded leather sofas are ultra comfy and I could see myself coming here just to hang and have a drink.    Speaking of drinks, they have a fantastic bar area too and the drink selection seems decent.  One final note, my girlfriend checked in to Four Square and mentioned it was her birthday.  I guess the hostess saw that and they brought out a special dessert for her.  Now THAT is service!

I have been hesitant to try this restaurant because of the mixed reviews in both Charlotte and Charleston (hometown). WOW was my group impressed with this restaurant. We decided to go during Queens Feast (restaurant week) because you cannot beat that deal! The food was delicious, the server was great! He was always around to fill our glass, never felt rushed, and when we had questions, he had answers.   The quality of the food was top notch, the preparation was impressive, and the presentation was beautiful. My fianc√© tried the craft cocktails (2 of them) and he loved the viper but didn't like the 2nd with Hendricks.   We can't wait to go back!

Had dinner there with a friend. We sat at the bar and had great service, and the food was also very good. This was all a happy surprise, as I had a much less satisfactory experience at the Atlanta location. Try the lamb shank!

This place is awesome. Great atmosphere but the service is phenomenal!!! They went above and beyond. We had the steak w/ lobster and crab. Meatball apps were good but the ahi tuna app was very delicious. Not only did the manager come out to make sure our experience was nothing short of wonderful but they invited us to the kitchen to meet the top chef!!! Kudos to 5 church!
Very good food. Love the decor and ambiance. It's a very trendy spot and typically stays busy. The service isn't always the best but the food makes up for it.

Went into this restuarant with high hopes.  I've passed by it walking on 5th a few times and it always looks elegant and busy, so when my company offered to treat our whole office to dinner on them, I suggested 5Church.  Mandi Bane, the sales director, assisted me with coordinating it and was absolutely wonderful.  I must've sent her a dozen emails with changes and updates on our party and reservation.  We were going to be a party of 11 on a Thursday evening at 8:15 PM.  Kudos to 5Church for accepting my company's strange request of paying via check, too!  You made life so much easier on an accounting level!    We arrived feeling like rock stars and were treated as such.  We had our own area of the upstairs and each couple had their own individual table in a U-shaped which was so unique.  Brandon, our server, had all the instructions about our party and payment and he was incredible.  Attentive, knowledgeable, patient...honestly, best service EVER.    We started with drinks and one of my guests ordered 2 bottles of bubbly.  Brandon poured our glasses, we toasted, and then....warm champagne hit my palate.  Something was said and one of the managers (I'm assuming) hurriedly came out with another bottle that was slightly more chilled.  Very classy.    I ordered a beverage called the Viper, a trendy concotion of cucumber and tequila with a surprising kick of pepper.  It was unique.    Soooo....why only 3 stars?  Well, because frankly the food was terrible.  We had heard about the 60-second strip steak and ordered it medium rare which we knew would come out close to moo-ing.  We didn't know it would be served almost raw and cold.  I was expecting it to be seared on the outside (so hot) and cool on the inside.  It was served on top of mashed potatoes-also cold.  And the sauce tasted like a jazzed up version of A-1.  (My apologies to the chef, but it has to be said).  Of the four people in our party that ordered 2 sent it back and requested it be taken off the bill.  Me and my boyfriend choked it down, but was displeased with the entree after having such high hopes.    I will say that I will probaly go back for drinks and an appetizer.  We did share the meat tray and that was lovely.  I told Brandon that the proscitto was the best I had ever had. As for service and atmosphere, 5Church really shined, but the entree of the hyped up steak was a major letdown.

Took advantage of Charlotte restaurant week and had dinner here tonight. What a great meal! I had the cauliflower  soup to start, and it was great. Wish I had a huge bowl of it. Then I had the grilled hangar steak, which was an amazing piece of meat. The taste was absolutely fantastic in my opinion. Dessert was a butter cake which was ok, but I'm not a sweets guy, so it was sort of a throw in for me.   My wife had the roasted beet and fennel salad, which she thought was great. I had a few bites and the greens were great! Made me miss summer. Her entr√©e was the seared scallops which she enjoyed very much.    We would love to eat here a few night a week, but it is expensive. And for someone who cooks and know how much food is, I just can't justify spending that much on food. 5church is a very good restaurant.    We also promised our waitress we would mention her. Thank you AMBER for the great service.

Ate here for the first time tonight and it was awesome. Really cool setting with a pretty diverse crowd. Ryan S. was our server and he was fantastic. Very knowledgeable, made great recommendations and was very attentive without being overbearing. My boyfriend and I were very, very happy with all of our food choices-most of them being server recommendations. Craft cocktails were definitely worth the trip as well! We will be back!

I dinned at 5Church on 2/5/15.   Setting: Beautiful restaurant! Everything was very modern, dark and sexy. From the moment I walked in I felt like I wasn't in Charlotte, NC but actually in NYC.   Food: I came with two colleagues, promptly seated around 7pm. Our waiter was absolutely excellent and very attentive. He was knowledgeable about food and gave great recommendations. Started off with various wines as we cruised through the menu. We all ordered the petite filet (med/rare, medium and med/well) mashed yukon and a side of green beans. The food was excellent, but all of our steaks came out practically rare. We didn't send it back though since we were exhausted. I tried the blue cheese steak topping. YUM! It went all over my mashed yukon and green means. We finished off dinner with the chai doughnuts and sorbet. If you like anything chai, please try them!!!!  Overall: I'll be back in Charlotte in May. I will most likely be visiting 5Church again!

Went for a work dinner after glowing recommendations from colleagues. We shared the ceviche and the poke which were great, but oh man the A5 Wagyu really changed my life. Had some solid cocktails but nothing too memorable as well.

Just visiting and the hotel recommended this wonderful restaurant. Loved the steak. My friend had the lamb burger. So good. Service was prompt and professional. Wine menu good selection. Thanks for not adding the same ol' regulars.
Not a good value for money, the restaurant is way overpriced for the quality of food provided.
Horrible service and food. 3 hour wait, after which they informed us them at they got the names mixed up and sat the wrong table. The food was not any better.

While I understand busy times for Queen's Feast however being packed like sardines in a high volume area of the restaurant(service bar at the bottom of the stairs) was horrible. I think we were bumped by every server walking by and every guest wanting a spot at the bar. The dollar speaks and when the atmosphere is horrible the dining experience is horrible. Food was so so.

I've only been here once and may have just ordered the wrong thing. I ordered the flank steak and it was not good. I usually finish my plate and I ate everything but the main protein. Not normal. It's overpriced for the quality I received. I will go back because everyone has a bad day, but if the second time isn't good, there will be another post with 1 star.

Great spot in uptown Charlotte...walkable from anywhere in the city. Really cool, upscale atmosphere inside with white leather and chandeliers for decor. Ordered the filet medium - it was delicious and crispy on top. Had two of "the ivey" cocktails and they were delicious if you like a sweet, fruity drink. Boyfriend got the tuna medium rare and it was great as usual - coated in a wasabi crust. Will definitely be back!

Disclaimer--This review is clearly biased because my fiance proposed to me here (I accepted!).  Also, we visited first week of May, so this review is several weeks overdue.  I've been hearing about Charlotte's burgeoning local food scene for a while, so when I had the opportunity to visit the city, i was super excited to try out a few restaurants.  Thanks to Yelp!, I decided on 5Church for dinner on one of the nights.    We started off with a bottle of malbec, the truffled mushroom pierogies, and the romaine wedge.  The malbec, Twigs Reserva, was a recommendation from our server, Brandon.  It was a good showcase of what an excellent malbec can be--luscious, full of flavor, but still delicate and silky.  As for the appetizers, both were stellar.  I would definitely order the pierogies again.  What's not to love about delicious, pillowy dough and savory mushrooms?  Also, the peperoncini in the wedge salad (are they housemade?) were surprisingly tart and delightful.  I love well-prepared little flourishes.    For the main course we split the seared sea scallops (slightly different preparation than the one on the menu right now) and mac and cheese.  I am a huge scallop snob and 5Church's won me over right away because they were excellently seared.  However, the mac and cheese (no longer on the menu) was a disappointment.  Though it looked deliciously creamy with a nice crunchy topping of (panko?) breadcrumbs, the first bite was oily with a curiously metallic after taste.  As soon as we told Brandon, he whisked it off and took it off our check--what great service!  He also asked us exactly why we didn't like it so he could tell the chef.  We ended the meal with a decadent chocolate trifle with marshmallow sauce.  Very sweet and rich but so unique!  And the portion was large enough to take some back to the hotel for a late-night snack.  Around the same time, my fiance proposed and I have to mention how wonderful the staff was.  Not only did Brandon bring out a bottle of prosecco for us to enjoy, the manager came by to congratulate us.  Thanks 5Church, for not only a memorable meal but also exemplary service.  We will be sure to visit the next time we are in town!

Parking here is a little tough but tolerable. Went here for brunch. Tried the waffle and the omelette, both were very good. Also had the chicken salad sandwich which was also tasty. Service was quick and accurate. Will return and try dinner.

I have been to 5Church a handful of times.  The service is great and the decor is nice.  The first time I went, we sat upstairs in the mezzanine which is a great place to sit for large parties.  Three things on their menu that I have had and I recommend are the pork belly, scallops, Brussell sprouts, and for brunch the crab cakes!  I have also tried whatever people ordered that I was with and everything is pretty good!

I've had brunch here twice.  It was really good, and a little crowded, but it is a popular brunch spot.  The food is here is nice, and a little traditional with a modern flare.  I did think the portion sizes were quite small for the price and quality.  I've also had a better mimosa.  I didn't get to try the sangria because I waited too long, so apparently it is good!  For a nice brunch, I think I would prefer their sister restaurant Nan & Byron's.  I also considered having my rehearsal dinner here.  For the price it was a really good deal for a chic location and good food, depending on your budget of course.  The space is unique, and beautiful with lot's of acrylic fixtures, with an earthy modern feel.  I would come back, maybe during Queens Feast to try their dinner options.

Geez, I haven't written a review in almost a year.  How bad do I suck?    I had pretty high hopes for this place.  Someone whose judgement I (used to) trust recommended it very highly.  I figured it would be at least OK, and in that I was not disappointed.    5Church would like so badly to be so very hip.  The ambiance from the moment you hit the door is a combination of black, mismatched wall decorations, and flop-sweat.  You can feel the vibe shouting at you, "YOU HAVE CHOSEN TO DINE HERE!  YOU ARE SO VERY COOL!!!!!!".  Alas, I am not.  I'm old, cranky, and get pretty annoyed when the food doesn't live up to the hype, so in retrospect the interior didn't work for me.  I will say I received exemplary service.  We ate pretty early (old, remember?), so she wasn't busy, but I really did appreciate her skill at being ingratiating, warm, and efficient.    We started with a shrimp and cheese flatbread.  I guess maybe my sights were set a bit too high, but it was......fine.  Nothing special, or that I can't get elsewhere.  I had the 60 second strip for entree.  The steak itself was acceptable, but again nothing that would make this a destination restaurant.   However, the roasted potatoes it came with wrecked this dish.  Roasted potatoes should be golden, crisp on the outside, fluffy and redolent of time in the oven inside.  I'm reasonably sure the ones I got saw a caramelizing torch for a minute or so.  Bonus points would have been awarded had anyone noticed I ate 1.5 of them and pushed the rest to the side.  Alas, none were given.  The cordial mixed drink I had for afters was a pretty generous pour, and the bartender made sure to come check that he had made it right since it was not a common drink.  Overall I left somewhat disappointed in the food.  The vibe is trying hard, the staff certainly seems invested in creating a good experience, but the food just isn't there for this to be a destination restaurant.  Additionally, I left a comment for the owners through Open Table, and their response seems to have been to add me to their mailing list.  Um, guys?  I don't need more spam.

Just like several of the other reviewers here, my GF and I decided to try this place for dinner last night for the first time (Queen's Feast).  First the positive 1. Good location - 2 blocks from center of uptown.  Basically across the street from my office 2. Nice atmosphere - Some reviews here on Yelp complain about the darkness.  I will have to say that one of the things this place succeeds at is LOOKING like a nice restaurant. 3. Our dinner server was friendly and attentive 4. GF's cauliflower soup was good  The negative... 1. hostess had zero suggestions  on parking - Valet parking begins at 6 pm (standard for restaurants on this block), so when I asked the hostess where my GF could park if she arrived before 6, the hostess had zero suggestions.  Isn't this something that they should train their employees on?  2. Warm beer (known issue) - I planned to arrive ahead of my reservation so that I could scope out parking for my GF and enjoy a cold one at the bar.  My draft IPA was warm.  I assumed that it was simply a new keg, so I asked the bartender to replace it with a different IPA.  He informed me that it was a known problem with all of their beers even though the temp gauge in their keg closet reads 38.  This most likely means that they have not adequately insulated their lines running to the taps.  Again, this place only succeeds in LOOKING like a nice restaurant.  First the bartender offered to give me chilled glass only to discover that they were out of chilled glasses.  I had him replace it with a Porter (more palatable at warmer temperatures).  I asked the guy sitting next to me at the bar if his beer was warm.  His response was "the beer is always warm here, that's why I ordered a Guinness".  3. Dinner seating was a joke - another reviewer already hit on this.  We were seated at a table in the bar are (we had reservations mind you), right in the middle of traffic, at bottom of stairs, across from restrooms.  4. Choice of water (another joke) - when at Morton's or Hyde Park, you expect to be presented with the fancy water choices.  However, a restaurant you needs to earn your way into that category.  All this accomplished was making me look cheap in front of my GF (which she already knows that I am).  5. Pork Belly Spring Rolls (jokes keep getting funnier) - they tasted as though they were right out of the frozen food isle and, I kid you not, the size of your pinky finger.  I can only assume that it was because they had shriveled under a heat lamp since the garnishment sauce was burnt to the plate like chewing gum.  6. Worst $38 filet if ever had - not trusting the quality of the Hanger Steak, I upgraded to the Filet.  And knowing full well at this point that they would over-cook my steak, I ordered it RARE in hopes that I would receive something resembling med-rare.  Sure enough, the steak arrived somewhere between Medium and Med-Rare.  And not a great cut.  Definitely grocery store quality.  PS.  I noticed some of the reviews suggesting that this is a good lunch spot.  I could actually see that as being the case.  However, NO plans to return for dinner or after-work drink.

Heard great things about this place from everyone in Charlotte, so we had to go! They have this AMAZING drink called the Bourberry which I could have had 5 of and I'm not even a bourbon drinker! Only HUGE drawback: drink is $11 a pop and doesn't even use any kind of super-premium booze, not cool. We waited about 20 minutes past what we were quoted for a table but the service was great and so was the food which I have to say was much more reasonably priced than the drinks. The decor is super fun; all black and white with damask-print wall coverings and clear plastic molded chairs. I'd go back but would really urge them to re-think their drink prices in comparison to food; great drinks will sell themselves, you don't have to jazz them up with crazy prices!

Awesome servers.  Awesome desserts. Basil Hayden rocks. Did not get a chance to try the food but will be back to try it again. Parks big is a bit tough as it is in Any part of uptown. Having said that, they offer free valet if you can trust another person driving your car.

Really enjoyed my meal here. Started with the greens salad, the dressing was delicious. Wasabi salmon cooked medium for the main course and I loved it. I'd order it again. Cool atmosphere and staff was great!

I guess I will be the voice of dissension in the following review, but to be honest my experience this evening wasn't anything to write home about.  Frankly it was quite forgettable.  To set the stage, it's Restaurant Week winter 2013 and I've heard some good things about 5Church and as part of the purpose of this event, this was a great opportunity to try a new place without breaking the bank.  I went ahead and made reservations for 6:00.  I got the impression that our babysitters were going to be a bit late and I called 5Church around 12:30pm and asked to move out our reservation time by about 30 minutes.  I couldn't hear the Hostess on the other end and she couldn't hear me because of the ridiculously loud blaring music behind her.  I got the "lazy" answer of that they were packed to the gills and there was no room for me to push out the time.  Fine, it worked out and we got there 5 minutes prior to 6:00.  When we got there the 3 hostesses were pretty snotty and couldn't be bothered and asked us to wait at the bar which was fine, but I walked past a nearly empty dining room to get the the bar.  I never get the whole overstaffing of hosts / hostesses thing.  Also, these people are the first impression you get when you walk in and to have them not be welcoming and efficient is a bad start to the experience.    At 6:20 we finally got seated only when I went and bothered the ladies at the hostess stand again, saying we were ready to be seated.  We walked upstairs and we were seated right next to the kitchen (Awesome right?).  They had these slim swinging doors which were constantly being kicked open and swinging loudly revealing the mishmosh of the kitchen.  It wasn't going to work for me and I asked to be reseated.  We were sat on the other side of the upstairs bar right under a speaker blaring music and I realized this was where the hostess that I spoke to earlier must have been standing when she took my call because I couldn't hear myself think let alone carry on my usual pleasant conversation with Sweetie.  Great, I should have packed my earplugs.  OK, onto the food.  I decided to forego the Restaurant Week Menu and ordered the Crispy Pork Belly and 60 Second NY Strip and Lobster Mac & Cheese.  The crispy pork belly app was tasty, I must say.  Crispy and well plated, it made for a nice culmination of flavors and it made things started turn around for me.  If I couldn't hear Sweetie because of the music at least I can enjoy the food.  The 60 second steak is awesome.  It is made in a cast iron skillet and never flipped but cooked through so that one side is cooked more but the other side is perfectly rare and cooked to temperature.  It was plated with a nice signature sauce by their chef which was both tangy and smokey....nicely done, it was the perfect compliment to the steak.  The lobster mac and cheese was disappointing and was just a saucer of mac and cheese completely void of lobster.  For $9.00 I expected more and it was a bit insulting to not have any more than a morsel of lobster.  I suggest they take a short walk to the Capital Grille to learn how that dish should be prepared. Sweetie had the wasabi encrusted salmon, which was bland and forgettable.  She expected to taste wasabi and got nothing.  Not much else to say.    Service was half and half, the waitress popped in at the right times for the most part but after dropping off the dessert menu we didn't see her for 20 minutes which was annoying since we were ready to go.  Sweetie went to the restroom came back reporting that there wasn't any soap in the dispenser which always makes you wonder how the servers are able to wash their hands.  All in all, my food was OK nothing spectacular and I don't think I'll be back.

I have been wanting to check out this place for awhile with all of the great press.   But I have to say for me it didn't live up to the hype.  We started with the Pork Belly Spring Rolls and just didn't have much flavor.  We got the Chicken and mashed potatoes, which had a good taste.  I got the Tuna and it also was good but the potatoes were not cooked enough I thought.    For me it didn't live up to the hype and was just ok, was hoping it would blow me away.

So here is my honest appraisal of 5church(10/03/17).  Loved the ambiance as I walked in the door - hostesses were very sweet and friendly.  Sitting at the bar (2/3rds full of patrons) I was quickly approached by a bartender who asked "something to drink?" And left a drink menu.  I shared that I would be having dinner as well and she returned with a dinner menu - not small talk or desire to connect with me.  I placed an order for a Willamette Valley Pinot Noir and was told they were out, taking her recommendation on an a similar wine.  As she served the wine, the bar surface in front of me showed no fewer than 5 drink rings, from prior patrons - my bartender too busy to clean between or care about her customers experience.    Dinner ordered - this would be the last time I would speak with my server for the night - no check in on food, no Thank You with the check drop off.    My salad now in front of me(Beet and Winter vegetable) - excellent preparation and flavor.  Only personal change would be the Boursin cheese to something stronger, but otherwise excellent.  My water glass was refilled consistently, and without comment or acknowledgement.  Dinner came and the scallops were clean, prepared perfectly and the flavors and texture on the plate complimented the scallops very well.  Challenge - they were warm but not hot.  They had been sitting/resting longer than I would have liked, and it took away from the pleasure of the meal.    Overall - this could be a 4 star with better front of the restaurant management.  Food is part of the experience, the experience is the other part.  Food had all the qualities of being excellent - but the experience was lacking.  Would I go back? Yes - but would sit at a table and have proper service.

Pretty slow service. Went on a Saturday around 3 but they only serve brunch all day. We were all disappointed in the selection of the menu considering it wasn't a brunch hour. Also, the lack of vegan options on the brunch menu. Food wasnt bad but wasn't amazing. Don't think I would visit for brunch but possibly give it a try for lunch or dinner.

One of Charlotte's trendiest hotspots, 5 Church works much more effectively as a bar than as a restaurant. This was my third visit here, but my first for a sit-down meal. We were entertaining colleagues from out of town, and our party had to practically scream across the table at one another to be heard. Our waitress was sweet, but the service was ridiculously slow. I ordered the pan-seared scallops, which were just OK, and no one else seemed particularly blown away by their plates. This may be a very cool spot for drinks and appetizers after work (the wine and beer selection is outstanding), but as a fine dining choice, it leaves a lot to be desired.

My daughter took me here for Mother's Day brunch buffet and it was absolutely delicious. There was succulent crab legs, the shrimp and grits was bomb and French toast was amazing. It was a little pricey but well worth it. We missed our reservation time but the wait staff was kind enough to get us in even though they were busy. I also love the ambiance. You definitely won't be disappointed... oh almost forget Mimosas we're on point

As soon as Charlotte's council vote was made possible by the "brunch bill" pass (by the state legislature), I made my early reservation at 5Church. In another words: The so-called "brunch bill" allows restaurants to start selling booze at 10 a.m. on Sundays (instead of noon). So, we were there at 10 a.m in celebration of North Carolina's new Brunch Bill, because why not ;)  I was in the mood for some Southern comfort food, so I ordered the Fresh Buttermilk Biscuit. It was fluffy and served with wild mushroom and truffle cream and topped with over-hard egg. - Convenient location in Uptown. - Friendly, courteous staff. - Love the black and white decor.  Four Yelps

This review is for rating my experience at the bar itself, not rating the food.  The reason for only a two star was for the fact it smelled like a bathroom, the people at the door were great, greeted us with excitement, the moment I set at bar, I could just smell this odor of toilet cleaner or a damp towel, and it did not go away for the whole time I was there. I ordered only one drink and I lost my appetite for more. I will have to give this place another go, but for now, they have some work to do, not impressed.   By the way, the one in Charleston SC was amazing!

Great place for drinks and dessert, not a good place to eat a full meal.   The portions are very small, the prices are insane and the taste is average at best. I ordered the "60 second" steak and my mashed potatoes tasted like someone dropped a salt shaker in the potatoes. Also, it didn't seem like a very quality cut of meat. Definitely not worth $38.   I ordered the lamb burger the week before. The bread seemed kind of dry and the meat was completely raw. Liberty's lamb burger is much better.   If you go here, just stick with drinks. It has a good crowd and great atmosphere.

Had an early dinner yesterday and was very impressed. We had a great experience and the food was extremely good. Love the new food and cocktail menu. I hope they stick with their new "fresh menu" approach. Our waiter Gabriel was awesome and we will definitely be back.
Really good "60 second" steak!  Creative and tasty!  Service could come with a smile, but the food is good.

Great ambiance, trendy and great food too! Went here for Sunday Brunch and was very pleased with my Shrimp & Anson Grits with Sweet Tea. Nicely presented and the micro greens were a nice touch. Very nice staff. Don't expect a quite meal as it is a popular place which makes the volume quite high :-)
Over priced and low quality food during today's Mother's Day brunch.  Not to mention I think the air conditioning was not working which made it hot.

Terrible service!  We made a reservation 3 weeks ago for 15 people at 9pm.  We waited at the downstairs bar and at 9:30pm were asked by the hostess if we wanted to sit together......wait, what? That's the whole point of a reservation! Were finally seated upstairs directly in front of the bar (where there is VERY little room and people were YELLING behind us almost the entire meal) around 9:50pm to a 3 course prix-fix menu (we knew this ahead of time). Even thought the menu was basically set, I still didn't get my entr√©e until 11:30pm, and it took over 20 minutes to get our checks once we had asked for them. Don't think the food was amazing enough for me to go back again.
Wonderful and attentive service.  Great flavors on food.  On point!!  Well done gentlemen!!!  Jason!  See?  Your name is in the review forever!!!

I've been to 5Church 3 times since its opening, with a different experience each time. The first, a Yelp event so of course it was live, had me giddy with hope of a new nighttime mainstay. Atmosphere, drinks and food were all on-point, and I'm already a fan of tapas-style dining. The second time I dropped in for a quick lunch, and was served a salad so small, I actually thought it was garnish, and asked the server when the actual salad would arrive. That was awkward for both of us. This last time was Sunday brunch; decent serve-time, really good lamb burger, and bottomless sangria. The sangria was a bit watered down; I could taste the Sprite in it, and the waiter developed a bit of attitude after my fourth glass (or did I get the attitude? No, definitely him.). But overall a decent, slightly overpriced brunch. Will it be my first stop? No. But it's the right move for location and convenience, if you're downtown.

So got a chance to try 5Church for restirant week. Heard of all the awards so I had high hopes coming in this dinner.   Kudos they did not disappoint. The three course was awesome from start to finish. I got the Quinoa Tabbouleh, Grilled Atlantic Salmon,  and the S' mores Trifle. The quinoa was lite and refreshing.  the salmon was grilled prefectly. The asian veggie salad that accompanied it gave it that brust of flavor. Then you have the soy-jalepeno vinaigrette made the dish sing. The chef did a great job on pair theese flavors together. Last but not least the desert.  The trifle was creamy and rich. Not too sweet and the marshmallows topping was fluffy airy.   The decor is clean, unique, and electic. Staff was great a well. Water glass stayed full and the food recommendations were great.  5Church truely lives up to the awards they have received.  You not be disappointed.   Feliz Comiendo

Great atmosphere and the food was awesome. Restaurant week menu was definitely not a disappointment. I had the hanger steak, bib salad and chocolate torte. Everything was delicious - they do cook their meat a bit on the rarer side but it didn't bother me. The only part that was a negative was the dessert - the chocolate torte was too rich but none of the other restaurant week options jumped out to me. Overall, we will definitely be back!

Great location...trendy atmosphere but that's about all 5Church offers. 5Church really isn't a "foodie" place...unless your idea of a great meal is poor service and a mediocre (at best) entr√©e. Then by all means...you have found the right spot!  I went there for my birthday last weekend. We had reservations for 7:30PM. We got our food around 10:15 after complaining to management.    While the restaurant offers the uptown location and trendy atmosphere, the service is horrible and the food nor drinks are worth the money.    I stuck to wine as the cocktails seemed watered down. BUT if you are into paying $15 a drink for a watered down cocktail then go on with your bad self.  Suggestion for management. If you are going to take over 2 hours to serve burnt food at least make sure the clientele is a bit tipsy. Then perhaps I wouldn't have remembered how bad the food was...  I ordered the crab cakes as I read some positive reviews on yelp...but then again most companies I've worked for have also asked us to post positive reviews as "customers". The first batch was burned to crisp and mostly bread. Maybe they thought I said "crabcakes...hold the crab?" I've had better crabcakes from Harris Teeter. A Swanson's TV dinner would be a considerable step up from the "crabcakes" at 5Church.    On a positive note:  *Trendy upbeat vibe *Manager comped the balls of bread labeled as "crabcakes" *I was able to charge my phone  *My friends pasta was actually pretty good *It was my Birthday so I didn't have to pay....  **John Anderson approves this message**

Great spot to grab dinner and a few drinks...It has a trendy and modern vibe to it (dim lighting, swanky music, funky decor). We went here during a business trip (from NYC) and did not feel that we were in Charlotte while dining here.  They have a cool looking bar and a decent selection of scotch.  Our waitress Alyssa was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about both the food and wine menu...she made several recommendations, all of which we enjoyed.  We started with the truffle mushroom pierogies and a special gnocchi app with pork shoulder...the gnocchi were very light and fluffy, and the pork shoulder had nice flavor  For dinner we had the salmon and the duck breast. The salmon was light, very tasty and good size piece of fish. The duck was a much larger portion and combo'd well with the mushrooms and potato cake.  We will definitely give this place another shot on our next trip to NC.
Excellent brunch. Now serving drinks at 10 am with the passage of the new Sunday liquor laws. Service was spot on and atmosphere is very trendy. Will definitely be back!

Ahhhh! I am IN LOVE with their decors. Of course, people don't do reviews on restaurant bc of decors right? It's for the foods! LOL.  Well we went for lunch and it was ok, nothing speculator. Waiter recommended the lamb burgers which was good! Kind of messy to eat and sauce dripping everywhere. Funny but their fries were addictive! The flat bread shrimp 'pizza' were ok too, wouldn't say I'll ordered it again. I do like the arugula flavor on it but otherwise didn't excited me.    Still, I can't get over their decors.  It looks like they put a lot of work and thoughts in it. Definitely a nice place for a nighttime lounge, drinks and chill place.

Food good but not wow. Our group had mussels, Pasta bolognese and short ribs. Although all the dishes were good, the pasta Bolognese was particularly exceptional. Didn't care for the bread at all. Try George's, Brios or Toscana for good bread and butter. As others have said it's a modern, vibrant environment. It's a nice restaurant and we enjoyed the evening, but no dish was such that we said we can't wait to come back.

Came here for dinner with my entire family! We enjoyed the atmosphere, very trendy, but the food was only okay in my opinion.   My sister in law and I both had pasta cappellinni with scallops added...the pasta was just that....pasta with some garlic, olive oil, butter, and some fresh burratta on top! The calamari appetizer was great though.  My mom had the steak and she said it was phenominal!  My dad had the swordfish, which was good, but a bit dry when I tried it.  My fiance had the sweet potato gnocchi with lamb...it was very tough for lamb which made it hard to eat. There were only a few gnocchi on the plate.   The cocktails were great and their wine list was very large as well :) Enjoyed the time with family and the experience, but will probably give somewhere else a try next time.

I was really excited to check this place out because I read about in an online brunch blog. Needless to say, it was overrated. The experience was sub-par. The hostess wasn't very friendly and we waited along time for food that wasn't freshly made and had obviously been sitting under a heading lamp for a while.  I would NOT recommend this place nor return. It seriously gave me a stomach ache and was a poor experience.   The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because they refilled our coffee in a very timely manner and due to the location.

Let me start out by saying this place is very trendy. The ambiance is suitable for a romantic dinner, a girls/guys night out, or even just drinks. It's located on 5th and Church across from Basil.   I had heard many good things about this place but was really impressed with my experience. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine choices. My friend and I spilt the Wasabi Crusted Salmon and the Lamb Bolognese. Both were beyond excellent. Salmon cooked absolutely perfect. For desert the S'mores Trifle is a must try!

I really love 5Church. I have been here for dinner and brunch multiple times. The dinner cost is on the pricey side, but brunch is surprisingly inexpensive! And good! I have had the French toast and burger. The mimosas and sangrias are ridiculously cheap, have a few! Sangrias are my fave, and I love that their sangria has a mulled wine taste, with a flavor or cinnamon and cardamom, yum!  This time around I have a mimosa flight - amazing! There were 4 flavors, kiwi was my fav. Others were pineapple, rose and berry(?)  All in all, I would return here again and again,  any beat the price or the quality of food. 5 stars all day from me.

I was invited here for a Saturday birthday celebration brunch and it wasn't a bad experience.  It was my first time dining here as it has been on my dining list for awhile.  I ordered the Shrimp and Anson Mills grits which were delicious and I had a few glasses of Sangria as well (not bad at $2.50 for a nice sized glass).  The staff were super friendly and accommodating to our party of 11 and even adjusted everyone's bill due to the extended wait time for our food to be prepared.  I look forward to bringing my hubby here to dine next time and we'll probably go for lunch or dinner.

Brunch was just ok.  The drinks were good and affordable.  All of our food was cold.  Flavors were good but the temperature really took away from overall experience. I'd give it another try though.  Hopefully it was just a bad day...

The hubby and I visited 5Church with another couple during restaurant week. We were seated quickly and our waiter was quick to greet us, yet fairly mechanical with his overview of the menu. He reassured us several times throughout our meal that he wasn't trying to rush us out the door, which led to us, in fact, feeling like we were being rushed out of the door...    Our apps, main dishes, and dessert all came out at an appropriate pace. Overall we all enjoyed ourselves. I'm giving three stars for 5Church because I'm just not sure I understand the hype... the ambience is cool, the food was good, but it didn't leave me dying to come back for another meal. I'd rather spend the same amount of money (or less) exploring another chic restaurant in CLT.

I have dined here twice for dinner and was very impressed with the food both times.  The short ribs are very good and the drink selections are expansive.  Service has been very good both times and the menu is a little pricey, but worth it.  The decor is very trendy but all flows together.

Visiting from out of town and despite iffy reviews on Yelp we decided to try it. Well, always trust the reviews. Don't get me wrong the food was delicious, I had the lamb sirloin and my boyfriend had the scallops. We also split the Yukon smashed potatoes. All of it was good but hardly as good as the price. Mainly because a meal of this price should be partnered with great service and drinks. The drinks had very little bourbon, mostly watered down. Our server did little to make conversations and made no suggestions. Merely took our order, gave us the items and left. It's very dark, but not in a romantic way, just dark. We were also seated at a table that every car that drove by the lights struck me in the eyes. There were tons of kids in for a prom, and in walked a 21st birthday party that dominated the bar and continued to yell over each other. We left in under a hour. They don't seem to know what kind of restaurant they want to be. Ultimately, this is a missable place, go to Cellar at Duckworths, way better food and service.
Sunday brunch was great. Food was great had the pizza. Had the bottomless mimosas and the server keep our glasses full which was great.

Unfortunately this was one of the worst upscale dining experiences I have had. The evening started out ok when we walked in--lovely modern decor and a fun vibe. Our table wasn't quite ready and the cocktail I ordered at the bar was delicious. Things quickly went downhill. Despite making a reservation well in advance and specifically asking to be in a quiet area, we were seated in the bar. It really seemed they had given our table away (though we were actually a few minutes early for our reservation) because I can't imagine they actually put people there regularly. The food was totally meh for the $$ and took 2 hours to come out even though we all ordered steaks. Our waitress was not very friendly though that may have been because she had to yell to communicate over the bar noise. Around 10, people in the bar were leaning up against my chair and using our table for their drinks. Absolutely absurd for the amount of money our group of 8 spent there.

Other restaurant week participants should take a cue from 5Church -- looking at you, Chima! Excellent service, excellent food, a relaxed/not-rushed environment. THIS is how you win fans and regular customers during restaurant week. It was our first time at 5Church but after such a great experience we'll be back for sure!  We made reservations and were shown right to our table as soon as we arrived. Service was friendly and attentive without being overbearing or rushing the experience. The waiter gave us the restaurant week menu as well as the regular menu... Smart man, as we added the hand cut fries from the regular menu.   From the restaurant week selections, I had the seafood ceviche and tuna. Both dishes were excellent -- light and fresh, high quality seafood! Dessert was the blood orange consume and the only thing I didn't totally love. I think it sat in the kitchen a little too long before it was brought to the table. The flavors were good but the gelato was melted and the meringue was a tad soggy.   I also really enjoyed my cocktail, the Viper, an awesome mix of patron, orange liquor, lime, cucumber and cayenne. Spicy! We're counting down to our next visit outside of restaurant week so we can try out other menu items.   Thanks for showing 'em how restaurant week is done, 5Church!

I honestly didn't know what to think about this place when I first arrived, but the hostesses instantly put me at ease with their smiles and friendly attitudes. Our group was seated and proceeded to experience one of the best meals I've had in a while. From the exemplary service to the DEEE-licious food at the great value (bacon pizza for four A+, flat bread A+, and lamb burger A++!!) I can't complain about a single thing at 5Church and I will be back again if I am ever fortunate enough to revisit Charlotte!

This place....meh. Flew into Charlotte, it got great reviews. However, a couple things immediately became apparent. One, the food was really overdressed, felt like each piece of lettuce was dipped into a vat of salad dressing. Second, the bus boys acted like they were clearing plates away at a McDonalds, I wasn't even halfway done before my appetizer was just taken from me. Third, the drinks seemed like they were made by someone's drunk uncle who had no bartending experience. I ordered an old fashioned, basically got a glass full of bourbon with an orange slice. I left wasted, so that was a plus. I will say, the steak was good and it was clear that they have good meat. This place would do a much better job if they pace the courses better and let the local ingredients shine over all the "flash".

The 60 second steak was original and delicious.  The ceviche was a ten as well.  The burger is also pretty stellar.  The bar is a nice place to grab a drink or sit down and have dinner as well.    My favorite part of this restaurant is the wine list.  It may not be extremely deep, but what they have is great value and top notch.  I am always happy with their by the glass choices.  I would recommend having at least two hours for a full dinner service fyi.

Okay here's the thing, the food here is great and the service was also pretty top-notch.  I'm not sure what it is about Charlotte, but they are really good at splitting bills.  The reason that they're only getting 3 stars and an A-OK rating is for the confusing welcome we received.  6 of us walked in on a Friday at 4:55pm.  I get that it's early-bird special dinner time, but we wanted to grab some drinks and apps before starting our night.  They don't actually open until 5, but the doors were open so we just walked in.  The two hostesses who greeted us informed us that they weren't open yet, but since it was so close to 5, we just stayed hovering awkwardly by their station.    We asked for a table for 6 and they inform us that there are no tables available.  Their entire restaurant is booked, but we're welcome to sit at the bar if we really want.    Well we really wanted, which seemed to put them in a quandary since they weren't REALLY booked.  Or everyone happened to cancel their 5pm reservation.  Both are equally likely I think.  My friend went on Opentable and found a reservation for 5:30pm for 6 so she booked it and went back to the hostess.
