At that point they "found" a table and asked if we wanted to be seated right away.  We stayed for an hour or so and had some terrific drinks and apps but the restaurant remained mostly empty.  Maybe they didn't think we'd notice?  As we walked out, the more extroverted of our group asked the hostess about the situation and a new guy tried explaining it as "opentable told us to not accept any more reservations."  Interesting since that's how we booked our reservation.  Maybe they didn't want our jeans and sneakers wearing, massive DSLR camera toting kind, in their upscale place.  We'll never know for sure.  If you made it this far into the saga, congrats!  The moral of the story is, the food is good, but if you want to have some, you best be reserving upfront.

Sunday Funday!! I've had my eye on 5Church for a while. The food looked appetizing, and the decor impeccable!!! I felt like I was dining in New York or Miami.   After reading a few reviews I thrilled to hear Mimosas and Sangria are $2.50! Sounds like a Win Win to me!   I made reservations a few days ahead using OpenTable. I parked across the street (which cost $16!!!!) Jesus!! I should've caught an uber!   The food was magnificent! I ordered the Crab cakes & Poached Eggs which came with spinach. I also had a side of bacon. The Crab Cake portion is small, yet so delicious! Cooked to perfection might I add. I appreciated the large lump Crab meat. I had 2 mimosas with my meal. I definitely look forward to having the Sangria next time. One of my girlfriends ordered the lamb burger (something else I look forward to having)   Our waitress was warm and informative. I appreciated her suggestions. I definitely look forward to coming here again soon. Thank you 5Church

Oh yum! First time here, last night before the short walk to Blumenthal Center for a show. I had the scallops and they were easily the best that I have ever had! Just right portion, great flavor and loved the succotash. Chose the broccolini as a side, watching my waistline and they were happy to do it without the Parmesan and it was delish.

Now THIS is what I'm talking about! Every aspect of 5Church has been meticulously thought-out and it shows: excellent, innovative cuisine, beautiful, spacious layout, very modern decor, awesome drinks. Service was professional and prompt. The 5Church-goers are sleek and sexy.  Yeah, it can get a bit expensive. But, you know what? You get what you pay for and 5Church is worth every damn penny. If you don't like brilliant, high-quality, premium beverages, there are like a billion shitty bars that serve Bud Light just down the street.

The restaurant has a very unique esthetic due to the hip layout and design. The bar area is very unique and is a great place to grab a drink after work. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable, to include the valet employees. BTW, valet parking is complimentary, which is fabulous for uptown Charlotte.   As far as the downside, this restaurant is extremely pricey and the portions were very small. In addition, the taste wasn't that fabulous and didn't match the price. I ordered the sea scallops, which were good, just not phenomenal. Kudos to our waiter for providing two girlfriends with free dessert since we were celebrating birthdays. Very generous!!  The restaurant is very loud and makes it hard to hear conversations from the other side of the table. At 10:00 pm, the music gets even louder to emulate a club like atmosphere.

The star of the show was hands down the pickled jalape√±o whipped butter. The butter was a fluffy cloud of joy in my mouth. It was followed by some super salty pork belly appetizers. Ordered the seared scallops with potato cakes which was good except the scallops would've been better had it been seared on both sides and not just one. Also ordered the wasabi crusted yellowtail tuna which was also good. The side of broccoli was good but not worth $8 for a little bowl. It's a hip and trendy spot, but seems a bit douchey and pretentious. There was one time we came in for brunch and we were greeted very rudely by the host. She was pretty snarky when we responded no that we did not have a reservation.

So, I have not been here for a meal. My review is for the Saturday late night crowd (after 10) and my feelings are mixed.   Pros: -everyone here is attractive...or at least the men are well dressed and the women are small enough to barely wear anything and still look stylish -drinks are good and strong -bartenders are nice and attentive, rare for these type of trendy Uptown bars. -no cover  Cons: -everyone here is attractive! Do not expect to come here in flats and a sundress and fit in. (Or if you are a man, heaven forbid...shorts!) in fact if you don't spend at least 60% of your time at the gym, eat any carbs, or are a woman weighing over 105 you might feel out of place. -a bit pricey  Side note: This place is like the cool kids table in middle school. You get invited and it's exciting but once you're actually there you realize they're all a bit douchey and you kind of miss goofing off with your dorky friends.

Great DECOR!!! Pay attention to design details. I had the shrimp, mushroom, omelette with home fries. The home fries are very fresh. The mimosa's were the best I ever had. Great Customer service. A very low key GEM. Good pricing... I will for sure be coming back.
Our server was great. The lamb burger was great and really cannot eat lamb.  This was fantastic!  Highly recommend this place!

Lets call it what it is, trendy food and a trendy atmosphere.  Service was pretty good.  Went to 5 Church in Friday night and were seated promptly.  Pretty good crowd and everyone was dressed in "going out" clothes.  The menu was pretty straightforward new American.  The food itself seemed more about quality ingredients and fancy presentation than taste.  My romaine  salad was ok, could have done with out 2 whole anchovies and soft boiled eggs.  Steak was a great cut of meat, a little on the expensive side though. My wife enjoyed her green salad and scallops. Out total bill was 91 before tip.   Good meal but I would rather eat at a less trendy spot for a little less money.

First time for us because we were given a gift card as a present and it's safe to say we probably won't be back.   The atmosphere and the decor in 5church is really cool and the host was awesome, I didn't catch her name though.  Showed up early for our reservation and didn't get sat until about 20 minutes after the time we were actually supposed to be there. The entire part of service was incredibly slow from getting a drink at the bar while we waited, or at least attempting too, 2 bartenders approached us w menus, one let me try one of the wines I was asking about but never came back to us before we finally got sat. The greet from the server took forever, getting our order took forever, and the food took even longer. The manager got us a free round of drinks and apologized for the long wait but both filets were suuuuuuper undercooked (which is surprising considering it took 45 minutes), the broccoli tasted like seafood, and the whipped potatoes had no flavor at all, super super bland.   The smores trifle was pretty much the only thing that would bring me back to this restaurant.   Definitely not worth $130.

I cannot speak to their main entrees, we came here for drinks and appetizers. We came during July 4th 2012. For fourth of July, this place is not crowded at all, which is surprising if it's supposed to be a big hit in town? I do have to commend and say that their interior decor is breath taking. Everything other reviewers have said are true. The waiter did not seem super attentive, he was just acceptable. He only came by once during our entire stay. The drinks are fairly pricey, but this is an upscale place. We tried 3 different appetizers on their dinner menu, and all three were very mediocre. I hope their cuisine entrees are better.

I went here this past weekend for a first date. It was a cool spot for sure.. Great atmosphere, hip music and beautiful decor combined with the delicious appetizers and wine made for a very good first date! The music was a little loud and it was tough to have a real convo without yelling but at least the music was good! I'll definitely be back!

I was visiting for work and our hotel recommended dinner at this restaurant, great recommendation!   The atmosphere of the restaurant is trendy, modern, very low lighting restaurant. They are known for their 60 second steak which is cooked on one side. Unfortunately I wasn't craving steak, I know its a crime! Instead I got the seared sea scallops with a side order of spinach. The way the sweet potatoes were done blew my mind away as they were mashed and so tasty. The amount of food was perfect where you didn't feel like a fatty after licking your plate clean.   I was so full from dinner I didn't have a chance to try out their dessert so the next time I'm in Charlotte I will need to stop by for that!

Best Sea Scallops I've ever had.  Dark Horse Chardonnay a winner, chilled just to right temp.  Service was rushed though, like they were trying to get us out so they could seat next table.  And don't sit at the green bench seats-the tables were not designed to work well with the bench seats and had to lean forward whole time.

Snobby!!!!  Bartender bends over and then whips back up to clear her hair back from her face!!! (not in an attractive way!)  Alejandro(?) stalks about the bar with a flunkie looking down his nose at everyone & everything while muttering imprecations towards his staff for his flunkie to pass on for him.   The staff huddles and chats loudly to each other at the end of the bar (as they ignore Alejandro & he ignores them)  I don't see, taste, hear anything about this place that makes it premier or even visit worthy except the space itself.

Having wanted to try 5 Church for some time, we headed there for brunch before a Carolina Panthers game.  The dining room was busy; but, quite quiet, so conversation was easy; which, in a large space as 5 Church, was a bit surprising and welcome.  We were seeking good brunch fare and were not disappointed with our croque madame and scrambled eggs with bacon.  The croquet madame was very substantial and the bacon and eggs came exactly as ordered.  But, alas, there was one slight disappointment; though it was not the fault of 5 Church.  It appears that Charlotte still lingers in the depth of blue law hell.  So, no mimosas; no bloody marys...  But, the lack of our cocktails of choice was made up for with excellent coffee.  we'll most certainly be back; albeit a bit later in the day...

The food- excellent!  We are gluten free and dairy free and they worked w us well.  Our server was excellent too.  What wasn't of good taste was the manager who asked us to move from our table to the bar because of a reservation that someone else had for our table.  (We had a reservation too.). He asked us to move even before our bill was signed... Not a good ending to our anniversary dinner.
I love this place!!! I just moved here from Austin Tx and the food is awesome and the atmosphere is even better! The mussels are to die for!

The staff and ambience are both excellent. However, besides the amazing Tokyo street corn special appetizer, the food was overall lacking in flavor. We ordered the permanent tuna dish and the special NC trout dish. Both seriously lacked in flavor, with only a tiny amount of bland sauce that was supposed to cover a large amount of bland fish. However, I will say both fish were cooked perfectly. The Brussels sprouts we ordered on the side had a good sauce, but it was severely undercooked; it was actually inedible. We were so disappointed after eating an especially flavorful appetizer, only to receive lackluster entrees that did not deserve the $30 price tag. Probably not returning.

went here for a girls' night out, and it was a good trip. the food was pretty darn good, and the service was great considering our large group and all the different demands. a bit on the loud side for me for dinner, so i don't know that i would come here other than with girlfriends, cuz we're already geared up to talking real loud together.

Friends and I decided to come here on a sat night for a couple after dinner drinks. We were in awe of how cute the decor was and fell in love with this little place. Then we got to take a look at the menu and decided to try to come for brunch the next morning. We were in luck that they had availability and made reservations while we were there. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. You can really tell they all work well together and always want to make their guests happy. Numerous staff members were asking if we were ok or needed anything. It was the same for brunch the next morning. Their coffee set up was as impressive as the decor! They had a little plate with sugar cubes, cream, and even jelly beans! The food was also amazing. I got the crab cake Benedict, which was small but just enough, and my friends got some sort of eggs and biscuit with mushrooms, asparagus, and a truffle cream sauce. They both said it was amazing and were so full afterwards. I cannot wait to come back to this adorable place and try out the dinner menu!

The service and food here was fantastic! We came here because of the reviews and it lived up to them entirely. We actually were surprised to find out they had a $30 prix fix style menu I believe. You got a few choices for starter, dinner and dessert. I HIGHLY recommend doing that. Below is the food we got: -Corn chowder- creamy base, very good, lots of corn in it -local greens- who doesn't love goat cheese on a salad? Yum! -Salmon (we all got it)- fantastic, nice crisp, flavorful, the soy vinegarette complimented it well, cooked perfectly -white chocolate cheesecake- very good and dense- just like a cheesecake should be -red velvet torte- good but didn't have that "bam-red velvet" taste -s'mores trifle- the favorite hands down. It tasted like a s'more with a warm brownie base! Yumx3!  So the food and service was great! My only complaint was the bathrooms. The ladies bathroom downstairs has 2 stalls and both were out of toliet paper- no biggie- I asked the hostess for more. She looked and couldn't find any, so she asked the manager who also could not find any. They then sent me upstairs to use that bathroom. The manager walked in before me (which I thought was strange as it was a man) and I walked in to find a single stall with no one in there. There is a second door that was unlocked going into the kitchen. So basically I was using the employees bathroom and boy did it stink!!!! It smelled like dirty wet gym socks that have been locked in there for a week. It was awful. And on top of it, it was awkward because how is the kitchen staff supposed to know that someone is in there so I locked that door- probably locking the staff out of the bathroom (oops- but I didn't want someone walking in on me). I later overheard the manager saying something about  not having any toliet paper- which I thought was very strange. So loss of a star for the facilites not being kept up.

Meh- food was just ok.  Nothing special at all.  I liked the atmosphere alot and when I'm looking for more of a cool scene and good cocktails I'll go back, but if Im looking for really great food I think there is much better.  It was very loud, so not the place to go to chat with your friends.

We had dinner here last night (5/17/14) with a group of friends. I would rate my dinner as one of my best of 2014 so far! It was delicious in every way! I started with a glass of Zinfandel from the bar that was massive. A friend had the wild berry Mojito. That's definitely on my list for the next time! It was amazing! Then I had the local field greens salad. Delicious and a very large portion. I ordered the 60 second strip. Delicious. Cooked to perfection. Paired with the bleu cheese sauce and asparagus...couldn't have been better.  Finished up with the white chocolate cheesecake. Perfection. Visually beautiful and equally tasty. I highly recommend 5Church on any given day! And the free valet topped of impeccable service inside and out.

I went here for the first day of Restaurant Week and had one of the best meals I've had in Charlotte so far.   I love the decor of this place. It's really cute and modern. The chairs could've been more comfortable, but that's a minor complaint.   The heirloom tomato/watermelon/burrata salad was amazing. Very juicy delicious tomatoes. Next up was the filet mignon with some fingerling potatoes. My steak was cooked perfectly...it was seriously one of the best filets I've had in my life. Dessert was a triumph with the s'mores trifle. I love s'mores anything, so it was a big hit.   Cocktails aren't cheap, but they're great. The rosemary gin fizz was refreshing, with nice herbal notes that weren't overpoweringly woodsy. I had another vodka drink (can't recall its name), which was also delicious.   Our server was polite and attentive, and he was honest about his likes and dislikes there, which helped us choose cocktails and our dishes. I appreciated that.   We will be back for sure.

Myself and a large group of friends went to 5Church for their New Years Eve party and were treated like garbage. They promised an open bar and full buffet, yet only served dry mashed potatoes and pita chips, while the drinks were completely watered down. They apparently forgot that people need utensils to eat food with because we had to use the hardened pita chips to eat the mashed potatoes, which were tasteless and appeared to have been made from a box. At one point, an extremely rude waitress actually told my friend to "get the fuck out of my way" because she was busy trying to serve the private dinner party that they had booked upstairs. They forgot to bring out the champagne toast at midnight because apparently they do not know how to tell time, and the waitresses snippily refused to serve champagne to many people when they finally decided to do a toast at 12:45 am.  All in all, it felt like we were crashing someone else's wedding and were treated by the staff and management as such. I would never recommend going to 5Church based on the fact that their management were so horribly uncaring when people called to voice their concerns and essentially brushed off the entire ordeal.

My wife and I have eaten her before, several times. In the past, the food has been very good. This time however, it was not. We had a 7pm reservation on Saturday night and were directed to the Bar upon arrival, as there "were no available tables", even though there were plenty of non occupied tables. We order: Octopus, Meatballs, Ceviche for apps, then Lamb Shank, Scallops, Fried Chicken. So lets start with what was good; Ceviche (not good but great), Fried Chicken, (very good). Now for the bad, Octopus was over seasoned and over cooked, scallops were cold, lamb shank was dry and hot, but the potatoes it sat on were cold, meatballs, (which normally are excellent) were dry. My wife had a margarita and I had a beer, my niece had Tea. Waiter was very attentive, but I'm not sending all  this food back. Our bill? Wait for it......$180.00, Before Tip!. There are at least 20 other restaurants in Charlotte where you can spend 180 bucks and get an outstanding meal, this place isn't one of them. Stop reading the "Best of Charlotte" reviews, avoid this place.

This was our third time dining at 5Church. The first two times the food was spectacular and deserved the price tag next to them, however this most recent visit was different. I'm not sure if the original exec chef is now devoting his time to Nan & Bryons, but quality has gone down. My husband and I started with the shiitake perogies which were good. The dough was nice and flaky and the filling was tasty. No complaints there. We also started with the crab cakes on the snack menu. These were disappointing, the flavor profiles that they used didn't meld together. The sweet apples and raisins mixing with the heavily peppered cakes and bitter shoots left my mouth confused. We then moved onto our mains. My husband ordered the short rib tortellini special and I ordered the scallops which our server promptly suggested when I asked what was best. The short rib filling was well seasoned and packed with flavor, unfortunately the pasta wrapped around it had been seared for a brief second on one side leaving a terrible texture reminiscent of uncooked pasta. The sauce was nice and again they made sure to glob on more pea shoots. My scallops were disappointing. The scallops while cooked perfectly were cold and gritty, two things that make one of my favorite proteins undesirable. The apricot compote was nice and refreshing and added needed citrus to the plate. However the spaghetti squash that sat underneath the whole dish took on a soggy quality and the brussel sprouts came to me cold. We passed on dessert fearing a lack of quality in that dimension as well. Service was decent our server was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed however her bald manager made no attempts to conceal his texting addiction, it's amazing we didn't watch him fall down the stairs. Overall I'm not sure we will return as we were fairly disappointed.

Really pretty place! Food was great as well. Husband got the lamb burger and it was one of the most juiciest burger out there! And I got the fresh buttermilk biscuits with pouched eggs, really delicious with lots of flavor, only wished there was more mushroom added. My only thing was I didn't enjoy their coffee flavor. But each there own with coffee bean flavor.
Fun ambiance, great drinks... Mediocre food. Mussels came out undercooked and chef refused to fix them.

If you are visiting Charlotte or living anywhere within 2 hours you absolutely have to go! The service and food are incredible and I have never had a negative experience. From the brunch menu on Sunday mornings, to happy hour drinks, and exquisite dinners, you can't go wrong! I especially give praise to the manager Nick, he always takes care of me and my guests to make sure we have the best experience possible! I hope 5Church keeps expanding all over the States! Bravo the whole staff and the talented chefs!

I visited 5Church for a business lunch with a vendor.  The vendor had been before and liked it and it's been on my list to try.    We met at 1:30 on a Friday so we missed the lunch rush.  I immediately liked the vibe and decor very much.  The servers were very friendly and attentive.    Since the vendor had been before, I was happy to trust her judgment for the appetizer choices.  She ordered Black Bean Hummus and Beet Sliders.  The hummus was delicious!  The fresh olive oil, line juice, and cilantro really made the dish cone alive.  The Beet Sliders completely knocked my socks off!!!  I will return to 5Church just for these Sliders...they were THAT good!  We also ordered the lunch special salad... Quinoa patties over greens with a lemon vinaigrette with oranges and goat cheese.  It was tasty, but the patties were a tad on the dry side.    I can't wait to go back with my husband... perhaps for brunch?   Good food AND Mimosas... yes, please!!

I'm pretty pleased with this place so far. The lamb burger is great. Juicy, flavorful, not too rich and not dried out.  On the other hand, the giant fry logs that come with it aren't very good. While they look cool they lack flavor and are tough. I also ordered the chickpea salad and tried some of the lobster mac and cheese and I wasn't blown away by either.  Still the lamb burger is excellent and I'm excited to try the other menus. The crew seems like they have their stuff together which is impressive for a restaurant open less than 2 weeks.

We had a 40th birthday celebration with 5 couples on Saturday night.  It was absolutely the worst service I have ever had hands down, the waiter was extremely rude, apps were good, dinner was served 50 minute after ordered, scallops overlooked and flavors bland.  Bartenders were also inattentive and dismissive.  So many more gems in Charlotte, I would not waste Time or money here.  From a seasoned waitress/bartender from Dallas, TX.
This is really nice place. I like location and vibe. Food was very good. I want to come back!

Don't come hungry or on a schedule!   Limited menu but good food. Service was inattentive and slow. Stated at 11:10 for 11:15 reservation. Food didn't come until after 12:30. I was just about to head for the doors and Qdoba around the corner when our food actually came.  They need to do better!

My husband and I heard great things about 5Church so we decided to give it a try for lunch one day. The ambience is nice and it's in a great location. We didn't have any trouble parking right across the street. We started with the calamari (which was misspelled on the menu - really?!) with tomato and ghost pepper aioli. The calamari itself was fine, very tender, but the batter was a little too greasy. We expected the ghost chili aioli to have at least a little bit of spice to it, but nothing. It tasted like mayo with some paprika. My husband ordered the classic burger and he enjoyed it, cooked the way he wanted, but nothing spectacular. My real problem came with my order. I ordered the mussels and fries. If I'm in a restaurant that has moules frites on their menu, I will probably order it 95% of them time. When my mussels came out, several of the mussels were closed shut. I pushed those aside and ate the few that were open. By the end of the meal, I realized that about 60% of the mussels were closed. For those that don't know, if a mussel is closed even after being cooked, it means that it was not fresh and was dead before it was even cooked. It it not considered safe to eat these mussels. These should not be eaten, let alone served at a restaurant. I have never received a dish of moules frites with so many closed mussels. The most I've received are maybe one or two, never the majority of a dish. If a dish cannot be prepared properly and safely, it shouldn't be on a menu. I don't know that we'll be going back.
I ordered the filet mignon with creamy potatoes. My meal was delicious! Everything on the menu was a bit pricey, but well worth it and the atmosphere was great.

I came here for brunch on a Sunday with a few friends. I got the salmon, one friend got the steak, and another got the waffles. Everything was delicious! The portions were a bit small for me personally, but my one friend didn't finish her waffle so take my criticism with a grain of salt. Be warned, they are no longer serving bottomless mimosas or sangria because of a recent state law, but the per glass price of each is so low you can easily order two or three glasses without feeling it in your pocket.   I've already told several people about this place since visiting a few weeks ago so I obviously recommend it. I will definitely come back whenever I'm in town.

Visiting Charlotte for the first time,Went with 5 co workers for late dinner arrived after 9pm Seated immediately.  Busy,Loud and quite dark! Tried the meatballs, octupus and hummus for appetizers.  Octupus was tender and delicious.  For dinner I had the roasted beet salad. Scallops, pork tenderloin and chicken are huge servings.  Beet salad was good. For dessert we tried the 3 flavor sorbet (coco, berry and mango) lemon creme br√ªl√©e and coconut mouse.  All 3 desserts were excellent!   Ambiance=4 Food= 4 Service =4 Will visit again when in Charlotte!

I've been here twice as more often to hang out and drink then actually eat dinner.  This place is definitely a "you-get-what-you-pay-for" type place, and you definitely pay.  The prices are high for some food and drinks, but the service for dining was great as the wait staff are knowledgeable and very professional.  I tried the jerk chicken lettuce, which was meh, but the Pork Belly snack was delicious.  I could munch on those all night if I wanted to splurge, as only two pieces were served for a $4 snack dish.  I wouldn't come hungry.  But most people probably come here for the atmosphere which doesn't disappoint.  The crowd is impressive and come if you want to be seen.  I'm probably too old for that, but at least the music they were playing was popular in my partying days, which says alot about the age of the crowd.  The only annoying part of the experience was the headlights that would always shine into the restaurant as cars are turning onto Church St. from 5th.  This was a distraction for me, but if you're going to be clubbing afterwards anyways, might as well prepare for the flashing lights here.

The outside already suggests 'classy,' but the inside is definitely worth mentioning. It has a really modern feel, but not too in-your-face about it.  The hostess that normally is in front slowly transitions into a bouncer as the night progresses. I haven't eaten an actual meal here, but friends have been raving about their lamb burger. Given the fact that its one of the most affordable entrees ($13) and looks amazing, this will definitely be my order when I come here for dinner!   The beverages are what one would expect from a Charlotte bar, but I will also mention that they have some craft beers and local favorites (Highland Brewing, Four Friends, etc)! This fact has earned them their fourth star! Prices are a little steep for drinks, but given the environment of 5Church, not too surprising, and not at all a deal-breaker. I still very much recommend this place for a chill night out with friends.   Noting my friend Grace's review: 'if you look all the way up, you'll get to see that the ceiling is black with words written all over in white.' - excellent detail!

Sunday afternoon we made a reservation with the OpenTable App for same day at 7:45pm for 2 people. We've got there in time and were right away seated. Our server was very nice and friendly. The atmosphere of the restaurant is great - the place was busy but no hectic so you feel really comfortable. As a starter we shared the tuna tartare which was great - only thing with a tartare you should get some toasted bread or some crostini at least. But probably that's still the European in me ;-). I took the shellfish pasta as a main. It was just great. The server told me the size is between a starter and main. For me it was perfect size. I still like to finish my dishes (if the food is good) and not have it boxed or even worse generate a lot of food waste. So perfect size, perfect taste I finished it all. My wife had the salmon - also perfectly cooked. We finished with the lemon tart also nice sized (not big) item to finish also a great meal. I asked for a Grappa to really close the dinner - unfortunately they had none - I know another European thing so stay with the brandy they have some  (but I haven't tried it).

Stopped in here for lunch today, and I was very impressed with the food! I ordered the french onion roast beef, which came with a standard side of fries. It doesn't sound like anything all that special, but it was awesome food! The roast beef was very tender and juicy. The caramelized onion compote was extremely flavorful and really pulled the whole sandwich together when combined with awesome melted provolone cheese. The bun was toasted to perfection as well. Even the fries were above average in my opinion; not too crispy/burnt but not soggy or greasy either. Our server was friendly and quick to refill drinks as well. With a price of only $12 for a big sandwich and good sized side of fries I can't complain about anything.

We came to Charlotte for the weekend and ending up eating at this place by chance, when most restaurants were shut on the evening of Nascar Sunday and we were pleasantly surprised by how good it was. I had the petite fillet steak which, especially considering the low price, was amazing! So well cooked. My boyfriend decided to go for a selection of appetizers including the sliders, tomato soup and the shrimp flatbed - all of which he enjoyed although he was jealous of my steak! Note that the appetizer portions were all rather large so three of them was definitely too much food.  The decor is brilliant too - the whole ceiling is covered in painted on quotes. Overall, loved the atmosphere in here. Only thing I did not like was the temperature - it was freezing! Considering it was 80 degrees outside we did not have sweaters so make sure you bring one along!

This place is hot for a reason! The decor is inviting, chic and cool all at the same time. The food presentation is very good. The food itself is solid. The muscles are the best I've ever had. I got the scallops this last time and they were perfect.   What stands out most to me about 5Church is the staff. They are attentive, kind and good at their jobs. Every time I go, I'm blown away by how great I'm treated. 5Chuch is the whole package.

Haven't been in a long time but went for Restaurant Week; it was excellent!    Food was delicious, although I think they went a little overboard with the Serrano pepper in my Ahi Tuna Poke.    My original dessert order was the Coconut Lime mousse, which I had to send back and exchange for the S'mores Trifle - it tastes burnt, like maybe they scalded the milk.  But the manager was gracious and accommodating.    Good service, nice atmosphere.  And the wine flight is worth it.

The vibe here is very cool and the food is fun and different and worth checking out for client dinners, dates, etc. uptown. It's busy but not too loud for conversation and it's dark at night so bring your readers or your flashlight app if you are old like me.   We had the pork belly spring rolls and they were tasty but there look to be lots of great app options that will have to wait until next time.   For dinner my buddy got the 60 second steak which was tender and flavorful with a great sauce that didn't overpower the meat. Our client had the chicken and mashed potatoes and was quite pleased. I had the scallops with corn and I loved it. Enough food, not heavy and the scallops were perfectly cooked.   The dark chocolate pretzel covered caramel bar is the dessert to get though we also shared the pound cake which grew on us too but couldn't top the elevated Twix bar dessert.   Good wine and beer selection, bar is hopping. Enjoy!

Came here for our anniversary dinner 7/20. While we were seated promptly even though we were early for our reservation the customer service ended there. After being seated and our beverage orders taken, we waited 30 minutes with no interaction from either of the two waitresses in the upper level of the restaurant. This is after one of them slid between our table and placed her bottom on our table to take an order from the couple next to us. I'm not sure why our waitress (long dark hair shaved on her left side) was surprised when I asked for check for our tea and ginger ale. Although she suddenly became very interested, we won't be returning.

Did you hear? Chef Jamie Lynch is on Top Chef season 14! Pop bottles.   5Church is the swanky, cool kid on the block. The interior is beautiful. I can't even begin to tell you how many birthday/bachelorette/event/-insert reason to celebrate- dinners here. I send people this way all the time.   The menu changes seasonally, but there's also some longtime staples on the menu like the lamb burger and 60 second steak. In all honesty, I can't think of a meal here I didn't enjoy. My current obsession is the ahi tuna poke. The avocado, serranos, pineapple, soy sherry, it's just a great combination of flavors. The award for most surprising dish I've had in the past couple months here is the chicken adobo. Why do I say that? Well, I'm not someone who will go to a restaurant and order chicken. In my head, I can make chicken at home (I know, I know... not anywhere near restaurant quality, but still). I would order this chicken. It's packed with flavor and delicious. The Viper is my go-to cocktail. Lunch-wise, I love the Italian Hoagie and French Onion Roast Beef. Guys, it's like French Onion soup in a sandwich! And it's delicious.   Follow 5Church on Instagram to see the latest pics of menu items. Parking- they offer complimentary valet. Make sure to bring some cash to tip!   I'm a huge fan of Chef Jamie, Patrick, Alejandro, Ayman and the entire team. They do great work and their passion shows. One of the coolest things I've ever witnessed was a night out with some of the kitchen guys here. To hear them all talk about how much admiration and respect they have for Chef Jamie, it says a lot.

5Church is the good looking place you die to go but once you get there you are terribly underwhelmed. The ambiance is perfect and the wait staff is amazingly friendly.  The food is just ok... I had the crab cakes and poached eggs, I enjoyed it.  The one thing that made this amazingly beautiful restaurant with an awesome staff and decent food loose points was the fact that the restaurant was hot... like literally burning up. I was there for about an hour and 15 mins bc that was my max, I was literally sweating when I left the restaurant and walking outside was a relief. I believe this heat debacle was a one off and because of that I would continue to patronize 5Church. Although the food was just good... the drinks were awesome and the ambiance was worth another trip.

I came here with a few coworkers for dinner, and it seemed like a decent place to eat at.  Even the yelp reviews gave us positive expectations!  Unfortunately, we all came out of this place pretty disappointed.  It could have been we ordered the wrong items? but regardless I was hoping at least 1 of the three items would have been above average.  Here is what we got:  -Chicken leg meal:  This was not very appetizing.  The presentation seemed very nice, but looks were deceiving for this dish.  The chicken was utterly dry even for dark meat!  The side of fries were the best part of the meal, and they were soggy.   -Special of the night (red snapper): This wins the most disappointing dish of the night.  You would think the special of this night would be pretty good.  But this dish's fish was thin and rather small (not filling), and it was overcooked so much that it was not possible to finish.    -Braised short ribs: This was probably the most acceptable dish that we ordered, and it was still over cooked.    I don't know if this place recently got new ovens/stoves and do not know how to tame their cooking heat or it just their style of cooking? Well the wait staff was very friendly, and attentive.  Probably will not be back, but definitely check it out and decide for yourself if you like it! Enjoy!

My sister and I went to 5Church for dinner on a Friday in December. Got there at 6 and the restaurant was starting to fill up. Started with wine, which is always good. We ended up ordering a bunch of appetizers to share so we could get a taste of everything.   Wedge salad was good. Pork belly spring rolls were a favorite (wish they came with more than 4 little pieces). Jerk chicken lettuce wraps were average- not as much chicken as I would have preferred.  Shrimp flat bread had an interesting taste which we attributed to the boursin cheese. Flat bread was circular shaped (like a pizza) but the pieces were too thin and flimsy to hold and eat. Would have been better  if it was a square made flat bread and the crust a little more crispy. Carolina gold "hoppin' John" was just rice and it was plain.   Ordered a bottle of wine and the waiter corked it for us to-go at the end of the night. The only brown paper bag he had was a large to-go food bag so he wrapped our wine bottle in the bag and handed it to us (...very odd).  Decent food but for the price I would have expected more. Not going to rush back there any time soon.

We arrived around 2 on a Sunday. We were sat immediately outside. Unfortunately,  they no longer have bottomless mimosas or sangrias but both are $2.50. Our food was delicious and our server was very nice. No complaints!

My sister's birthday party was here last weekend and I had an ok time. The waiter was a little rude, but oooooonly slightly. The atmosphere and food itself was pretty good. We tried the chick pea salad and black bean hummus. The restaurant put a little card on the table for the birthday girl, which I realize is a nice thought; however, they left another card on the table for a different party (that I guess cancelled?). LOL. Their tables are a little far apart and it makes it difficult to have conversation, but it was not a huge deal. Anyway, overall it was an ok time.

Agree with others, food is decent and ambience makes the place. But that alone should not be the deciding factor for a 4-5. I had more than one experience with not so great smells from the kitchen (heavy bad fish smell) and emitting from the bathroom during my dinner. Really turned me off a couple times. But, this was during Restaurant week so maybe it factored into it. For the whole experience and only good food, I would say the most I can muster is a 3.

To be honest, the only thing that saved our experience here was the service.   She was a real treat.   Other than that, it smelled like fish when we walked in, and not in a good way.   The menu was tiny, not varied, and TOO expensive, especially the tiny portions.  To top it all off, the food was subpar.  However, the wine list and wines were good.

I came here for lunch with my mom on a Wednesday.  We were immediately seated.  The atmosphere is very cool and a definite conversation starter.  I may have felt some slight judgment when we asked for the wine list, but oh well, it was my day off!  My glass of chenin blanc (a new to me variety) was so delicious, I could have had a second glass!  We split the romaine salad with ceaser dressing, anchovies and olives.  This is THE BEST take on a ceaser salad I have ever had. Salty, lemony, so many elements that I love! We also shared the lamb burger which, I have to say while it's smaller than the Liberty's, I think it wins in the taste test contest.  Bursting with flavor in every bite.  I could have eaten the entire thing!    I can't wait to try 5Church for dinner.  A GREAT new addition to downtown.
The food was great! I really enjoyed the salmon, eggs and fries. My friends had the Belgian Waffles.  The ambiance is chill and will go back for date night!!

I went to 5church on a Friday night around 8.  I was pretty busy but our server arrived promptly and had a great attitude.  As many have said this place has a great trendy modern but classic feel to it.  Great for our girls night and great for a date night.   For the food each one of us ordered something different so we could sample each others food- salmon, trout, flounder, jerk chicken appetizer and greens.  All were very tasty.  The Trout was my favorite and that would be my entree if i were to return.  I had the jerk chichen appetizer as my main meal because i wasnt $25 dollars worth of hungry...but though it was good the portions for the appetizers are very small.  Not big enough to share with anyone.  The "bites" on the menu dont waste you time...its really a bite..like a spoonfull of something.  Save that money an buy a drink, which were also good and had a great balance of taste and alcohol.  Over all pretty good.  But bring your wallet and dont be super hungry.

Third time I have visited 5 Church.  Now that I know where they are, it helps. If that sounds stupid (they are at 5 Church, idiot), please note on the website and Google maps the address is Tryon street. Try going on a busy Friday or Saturday night and realize you have to circle the maze of one way streets to actually get in front of the restaurant. Very frustrating and a little puzzling that owners don't try to change their business listing to remedy this.  The place is beautiful - and they have beautiful people working there. I have always liked any server we have had, but find the bartenders dismissive and condescending. Yes, I know you are busy, but it is your job, right? Not making eye contact so I can get your attention to get a drink is not good bartending. It has been my experience every visit.  The food is avant-garde - love. Last time we got the tuna tartare small plate. The diced jicama was a great textural addition. Warning though, this is very very hot (spicy). Next time I will ask to dial back the scotch bonnet. The bread served with it however was a total miss. Would not hold up to the meat being place on it. Perhaps if it were toasted or a crisp bread, or even more of a cupped - type shape to drop the tuna into it would be more successful.  We got a few other small plates. Spicy is the name of the game here folks so order accordingly. All was well executed.  It's noisy here, but our table was small enough that we could hear each other talk just fine, even with the table next to us so close I could have eaten from their plates. :)
The music is loud, true.  But the food is amazing.  Try the Shrimp pizza, out of this world good.

I hate to give this place a low rating but I wasn't a fan.  We ate here a few months ago for our Valentine's Day dinner. I'd been wanting to try this place out for awhile & was really looking forward to our meal! Between my BF & I, we had 3 cocktails, 2 snacks, 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 1 side item. The bill was around $120 (not including the tip), which I thought would've been fair if the majority of food & drinks we had were actually good.  The 3 cocktails we ordered were the New-Fashioned, Viper, & the 5Church. Both the New-Fashioned & the 5Church sounded great on paper but were executed poorly. They were really watered down.. Gross. The New-Fashioned was supposed to be rimmed with nuts, which is already weird, but it's the NEW-Fashioned so just go with it, right? Mine was only halfway rimmed- sloppy presentation. The Viper, made up of Patron Silver, orange liqueur, lime juice, cucumber water, & cayenne pepper, was an interesting combination & surprisingly a really good one! It was refreshing with a little kick to it. So 1 out of 3 cocktails were acceptable. K  For our 2 snacks, BF got the Szechuan Pork Belly & I got the Black Bean Hummus. On the menu, it states that the Black Bean Hummus comes with grilled flat bread. Awesome, I love flat bread! Well, grilled flat bread my ass. I was expecting something pillowy & soft. What I got instead were extremely salty, nasty pita chips. Totally INEDIBLE. Whoever wrote the description on the menu obviously didn't know the difference between GRILLED & FRIED. Here's a tip 5Church: How about don't write something misleading on the menu next time? The hummus itself was pretty tasty so I ended up eating the hummus by itself. BF said the Pork Belly was pretty good, but kind of salty.  The 2 apps we ordered were the Truffled Shiitake Mushroom Pierogies and Artisan Cheese Selection. The pierogies were my favorite part of the meal. Buttery, crisp exterior and flavorful filling. AND NOT TOO SALTY. Perfect. The cheese plate consisted of 3 different types of cheeses, 2 types of fruit preserves, olive tapenade, and were served with crostini, sweet peppers, and olives. The cheeses were good, but I didn't really care for any of the accompaniments, besides the peppers and olives.  BF had the Scallop entree and I ordered the Crispy Marinated Tofu. The tofu comes with sauteed spinach, kimchi, and green beans. The tofu didn't taste like it was marinated. The only flavor I got from it was salt from the breading. The spinach and green beans were the best part of the entree. The kimchi was such a FAIL. Now, I know that being half Korean, I can't really get my hopes up about finding good kimchi anywhere, besides my mom's. I also know that the kimchi that was on my plate SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN SERVED. It was ridiculously salty, gingery, & dry?! .. Just disgusting and a sad, pathetic excuse for kimchi. I never do this, but I took one bite and immediately spit it back out. Only someone with busted taste buds would actually swallow something so revolting. BF's scallops were decent but he said they were a little heavy-handed with the salt as well.  Finally my side. I got the Creamy Mashed Potatoes because I love mashed potatoes! I thought it was a little pricey for a SIDE ($7) but changed my mind when I saw the HUGE serving of what I thought would be deliciousness. Well guess what, it was extremely salty. Big surprise, no? It wasn't as terrible as the kimchi, but I could only stand to eat a few bites of it.   There are a few redeeming qualities. Our server was on top of it for such a busy night. Our food & drinks came out in a timely manner and our waters never got less than halfway full. I also loved the whole ambiance of the restaurant. Dark, trendy atmosphere and they really paid attention to detail when decorating the place. It really looked like a great date spot. So, points for that.  If you like excessively salty foods, you will probably love this restaurant. If you're someone with normal taste buds, you have been warned. I might try this restaurant again one day but I'm definitely not in any rush.
Heard  all kinds of great things about the lamb burger and home made fries.  Did NOT disappoint. Wonderful experience

Made reservations for New Year's Eve dinner. Arrived and, unfortunately, there were people staying at tables longer than anticipated. 40 minutes later, we still didn't have a table. Staff were pleasant when we checked in to see if or table was ready but no one made a point to let us know anything. The atmosphere was very nice and the crowd had a nice vibe. If convenient, may make another attempt.  The owner/manager did reach out and offer apologies... which I can really appreciate.  Wife and I rarely make it uptown for meals and I would really love the opportunity to give this place an updated review.

We came here for brunch and it was super cute and trendy. When we were there a lot of people were celebrating their birthday so it seems really good for big groups and that kind of scene. They have really good (and cheap) mimosa and sangria deals, and the mimosas are actually good. The food looked good and to my surprise, tasted as good as it looks. To top it all off the service was great as well. I would definitely come back.

Time for an update - I really love this place.  I'm so glad it's been able to hold it down at the corner of Fifth and Church... even the name of the place is an ode to the trials and tribulations that restaurants and bars have had at that location.  5Church is one of my favorite places to grab lunch or happy hour in Charlotte.  Lunch is really great bc they understand the lunchtime mentality.  The servers are on-point and the kitchen delivers quality lunch in a timely fashion.  The lunch execution is near flawless.  Refills appear magically.  If you get a chance to try their filet burger special, please order it.  The jalape√±o aioli has a little kick that goes so well with the tasty patty.  Sesame seed bun - absolutely.  If you're a beet fan, the beet sliders are legit.  The only problem with those guys is that after a couple of small sliders, you'll be craving beets the rest of the afternoon.  BTW, beets - where have you been all my life???  Place is nice, ladies look gorgeous, and modern look is sweet.  They have an upstairs area for private dining - it worked well for a work function one other time.  There's a private bar there, but getting beer is a pain since they get it from below.  Nonetheless, cool atmosphere for a private dining event.  Looking forward to the next happy hour which I can hopefully roll right into a dinner experience there.  dmo out.

What, why doesn't 5Church have higher ratings here on Yelp?! Yes, the prices are higher than many CLT restaurants, but you get what you pay for. Plus, a place like this would be even more expensive in NYC, so, for us it was a steal. First off, the staff are totally lovely. Really a genuinely friendly and attentive group of people. As a customer, you feel valued and welcome. Interior is comfortable and clean with hip, quirky decor.  As for the food, we were very satisfied. 5Church is clearly using fresh, high end ingredients. The fish does not taste fishy, the lamb does not taste gamy, vegetables are served at their peak flavor/freshness.  I mentioned that yesterday was my birthday and the staff went out of their way to help me celebrate! We had a fantastic time at 5Church and would certainly visit again!!

Yum yum yum. A Charlotte restaurant week WIN!!! Most places skimp and this one did not. Service was impeccable and even cramped in the middle tables, we were delighted - food was delicious, fresh and came out better than our expectations. Seriously, that s'mores desert is what foodie dreams are made of..... My husband ordered a green olive Gorgonzola martini and said it was one of the best he's had - my roasted chicken (even with a bone) was beyond tasty.... Risotto was perfect and I can't wait to go back. We left and the place was jamming, so I think Charlotte has a new top-choice in uptown. We'll definitely be back!!!

One of the nicest places in Uptown that doesn't act like it's some exclusive place. They change the menu frequently so everything is fresh and the drink options are great. The atmosphere is unique and I enjoyed hosting a group function here last December.

I am solely basing my review from trying to receive information for an event I am planning. I have not eaten here, but since I can't even get feedback (i.e. call or email) to receive pricing, etc. then I definitely don't want to waste my money and time here. TOO BAD , TOO SAD, sure the event coordinator is just that busy they don't care. Or maybe , I should stop in and ask? I think not, time is precious and you disappoint me 5Church. 2 weeks now and nothing.  I personally had the event coordinator contact me to figure out how my inquiry was missed, and was given great details. This is a beautiful establishment so it will be nice to have an event here. Thank you

My family and I had dinner last night and we were disappointed about the food and service. Dishes flavourless. Our food came before our drinks. The busboy stole my plates before I was done eating. So I don't recommend to eat here at least during restaurant week.
The food was good it just needed some seasoning. The brunch bread was really tasty and the mimosas were good but tbh the price doesn't match the quality of the food. Service was nice!

I tried this place when it was brand new. The food was awesome. We did the chefs tasting menu which was very good. Large wine list. Open and loud atmosphere. Didn't bug me. Staff was friendly and efficient.

Trendy/ritzy little place! I was impressed with the attention to detail in the decor. Large wine list and I've heard their cocktails are really good too. We called ahead and put our name in and they said they were on a 30 min wait. By the time we got to the restaurant, they were ready for us and we were seated right away.   We ordered the calamari for an appetizer, and our server recommended the pork belly spring rolls. I thought the calamari was a decent size (sharable between 5 people with another appetizer), but there were only 4 spring rolls so I'm confused on why our server recommended them to our group of 5 people. Neither of the appetizers were especially good or memorable to me.   For my entree, I had the petite filet with bomb.com mashed potatoes, and the Gorgonzola sauce. My date had the crab cakes. Our friends had the scallops, bolognese, and the 60 sec. steak. My steak was great, but I think it was more medium rare than medium (I ordered medium). I don't like sending anything back and I don't mind medium rare either so I happily had my steak. The Gorgonzola sauce is not your typical steak sauce but I really enjoyed it.   We also ordered three desserts: the coconut lime mousse, espresso mouse, and red velvet cake. The table overall enjoyed the red velvet cake the most, but I was obsessed with the espresso mousse!! So good... Our server was great but not anything memorable through the entire meal. I had a very nice night out with friends with some good food!

Atmosphere was nice. However, the steak was a joke. I ordered the seared steak which might as well been a TV dinner piece of Salisbury steak. If the steak was a 1/2" thick that would be a stretch. Also, the steak was about 4 "s long. Next, there wasn't a seared mark on the steak. To top it off, the plate came with my steak and spinach and zero presentation. It looked like a serving from a school cafeteria. To think they wanted over $30 for this. Do yourself a favor and have drinks and go it somewhere else to eat. It was an embarrassment to take 7 colleagues there.
Had a perfect wedding reception at 5Church! The service, food and ambiance were all amazing. Special shoutout to Alexa for making out wedding reception great!

Alright Church-goers, there's been some changes. Bottom line, I still like it. And I see many reviews about the new menus and prices already.   The ten dollar lunch menu was the best. Now the lunch menus don't come with a free drink. And they all have different price. The smoked turkey sandwich for example,  got bigger and less greasy. The fries are less salty too. So it might better suit some people. I liked it too. But I would say I liked the old deal better.  The service still rocks. Genna (?) was awesome. We were wondering if it was in Fourth ward. She wasn't sure so she looked it up and came back with an answer even though we said nevermind.  I'll still go for lunch every week.

Good food and upbeat crowd made for a fun evening. Very interesting decor(check out the ceiling,a complete copy of "The Art of War".  We had fish, my swordfish (the special with heavy dumplings) was a little dry, but my husbands trout was delicious. I'd definitely give them another try!

My initial thought after visiting 5Church is that it is a very nice restaurant in Uptown Charlotte.  The menu offerings are creative, the specialty cocktails and wine list are decently priced and very modern, and the ambiance of the restaurant is unique and trendy.    We were with a larger group so we all were able to try a variety of appetizers and dishes.  The crab cakes and bacon pizza were delicious, however the gnocchi was a little weird and had some sort of indistinguishable meat thrown in as a "Chef's Choice"...which we all know means whatever they had left over from the night before.   The tomato soup was very very salty but the black bean was delicious.  The gin fizz cocktail is very interesting, however the spirit and wine selection was plentiful and had something for everyone.  For our entrees, I had the duck breast.  It was well cooked, mildly seasoned, and everything you would expect for a nice duck breast...nothing more and nothing less.  I also was able to try the lamb burger which was good.  A friend of mine ordered the Kobe flatiron steak and we were all surprised after tasting how poor quality the cut of meat was.  Kobe beef is supposed to be one of the best cuts of steak you can find...and the one he received for his entrees was about as a chewy as a stick of Trident gum.   The server was very accommodating and brought out the 60 second strip steak.  For the rare steak lovers, I highly recommend ordering this if you ever stop by 5Church. It is one of the most unique preparations of steak I've ever tried.  Heavily seasoned and seared on one side while being almost completely rare on the other.  It was an excellent cut of steak and definitely the signature dish of 5Church.   Overall, 5Church was a pleasant dining experience with a unique atmosphere and friendly staff.  It was not particularly memorable but had solid menu choices if you happen to stop by.  I wouldn't recommend it as a top place to visit while you are in the area considering the price points and other surrounding restaurants.

Fabulous atmosphere - very fun and funky. Food is great (chickpea salad is yummy!). Our service left a little to be desired. The waitress was a little absent-minded. Would I go again? Hell yea, but I'd look for a different server.

Hands down my favorite restaurant uptown. Rather going for brunch or dinner it's never a let down. For dinner the mouth watering filet is an excellent choice. They have the best selection of cocktails around. My personal favorite was the Ready Orgreat, it's a must try!

Finally a restaurant worth it in Charlotte! From the food, decor to service, everything is great! I've only been there for dinner and brunch, but they have recently opened for lunch, which I cannot wait to try! Dinner has always been great, the duck and the smoked and roasted salmon are some of the best dishes! The sangria at brunch is also great, can't beat the $15 endless sangria! Definitely one of my new favorite places in Charlotte, and it takes a lot to impress me!

Run don't walk for the Lamb Burger! I'm told it's on all 4 of their menus and it was delicious!  Only 3 stars because my husband was not so thrilled with his steak dinner. The pork belly fried rolls were good, the cheese plate did not impress.

Great restaurant with a unique vibe. We went here for a date night and were thrilled with the service, food and even the drink specials. The food was delicious, our favorite being the Ahi Tuna Poke. My only caveat with 5Church is the seating arrangements. If you do not request a seat either off to the side or in a quiet area you are thrown by the front door or in the middle of a very loud space. Wanting to go here for a romantic dinner this was unfortunate but we have learned and next time ask for the appropriate seat ahead of time. Although this place is very trendy I would highly suggest not bringing the entire family. It is not the most child friendly environment with the large bar and upscale clientele.
Friendly waitstaff, although all the tattos really give the place a sort of vibe that i was not expecting. Definitely overpriced, but if you're looking for divorcees..this is the place!

I came here for a drink and some appetizers one night.  The drink was good, but a little pricey, ok everything is a little pricey-but I guess you pay for the area.  The appetizers were tasty and satisfying.    The hostess was ok, not overly friendly.  The bar staff was nice.  The restaurant is beautiful inside.  It is a very open space, and trendy atmosphere.  I went during the week and so it wasn't overly crowded.    I would come back to try dinner sometime.

Great atmosphere. We have been here a few time for drinks. Always a fun environment, but this was our first time eating there. We got the cheese board and ahi tuna for starters. Great dishes and excellent cheese selections. Most of us got the duck at the table which was very good. One friend got the octopus  and said it was the best cooked she has had, but very spicy and no indication on the menu that it was spicy. Only issue I had were the cocktails. The service was excellent, but the cocktails had too much ice and very little liquid. Overall very good experience.

I have to say, I am sad to even write this, as I used to enjoy this restaurant. However during my past two trips here, I have been thoroughly disappointed.   Most recently was at brunch this past weekend. We were sat a little after 12:30, and did not receive our food until 2pm. Our drinks at the table were empty and our waitress was scarce. When our food came, no one had a "hot" meal, and there was no check in on how we were doing after our meals arrived. After our meals arrived, we ordered other drinks and they weren't delivered until we had finished our plates.   I'd like to say that it was just our table, but you could see there were other tables there just as long, and just as impatiently waiting for everything.  However there were also tables receiving their food quickly and had attentive service. At best, the service just seemed spotty throughout the restaurant.   I'm sad to say that my group has taken 5Church off the list.

Love the one in Charleston and the original isn't bad either. Friendly, attentive staff and food was delicious. Crab cakes and eggs as well as corned beef and root vegetables were both fantastic. No booze until noon was a bit of a surprise but still a nice brunch spot!

This is a beautiful restaurant, with really unique d√©cor.  I loved the ceiling!  The server we had (I believe his name was Hack) was awesome.  He was knowledgeable and attentive.  He was also very respectful and professional, which I cannot say about the other servers.  For example, I had to use the restroom during the meal, so I excused myself.  On the way to the restroom, at least 3 different servers walked in front of my path, not giving me the right-of-way.  Then on the way back, another 2 servers (one of the same ones as before) did the exact same thing.  I am not talking about needing my path cleared completely, but rather, they stepped in front of me, knowing that I was walking with them.  I know this sounds petty, but the fact that 4 different servers did this makes me feel that professionalism and customer service are not a priority at this restaurant.  For the food, I had the bistro steak.  It was cooked perfectly, but not seasoned the greatest.  The mashed potatoes were dry and lacking flavor - certainly nothing special.  The b√©arnaise sauce sat for too long and was too cold.  My wife asked for a peppercorn sauce to accompany her steak, knowing that it was off-menu, she didn't have any expectations.  However, what she received was just another sauce off of their menu, which was basically Worcestershire and ketchup - tasted fine, just nothing special and certainly not peppercorn.  She did not receive an explanation that they couldn't make another sauce.  Overall, this place is just OK.  It has it's highs and lows.  It was overpriced for what you received - definitely a place that is trying to be more than it apparently has the ability to do.  I really wanted to like this place, and I think the ratings the restaurant has received (about 3.5 stars) is about where it should be, if not a little lower, which is why I ranked it a 3.  I do not plan on going back to this restaurant.
Delicious. Fast, informed, friendly service. Cool, energetic space that wasn't too loud. Great location.
We were in Charlotte to have dinner with friends.  Good location great drink selection broad selection of appetizers and entrees.  Gets busy quick on Saturday eve.

I've heard some decent things about 5Church's food but have heard awful things about their service. We decided to pop in here on St. Patrick's day as it seemed to be the only place without an exhaustingly long line. However upon getting inside, realized the bar was grossly understaffed and was getting orders incorrect left and right. I ordered 5 Irish car bombs and was informed that they were OUT OF GUINNESS. I've never heard of a bar running out of Guinness on St Patrick's day but the bartender told me he could substitute a local porter instead. I was charged for 5 "seasonal draft beers" and Jameson shots which last I checked was NOT an Irish car bomb. As a result my tab was $60! I was expecting to pay slightly more than usual on this day but we later found out that every other bar was doing $7-8 Irish car bombs so it was a complete waste of my money. This review is due to the lack of transparency in pricing and completely terrible service for drinks (I can't speak for the food quality). Obviously will never return to 5Church again.

I think I may have eaten too much which may have led to this rating, I would probably give 5Church around 3.5 stars  The night started off pretty well, we got a call around 5:00 PM to confirm our 7:00 PM reservation. One problem, they failed to mention that there was no valet parking that night so we left our house with the plan of arriving right around 6:55 PM. When there were shut down streets in downtown Charlotte and no valet person in sight, it made for a bad start to the evening.   Once we parked and got inside, the ambiance in there is excellent, definitely feels hip with nice wall murals and the Art of War written on the ceiling. The food overall was good, but not great and I felt our bill was a little high for what we ended up eating. We were at Soul Gastrolounge last weekend which I felt was a MUCH better value for the amount of food you get.  Appetizers Pork Belly - AWESOME, small portion, but just enough to wet your appetite Beet Sliders - Also well done, wouldn't have expected them to be good, but quite surprised Jerk Chicken Lettuce Warps - Also very very good Perogies - Not my favorite, was expecting better based on past reviews, but I felt these were disappointing.  Entree 60 second NY steak -unique flavor, texture that change throughout the cut. Never had anything quite like it before and would recommend it if you are a fan of NY steak. Be warned, most parts are VERY rare, but it is juicy and flavorful  Dessert Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake - was expecting better based on waiter recommendation, i would say it is slightly above average  Overall, 5Church is worth visiting once, but I don't think I will go back given the limited number of date nights that my wife and I can take with 2 kids. GIven the chance, we would go back to Soul Gastrolounge in a heartbeat before 5Church!

My family went for Mothers Day Brunch. Everything was exceptional. We were greeted at the door with a very pleasant hostes. Our server was great and the buffet was always stocked with fresh seafood. Everything was hot or cold depending on the food. Best part... although it was packed you could carry on a conversation. Whatever your doing Nick...keep it up. We will be back.

went here to grab drinks and small plates with friends  i got the tomato salad which came with a crostini with an olive spread- good! also got the black bean hummus which came with yummy chips  good service and good ambiance! would go again to grab drinks

Our waitress did not pay attention to us for the first 15 minutes we were there, and rarely came to check on us afterward. Then, we had to ask her to take our order since she kept walking past us and ignoring us. Our water glasses had lipstick on them from the previous party. One of the members of our party ordered a Bloody Mary when we first arrived and it didn't come to the table until after the food was delivered, and after we had to remind the waitress about the drink. (And it was an awful Bloody Mary). We ordered 3 coffees that were in small cups that you could finish after 3 sips, no refills, and $5 each...for a black coffee. I could have ordered a large specialized drink from Starbucks for that price. Our food and coffee were both luke warm by the time it got to our table. All in all, we were not happy with our experience, would not suggest others to eat here, and would not try this restaurant again.   But the restaurant was clean, so I'll give it 2 stars.

I came here with coworkers for lunch. I ordered the Reuben with fries and it was delicious. This was my first visit but others had been here before and they were not satisfied with the pasta of the day and a salad with chicken.   I had heard great things about this place for dinner so I look forward to coming back and trying the dinner menu.

My current favorite lunch spot uptown. The lamb burger was amazing, the new $10 lunch specials are excellent and their fries are the best in town.   The decor can best be described as funky. Graffitti'd ceiling, angel wing lamps over the bar, cool art. I've yet to check out the dinner scene and from what I've heard, scene is an appropriate term. I've stuck to lunch and have been consistently happy.  Their sandwiches are nicely constructed, tasty, buttery and good. My friend and I split the grilled prosciutto/mozzarella sandwich and the smoked turkey sandwich. Neither of us would give up the other half of our sandwich without protest. And the fries. Yum. Crispy, salty, flavorful and as good as a fry gets.   The service was prompt and efficient, it's a place worth going back.  We plan to keep going back.

Went to this restaurant last night for our anniversary dinner expecting great things due to some wonderful reviews and friends recommendations.  Service was excellent! Many many servers and assistants constantly flowing around the area.   Ambiance  was really cool. Loved the feather lampshades over the bar, very interesting light fixtures through out the restaurant, and the overall feel was very clubby. It was far too loud in the lower level where we were seated, but perhaps the upstairs area would be different? If we return, I will have to ask to be seated there. I had to ask the waitress to repeat herself many times because to the noise level, and I have great hearing!  Wonderful people watching.   The food was only ok.   The bread basket included two pieces of warm bread. I appreciated warmed bread. The butter was soft but whipped and not salted. I prefer salted.  It was a restaurant week, and I liked the options listed so ordered one of their pre-selected three course combinations. I started off with  the black bean hummus which was very salty with fried wonton strips. Blah. Next was the wasabi crusted salmon and I exchanged the side accompaniments for the mashed potatoes and glazed vegetables. The presentation was nice, but very few vegetables were on the plate (2 pieces of broccoli). The mashed potatoes with gravy were delicious and the best part of the entire meal.   I really liked the fact they offered a 3 course wine pairing and it was very reasonably priced at on $15.  I only wanted one glass for the meal so I ordered the recommended pinot noir and it was excellent.  Hubby ordered a bunch of different "first courses" and "snacks."  He started with the warm tomato soup which had a lovely presentation with a toasted cheese crouton laying across the top of the bowl. It was served straight on the table, no plate under the bowl. Hmmmm.  His verdict, bland. He ordered the truffled mushroom pierogies (fried & tasty!), the tiny beet slider (we definitely prefer 131 Main's beet slider), crisp pork belly,  and jerk chicken lettuce wraps. It was fun having all these appetizer size dishes show up and tasty and nibble the different flavors. Nothing was outstanding though.  The restaurant week menu included a dessert and I ordered the s'mores option. It was terrible. The server offered to box up the dessert, so she did notice that I did not eat more than 2 bites. When I said "no thanks," she did not investigate  why I didn't eat it. Hubby thought it was pretty awful too.  The server took our valet parking receipt out and the car was waiting for us when we walked out.  This was wonderful.  Service is excellent, food is poor.  No plans to return.
Love this place! Every time I am there the food is amazing and the staff is friendly. The atmosphere is great and don't think dinner is the only thing as Sunday brunch is to die for!

We stopped in here for drinks and appetizers one evening when in Charlotte for a wedding. The interior is really beautiful, very well decorated. We bellied up to the bar and asked the bartender what would be quick food wise and ordered a couple drinks. The bartender seemed harried and gave us a couple suggestions.  We ordered the black bean hummus, yuck, it's really bad. I think we didn't look at the description clearly, we just saw hummus so we ordered it. Hummus shouldn't be made from black beans. Very bland, we didn't eat it, to their credit they took it off our bill.   I had a wedge salad, which was fine, the lettuce was crisp, flavors tasty.   We had to catch our server multiple times to ask for silverware, napkins etc. I think they were just generally overwhelmed but I don't think I would go back.

Great service and nice atmosphere but the food is major lacking in flavor. My salad was so heavily dressed with balsamic drizzle that it overpowered the rest of the salad. My short-ribs were falling off the bone but had very little flavor, I just couldn't finish it, and I  rarely don't finish a meal.  UPDATE: I got a nasty message on yelp from an employee. Please don't patronize this restaurant. I now changed my star rating.

Visited 5 Church for the first time with friends after Googling then Yelping for a spot that made artisan style cocktails with egg yolks. Yes I said egg yolks! . I like to think of myself as a Whiskey  connoisseur and having just moved from NYC I've had it tons of ways and with an egg yolk was my favorite. This adds a smooth element that sits well with my palette so I recommend anyone who loves whiskey (Makers is my fav) to try it.  Ok back to 5 Church! So I asked if they could make an herbal infused Whiskey with an egg yolk. They didn't have all the ingredients that I needed so we went with what they had. The cocktail was over powered by this liquid cilantro and rosemary I believe. They get an "E" for effort.   Because we were there to drink so gave them a second chance and ordered a Makers on the rocks with an egg yolk which then tasted like dish water or what I assume it would taste like lol.  Anyway, the Maine Lobster appetizer was great and my friend ordered a Gin Gimlet that was amazing. So to sum this up, crafted drinks bad and basic cocktails good lol.  I'll come back to try their brunch.

Came here for dinner on a Friday night, the place was crowded but we had already made reservation by calling beforehand. The table was not ready when we got there so we had to wait for another 10 -15 minutes but I didn't mind because the waiting couch is very comfortable and it was raining outside. You can also order drinks while you are waiting.  To start with, I got a glass of wine, which I was able to sample before getting the full glass. My friend got the bourbon drink, which was delicious- great raspberry flavor but I could barely taste the alcohol. The New-Fashion drink was interesting- rim of the glass was coated with nuts and the alcohol content was good. I recommend trying it if you are a bourbon fan.   For the appetizer, we got the cheese plate ($16). It was delicious and good portion size for two people. We tried sharing between 4 of us and it wasn't enough.   For the entr√©e, I got the lamb burger ($14), one of the best ones I have had. It comes with a side of fries. The burger might not look enough at first sight but it will fill you up before you know it. My friend got the steak but according to her, the sauce it came with tasted like a BBQ sauce and it wasn't the best.  It's a good place for a date night or a fancy dinner with friends. It's a bit expensive because you are paying for the decor and the ambience. For me, it's a one-time place.

Honestly the best restaurant I've had in Charlotte. The atmosphere reminds me of a night out in Manhattan and the cocktails were great. We ordered the filet and it was also amazing. Also try the pesto flatbread. We loved the app so much we ordered 2.

First and probably last time I'll probably go here. We came for lunch on Valentine's Day and we were super disappointed.  Honesty the food wasn't bad, not memorable, but not bad. I had the lamb burger and my husband had the polenta and shrimp, their play on shrimp and grits I guess.  Let's start with service, it blew. I basically felt we were forgotten. I think because we don't drink and just wanted water the waitress was annoyed. Everybody else got banana bread to start and we just sat with nothing. She eventually gave us the banana bread when we were done with our meal. We had to send the shrimp and polenta back because it was cold, probably cause it took 30 minutes after we ordered to get our food. It was just overall a disappointment especially since we were excited to go.

This place is designed to the nines ... or designed within an inch of its life.
